talents_data.description: Compilation of Talents for Star Wars SAGA Edition.

talents_list.name: Accurate Blow
talents_list.description: if exceed Ref Def by 5 or more deal +1 die dam, per melee group

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose one exotic melee weapon or one of the following weapon groups in which you are proficient: advanced melee weapons, lightsabers, or simple weapons. When you make a melee attack with a weapon from the chosen group and the attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, you deal +1 die of damage with the attack.

talents_list.name: Acrobatic Recovery
talents_list.description: DC 20 Acrobatics to not fall prone

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If an effect causes you to fall prone, you can make a DC 20 Acrobatics check to remain on your feet. [[Weak talent option: Add "additionally, whenever an effect causes you to be moved a number of squares, you may roll a DC 15 Acrobatics check to reduce the movement by one square. For every five points you beat this DC by, you may reduce the movement by another square.]]

talents_list.name: Action Exchange
talents_list.description: when you use Force Delay, grant 1 ally in 6sq & LOS to trade a move action for a stan action
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use Force Delay, you grant one ally within six squares and line of sight the ability to trade a move action for another standard action on his next turn.

talents_list.name: Acute Senses
talents_list.description: reroll Perception
talents_list.full_text_description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. (SotG) This talent applies to Use Computer checks made to perceive enemy ships (see Starship Skills, SotG page 18).

talents_list.name: Adapt and Survive
talents_list.description: when an enemy in 24sq & LOS gains morale or insight bonus, you gain it too until your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an enemy within 24 squares of you and in your line of sight receives a morale or insight bonus of any kind, you also gain the benefits of that bonus until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Adept Assistant
talents_list.description: with aid another on a Mechanics, Pilot or Use Computer add +5 not +2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully aid another character on a Mechanics, Pilot, or Use Computer check, you add +5 to the check result (rather than the normal +2).

talents_list.name: Adept Negotiator
talents_list.description: Persuasion check v. Will Def (+5 bonus if opp higher level), moves -1 CT, if at end, cannot attack unless attacked or allies attacked
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can weaken the resolve of one enemy with your words. The target must have an Intelligence of 3 or higher, and it must be able to see, hear, and understand you. Make a Persuasion check; if the result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, it moves -1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). The target gets a +5 bonus to its Will Defense if it is higher level than you. If the target reaches the end of the track, it does not fall unconscious; instead, it cannot attack you or your allies for the remainder of the encounter unless you or one of your allies attacks it or one of its allies first. This is a mind-affecting effect. [Despite the restriction of the Persuasion skill (cannot retry on same target if fail for 24h), there is no limit to the number of times you can use this on a single target.] (SotG) You affect the condition track of a specific character (usually the vehicle's commander), not a starship. [[Under the Perception skill, there is a section on Sense Influence. It’s a DC 20 Perception check to notice if someone is being affected by a mind-affecting force power or other method of coercion. Therefore, I would allow a perceptive NPC to make a Perception check to notice if he (or his friend) is being manipulated. A success would alert the NPC that something is not right. He may even start suspecting the jedi PC.]]

talents_list.name: Adept Spellcaster
talents_list.description: reroll any force power as a full-round action
talents_list.full_text_description: You may use any Force power that normally requires a swift action, move action, or standard action as a full-round action instead. If you choose to do so, you may reroll your Use the Force check to activate that power, but you must accept the result of the reroll, even if it is worse (must take re-roll).

talents_list.name: Adrenaline Implant
talents_list.description: 1/encounter adjacent ally gains 10 hp at start of each of its turns (do not accumulate) (at end of encounter target moves -3 CT & needs rest or surgery)
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a standard action, you can give one adjacent living creature an adrenaline implant. The target must be willing to receive this implant, which grants the target 10 bonus hit points at the start of each of its turns. These bonus hit points do not accumulate. Damage is subtracted from the bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points from different sources do not stack.

talents_list.name: Advanced Intel
talents_list.description: if not surprised can use Spotter even in surprise round

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are not surprised at the beginning of combat, you can use the Spotter talent as a free action on your first turn, including during the surprise round.

talents_list.name: Advanced Planning
talents_list.description: Before combat, choose willing one ally in LOS, swap initiative results

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you roll Initiative for combat, choose one willing ally within your line of sight. You and that ally swap Initiative results.

talents_list.name: Advantageous Opening
talents_list.description: when ally or opponent in LOS rolls nat 1 on atk, make atk against single target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an enemy or ally in your line of sight rolls a natural 1 on an attack roll, you can make a melee or ranged attack against a single target within range.

talents_list.name: Advantageous Positioning
talents_list.description: opponent you're flanking is considered flat-footed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any opponent that you are flanking is considered flat-footed and is denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense against you.

talents_list.name: Advantageous Strike
talents_list.description: +5 Atk  with Atk of Opp with melee

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take advantage of your opponent's haste. You gain a +5 bonus on attacks of opportunity with melee weapons you are proficient with.

talents_list.name: Adversary Lore
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will Def in 12 sq & LOS for target -2 Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can peer into the Force and search for weaknesses in the defenses of your enemies. Make a Use the Force check against the Will Defense of a target creature within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. If the skill check equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, that target takes a -2 penalty to Reflex Defense against you and all allies who can hear and understand you until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Affliction
talents_list.description: when you damage an opponent with a Force power, opponent takes +2d6 dam at start of next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your Force power carries the taint of the dark side more so than even other dark side users. When you damage a single opponent with one of your Force powers, that target also takes 2d6 points of Force damage at the beginning of its next turn, before taking any actions.

talents_list.name: Aggressive Negotiator
talents_list.description: when you damage an opponent with lightsaber, can take 10 on Persuasion checks
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you damage an opponent with a lightsaber attack, you can take 10 on any Persuasion checks you make before the end of your next turn, even if you would not normally be able to.

talents_list.name: Aggressive Surge
talents_list.description: 1/enc make a free charge when you take a Second Wind
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter when you catch a second wind, you can make a charge attack as a free action, provided that you can make a charge attack against a legal target at the time you catch a second wind.

talents_list.name: Akk Dog Attack Training
talents_list.description: your akk dog follower gains Powerful Charge feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your akk dog follower gains the Powerful Charge feat.

talents_list.name: Akk Dog Master
talents_list.description: gain 1 akk dog follower w/Power Attack feat, your force powers can target akk dog (one toward max)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain an akk dog follower. Choose either the aggressive, defensive, or utility follower template, and generate the akk dog follower's statistics using the rules on CW page 32. This follower gains the akk dog species traits (see the "Akk Dog Followers" sidebar) and the Power Attack feat. Additionally, any Force power you activate that targets you can target your akk dog follower instead, at your discretion. An akk dog counts toward the total number of followers you have, just like followers gained from other talents.

talents_list.name: Akk Dog Trainer's Actions
talents_list.description: if you atk: if akk dog adjacent to target dam = d6+Str mod & part of your atk for DR, akk dog can charge (both -5 atk & replaces charge mod), if you hit akk dog +2 next atk v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You and your akk dog have bonded through the Force and can fight in concert. You can use any of the following actions on your turn. •Attack in Concert: As a standard action, you can make a melee or ranged attack against a target in range. If your akk dog follower is adjacent to the target and your attack hits, the target also takes piercing damage equal to 1d6 + the akk dog's Strength modifier. This additional damage is considered part of your attack for the purposes of resolving damage, DR, SR, and overcoming damage threshold. •Fall Upon Prey: As a standard action, you can make a melee or ranged attack against a target in range, and your akk dog can take the charge action against a target within its range. However, both you and your akk dog take a -5 penalty on your attack rolls (this replaces the bonus to attack rolls granted by the charge action). •Paired Maul: As a standard action, you can make a melee or ranged attack against a target in range. If the attack hits, your akk dog follower gains a +2 competence bonus on its next attack roll against that target.

talents_list.name: Always Ready
talents_list.description: when a readied action is triggered Initiative does not change

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are accustomed to operating in response to enemy actions. When your readied action is triggered, it does not change your initiative count (see page 162 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Ambush
talents_list.description: if you hit an opponent that has not yet acted, add +2 dice dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully hit an opponent that has not yet acted in combat, you deal +2 dice of damage with the attack.

talents_list.name: Ambush
talents_list.description: if not surprised give up stan for nonsurprised allies in LOS extra move or can reroll Init & take better
talents_list.full_text_description: During a surprise round, before combat begins, if you are not surprised you can give up your standard action to allow all nonsurprised allies within your line of sight to take an extra move action during the surprise round. Allies can spend this move action to instead reroll their Initiative check and take the better result as a free action before combat begins.

talents_list.name: Ambush Specialist
talents_list.description: if not surprised you can treat first round of combat as surprise round to activate talents etc. In surprise round designate one enemy as prime target & +2 atk until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are not surprised on the first round of combat in an encounter, you can treat the first round of combat as if it were the surprise round for the purposes of talents and feats that trigger only during the surprise round. Additionally, during the surprise round as a free action you can designate that target as your prime target. You gain a +2 morale bonus to attack rolls against your prime target until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Anticipate Movement
talents_list.description: 1/rnd as reaction to enemy in LOS moving, grant 1 ally in LOS to move their spd as free
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round, as a reaction to an enemy in your line of sight moving, you can enable one ally within your line of sight to move up to his or her speed as a free action.

talents_list.name: Apprentice Boon
talents_list.description: add your Force Point result to an ally w/in 12 sq with a Use the Force modifier lower than yours

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an ally within 12 squares with a lower Use the Force skill bonus than you makes a Use the Force check, you can spend a Force Point as a reaction to add to that Use the Force check. Use your level to determine how many dice to roll for the Force Point.

talents_list.name: Armor Mastery
talents_list.description: Ref Def bonus = HL + 1/2 armor bonus or armor bonus, counts as Armored & Improved Armored Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When calculating your Reflex Defense, you may add your heroic level plus one-half your armor bonus (rounded down) or your armor bonus, whichever is higher. You must be proficient with the armor you are wearing to gain this benefit. This talent counts as both the Armored Defense and Improved Armored Defense talents for the purposes of prerequisites.

talents_list.name: Armor Mastery
talents_list.description: max Dex bonus is +1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The maximum Dexterity bonus of your armor improves by +1. You must be proficient with the armor you are wearing to gain this benefit.

talents_list.name: Armored Augmentation I
talents_list.description: 1/encounter add armor bonus to Ref Def to thresh until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you may spend a Force Point as a swift action to augment your own ability to withstand damage by imbuing the armor you are wearing with the Force. This allows you to add your armor bonus to Reflex Defense to your damage threshold until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Armored Augmentation II
talents_list.description: also gain DR = 2 x armor's equipment bonus to Fort Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the Armored Augmentation I talent, you also gain DR equal to 2 x your armor’s equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense.

talents_list.name: Armored Defense
talents_list.description: Ref Def bonus = either heroic level or armor bonus

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When calculating your Reflex Defense, you may add either your heroic level or your armor bonus, whichever is higher. You must be proficient with the armor you are wearing to gain this benefit.

talents_list.name: Armored Guard
talents_list.description: when you use Ward add one-half your armor bonuses to ally's Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Ward talent (see below), your ally’s cover bonus to Reflex Defense is increased by one-half the armor bonus of any natural armor you possess as well as any armor you are wearing.

talents_list.name: Armored Mandalorian
talents_list.description: add armor's Fort Def to Elite Trooper DR, if lightsaber does not ignore DR it doesn't ignore your DR

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Mandalorians wear armor constantly and learn to adjust to take an impact on the strongest section of their armor. You add your armor's Fortitude Defense bonus as an equipment bonus to your elite trooper damage reduction (with a maximum bonus equal to your base elite trooper DR). Additionally, if a lightsaber does not ignore the DR of the armor you are wearing (such as cortosis weave/phrik alloy armor), a lightsaber does not ignore your damage reduction.

talents_list.name: Armored Spacer
talents_list.description: treat as AP (heavy)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use armored spacesuits as if you had the Armor Proficiency (heavy) feat.

talents_list.name: Arrogant Bluster
talents_list.description: Persuasion to change enemy's attitude for -5 enemy's Will Def until next turn, FP for end of enc

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take on an air of arrogance, allowing you to distract and sway others with your apparent knowledge and experience. When you make a successful Persuasion check to change an enemy’s attitude, the enemy takes a -5 penalty to its Will Defense until the end of your next turn. If you spend a Force Point, the duration is extended to the end of the encounter. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Art of Concealment
talents_list.description: Stealth to conceal items on person can take 10 even if rushed, can conceal as a swif

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Some smugglers are adept at hiding contraband and weapons, even on their person. When making a Stealth check to conceal an item, you can take 10 even under pressure. Additionally, you can conceal an item as a swift action.

talents_list.name: Assault Gambit
talents_list.description: 1/turn designate 1 ally & 1 target with LOE, they roll Initiative & winner makes free atk against other
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a standard action, you can designate one ally and one enemy that have line of effect to each other. The ally and the enemy make opposed Initiative checks, and the winner can make a single immediate melee or ranged attack against the loser. No character can benefit from this talent more than once per round.

talents_list.name: Assault Tactics
talents_list.description: DC15 Tactics, designate single object or creature, allies that can hear you, +d6 dam until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you may designate a single creature or object as the target of an assault. If you succeed on a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check, you and all allies able to hear and understand you deal +1d6 points of damage to the target with each successful melee or ranged attack, until the start of your next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Assured Skill
talents_list.description: Lose competence bonuses on 1 skill to roll 2 dice keep better

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you select this talent, choose one skill . Whenever you roll a skill check with that skill, you can choose to lose any competence bonuses to that skill check and instead roll 2 dice, keeping either result. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different skill to gain the benefits of this talent.

talents_list.name: At Peace
talents_list.description: +2 all Def until end of encounter or until you attack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to gain a +2 Force bonus to all defenses until the end of the encounter or until you attack, whichever comes first.

talents_list.name: Ataru
talents_list.description: may add Dex mod on damage or double Dex bonus if two-handed instead of Str

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may add your Dexterity bonus (instead of your Strength bonus) on damage rolls when wielding a lightsaber. When you wield a lightsaber two-handed, you may apply double your Dexterity bonus (instead of double your Strength bonus) to the damage.

talents_list.name: Attract Minion
talents_list.description: attracts nonheroic character 3/4 your level, multiple

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You attract a loyal minion. The minion is a nonheroic character (see SECR page 277) with a class level equal to three-quarters of your character level, rounded down. You may select this talent multiple times; each time you select this talent, you gain another minion. Normally, you can have only one minion with you at a time. Any other minions you have are assumed to be looking after your various interests. If you lose a minion, you can send for another minion if you have one (although normal travel time still applies). Each minion that accompanies you on an adventure is entitled to an equal share of the total experience points earned for the adventure. For example, a minion that accompanies a party of five heroes on an adventure receives one-sixth of the XP that the group earns. [Should your minion die, you must spend a talent to get a new one.]

talents_list.name: Attract Privateer
talents_list.description: attracts nonheroic character 3/4 your level, multiple

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You attract a loyal privateer lieutenant. The privateer is a nonheroic character who has a class level equal to three-quarters of your character level, rounded down. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you gain another privateer. Each privateer who accompanies you on an adventure is entitled to an equal share of the total experience points earned for the adventure. For example, a privateer who accompanies a party of five heroes on an adventure receives one-sixth of the XP that the group earns.

talents_list.name: Attract Superior Minion
talents_list.description: Attract Minion with NH level = to your character level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You attract a particularly skilled and powerful minion. The minion is a nonheroic character with a class level equal to your character level. This talent otherwise functions as the Attract Minion talent.

talents_list.name: Attune Armor
talents_list.description: armor bonus +2, Dex bonus improves +1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you may spend a Force Point to attune a suit of armor to the Force, permanently increasing its armor bonus by +2. In addition, the maximum Dexterity bonus of the attuned armor permanently improves by +1. Only you can benefit from wearing the attuned armor; the benefits do not apply if someone else dons the armor.

talents_list.name: Attune Weapon
talents_list.description: +1 Atk with melee weapon

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may spend a Force Point to attune a melee weapon. Attuning the weapon takes a full-round action. From that point forward, whenever you wield the attuned weapon, you gain a +1 Force bonus on attack rolls. The weapon is attuned to you alone; others who wield the weapon do not gain the Force bonus.

talents_list.name: Attuned
talents_list.description: when you roll nat 20 on attack v. opp with Dark Side 1+ can activate any power with [light side]

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you roll a natural 20 on an attack roll against a target with a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher, you can activate a single Force power with the [light side] descriptor immediately as a free action.

talents_list.name: Aura of Freedom
talents_list.description: +5 on skill or grapple checks to all allies w/in 6 sq, can spend FP to negate an ally moved against will
talents_list.full_text_description: All allies within 6 squares of you gain a +5 Force bonus on skill checks or grapple checks made to escape grapples or other immobilizing hazards. Additionally, whenever an ally within 6 squares of you is moved against its will (such as by the move object Force power or the Bantha Rush feat), you can spend a Force Point as a reaction to negate the forced movement entirely.

talents_list.name: Autofire Assault
talents_list.description: can brace a weapon that is not restricted to autofire only, but you must be proficient with weapon

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When making an autofire attack, you can brace a weapon that is not restricted to autofire only. You must be proficient with the weapon being used.

talents_list.name: Automated Strike
talents_list.description: DC 15 Knowledge (tactics), all droid allies who can hear you gain Double Atk from one of your WP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can make a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check. If successful, all droid allies able to hear and understand you gain the benefits of the Double Attack feat for one weapon group with which you are proficient until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Aversion
talents_list.description: until end of encounter all squares within 2sq are difficult terrain for enemies

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to radiate an invisible aura that makes other beings want to avoid you. Until the end of the encounter, all squares within 2 squares of you are considered difficult terrain for your enemies. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Avert Disaster
talents_list.description: 1/encounter turn a critical hit into a normal hit

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can turn a critical hit against you into a normal hit.

talents_list.name: Backstabber
talents_list.description: 1/turn when you flank treat them as flat-footed for 1 atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, when you flank a target, you can treat him or her as flat-footed for one of your attacks.

talents_list.name: Band Together
talents_list.description: 1/enc each: 1. swif 1 enemy whenever an ally w/in 12sq hits target +1d6 dam, 2. swif grant allies w/in 12sq & LOS +5 Will Def until end next turn, 3. w/Persuasion unfriendly or indifferent into ally for enc direct target as swif

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can inspire disparate beings to temporarily ally for a common cause. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: • Directed Attack: As a swift action, designate one enemy character or vehicle as the target of this talent. Until the end of your next turn, whenever an ally within 12 squares of you hits the target, add 1d6 points of damage to each hit. • Strength in Numbers: Your allies gain confidence in numbers. As a swift action, you grant all allies within 12 squares of you and within your line of sight a +5 bonus to Will Defense until the end of your next turn. You must have a minimum of two allies to use this action. • Temporary Allies: With a successful Persuasion check, you can turn a Gamemaster character with an attitude toward you of unfriendly or indifferent into an ally willing to aid you and follow your direction for the remainder of the encounter. As a swift action, you direct the Gamemaster character to attack a target, aid another character, or use a skill to aid you or your allies. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Bando Gora Surge
talents_list.description: if you move up CT, gain hp = 5 + HL
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you move up the condition track by any means, you gain bonus hit points equal to 5 + your heroic level. Bonus hit points are consumed before normal hit points, and unused bonus hit points go away at the end of the encounter. Bonus hit points from multiple sources do not stack.

talents_list.name: Barter
talents_list.description: reroll Persuasion to haggle
talents_list.full_text_description: You may reroll any Persuasion check made to haggle (see the Persuasion skill, CR page 71). You must, however, accept the result of the reroll.

talents_list.name: Battle Analysis
talents_list.description: DC15 Knowledge (Tactics) know which allies or opponents in LOS have half hp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can make a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check. If the check succeeds, you know which allies and opponents in your line of sight are reduced to at least half of their maximum total hit points. (SotG) If you succeed at both a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check and a DC 15 Use Computer check, you may use this talent to determine what vehicles are reduced to at least half their maximum hit points.

talents_list.name: Battle Meditation
talents_list.description: allies within 6 squares get +1 Atk for encounter if within 6 squares

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The Jedi technique known as Battle Meditation allows you and your allies to work together seamlessly and with a level of precision that can only come from the Force. As a full-round action, you can spend a Force Point to give you and all allies within 6 squares of you a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls that lasts until the end of the encounter. This bonus does not extend to allies outside the range of the effect, even if they move within 6 squares of you later on. Allies who benefit from the Battle Meditation must remain within 6 squares of you to retain the insight bonus, and they lose it if you are knocked unconscious or killed. This is a mind-affecting effect. (SotG) This affects all allied gunners within 6 squares at starship scale. Unleashed: When you use the Battle Meditation talent, you can spend a Destiny Point to have its bonuses apply to all allies within the same star system. [[Weak talent option: Allow allies who re-enter range to regain benefits.]]

talents_list.name: Battle Mount
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Expert Rider, Terrain Guidance, trained in the Ride skill.
talents_list.description: 1/enc each on mount: 1. if use mount as cover can make 1 atk, 2. if use mount as cover gain improved cover - if fail by 10 or more still get cover, 3. mount can make atk as swif not stan

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to fight from a living mount. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: • Covered Attack: Once per encounter, when you use Use Mount as Cover (but not improved cover) with the Ride skill (CR page 72) you can make an attack as a standard action, but you must have a free hand to do so. • Reduce Profile: You gain additional cover from your mount. When you succeed in using the Use Mount as Cover application of the Ride skill (CR page 72), you gain improved cover. If you fail by less than 10, you still gain the benefit of normal cover. You gain no benefit if you fail by 10 or more. • Swift Attack Mount: Once per encounter, the mount you are riding can make an attack as a swift action instead of as a standard action.

talents_list.name: Battlefield Medic
talents_list.description: first aid as stan not full

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the first aid application of the Treat Injury skill on a creature as a standard action instead of a full-round action.

talents_list.name: Battlefield Remedy
talents_list.description: when successfully use Treat Injury to administer First Aid target also moves +1 CT
talents_list.full_text_description: You have learned a variety of different ways to treat combat injuries in the field. When you succeed on a Treat Injury check to administer First Aid, the tended creature also moves +1 step on the condition track.

talents_list.name: Bayonet Master
talents_list.description: with full atk treat ranged weapon w/bayonet as double weapon ignoring penalties for double weapon

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you take a full attack action, you can treat a ranged weapon with a bayonet as a double melee weapon. You can attack with the bayonet and club a target with your ranged weapon (as with the Gun Club talent), ignoring the normal penalties for attacking with both ends of a double weapon.

talents_list.name: Beast Trick
talents_list.description: can use mind trick on beast Int 2 or less, cannot perform or understand complex directions

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the mind trick Force power on creatures of Intelligence 2 and lower. However, a beast with an Intelligence of 2 or less still cannot perform any complex action or understand complex commands it wouldn't otherwise be able to understand; an affected beast might understand "Attack those Sith troopers!" but it would not comprehend, "Break into the command center and disable the communications array."

talents_list.name: Befuddle
talents_list.description: Deception v. Will Def can move through threatened area without Atk of Opp, counts as 2 squares
talents_list.full_text_description: If you succeed on a Deception check against a target's Will Defense as a swift action, until the start of your next turn you can move through the threatened area of that target as a part of your move action without provoking an attack of opportunity. Each threatened square that you move through counts as 2 squares of movement.

talents_list.name: Begin Attack Run
talents_list.description: designate a single target, +5 Atk with an attack run

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you designate a single target. When using the attack run action against that target, vehicles in your squadron gain a +5 bonus on their attack rolls (instead of the normal +2). You may have only one target designated at a time.

talents_list.name: Believer Intuition
talents_list.description: if successfully attacked, Use the Force v. attack to add Cha mod to Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, when an opponent successfully attacks you. Make a Use the Force check and compare the result to your opponent's attack roll. If the check equals or exceeds the result of the attack roll, you can add your Charisma modifier to your Reflex Defense.

talents_list.name: Beloved
talents_list.description: each 1/enc: ally 6sq +2 Ref swif, or atk & if atked ally atk free, or if atked LOS allies move 2sq as reac
talents_list.full_text_description: Your allies hold you in such esteem that when you are threatened or injured, you can impel them to action. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: •Guardian: Choose one ally as a swift action. As long as you remain within 6 squares of the ally, you gain a +2 bonus to your Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. •Reprisal: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range as a standard action. If your attack roll succeeds and if that target attacks you before the end of your next turn, one ally within 6 squares can make an attack against that target as a reaction. •To Me!: Spend a swift action. Whenever you take any damage before the beginning of your next turn, each ally within line of sight can move 2 squares as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Better Lucky than Dead
talents_list.description: 1/encounter +5 bonus to one Def until start of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction, you gain a +5 luck bonus to any one defense until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Bigger Bang
talents_list.description: +1 die dam with Improvised Device

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you create a grenade with the Improvised Device talent, the grenade deals an additional die of damage when used.

talents_list.name: Biotech Adept
talents_list.description: reroll Knowledge (life sciences) or Treat Injury to use or repair biotech
talents_list.full_text_description: You can reroll any Knowledge (life sciences) or Treat Injury check made to use or repair biotech devices and weapons, but you must keep the second result, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Biotech Mastery
talents_list.description: can make modifications in half time & half cost, can take 10 on Mechanics check
talents_list.full_text_description: When using the Biotech Specialist feat to modify biotechnology, you are able to make the appropriate modification in half of the normal time for half the normal cost. In addition, you can take 10 on the Mechanics check (even when distracted or threatened), but you cannot take 20.

talents_list.name: Black Market Buyer
talents_list.description: automatically locate black market merchant

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When seeking an item from the black market, you do not need to make a Gather Information check to locate a black market merchant; you automatically succeed.

talents_list.name: Blast Back
talents_list.description: 1/rnd when damaged by area atk, make an atk v. source if have LOS & range

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round when you are damaged by an enemy’s area attack, as a reaction you can make an immediate melee or ranged attack against the source of the area attack, provided that you have line of sight to the attacker and the target is within your melee or ranged reach.

talents_list.name: Blaster Turret I
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, Tiny Init +4 Percep +4 Ref Def 10 10hp thresh 8 turret, 3d6 dam, you must be adjacent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as standard action you can create a blaster turret (Size Tiny, Initiative +4, Perception +4, Reflex Defense 10,10 hp, Threshold 8) that can be mounted to any flat surface. The turret fires as a standard blaster pistol once per round, using your base attack bonus plus your Intelligence bonus and dealing 3d6 points of damage. The turret fires at any target you designate (a free action, once per round on your turn), though you must remain adjacent to the turret to control it. The turret is expended at the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Blaster Turret II
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, Tiny Init +8 Percep +8 Ref Def 12 15hp thresh 10 turret, 3d8 dam, remote 12sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your turret's capabilities increase in the following ways: Initiative +8, Perception +8, Reflex Defense 12, 15 hp, Threshold 10, and the turret deals 3d8 points of damage. The turret can be directed by remote control at a range of 12 squares.

talents_list.name: Blaster Turret III
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, Tiny Init +8 Percep +8 Ref Def 12 15hp DR5 thresh 10, 3d8 dam fires twice, remote 12sq
talents_list.full_text_description: Your turret gains the ability to fire twice per round, with a -5 penalty on each attack roll, and gains DR 5.

talents_list.name: Blaster and Blade I
talents_list.description: with a single attack with an advanced melee weapon make a free pistol attack
talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a single attack with an advanced melee weapon as a standard action, you can immediately make an attack with a pistol as a free action, provided you have both the advanced melee weapon and the pistol in your hands when the melee attack is made. You apply the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons to both of these attacks.

talents_list.name: Blaster and Blade II
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Blaster & Blade I, Dual Weapon I, WP (advanced & pistols)
talents_list.description: treat advanced melee weapon as if you were holding it two-handed (dbl Str bonus)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are wielding both an advanced melee weapon and a pistol, you treat the advanced melee weapon as though you were wielding it two-handed (including doubling your Strength bonus on damage rolls).

talents_list.name: Blaster and Blade III
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Blaster & Blade I & II, Dual Weapon I, WP (advanced & pistols)
talents_list.description: make full attack as stan if you attack with both

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are wielding both an advanced melee weapon and a pistol, you can make a full attack as a standard action instead of a full-round action, provided you attack with both weapons.

talents_list.name: Blend In
talents_list.description: When adjacent to two creatures gain concealment against non adjacent targets.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to blend into a variety of cultures and groups with ease. As a swift action, you gain total concealment when adjacent to at least two other creatures. This benefit does not apply to attacks from adjacent creatures.

talents_list.name: Blend In
talents_list.description: Stealth replaces Deception for a deceptive appearance, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know the tricks of body language and movement that allow you to disguise your appearance without elaborate materials or efforts. You can use your Stealth modifier in place of your Deception modifier for the purpose of creating a deceptive appearance. You are considered trained in the Deception skill for the purpose of using this talent. If you are entitled to a Deception check reroll, you can reroll your Stealth check instead (subject to the same circumstances and conditions).

talents_list.name: Blind Shot
talents_list.description: ignore penalties v. concealment or total concealment

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You ignore the penalties on your ranged attack rolls when a target has concealment or total concealment.

talents_list.name: Blind Spot
talents_list.description: with vehicle 2 sizes bigger, must be adjacent, opposed Pilot, Atk vs. target +2, Atk from target -2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can fly a vehicle you pilot so close to a target at least two sizes larger than your vehicle that it is difficult for the target to avoid or attack you. You must be adjacent to the target (at starship scale) to use this talent. As a swift action, make an opposed Pilot check against the target. If you succeed, you move into the same space as your target. You move with your target if it moves (assuming your vehicle has sufficient speed to keep up), and you must make another opposed Pilot check each round as a swift action to stay in its blind spot. As long as you stay in the target's blind spot, any attack you make against the target gains a +2 bonus, and the target takes a -2 penalty on attacks made against you.

talents_list.name: Block
talents_list.description: negate melee attack with Use the Force check, DC = Atk roll, -5 every time used in round must have activated lightsaber, aware and not flat-footed, FP for adjacent character.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you may negate a melee attack by making a successful Use the Force check. The DC of the skill check is equal to the result of the attack roll you wish to negate, and you take a cumulative -5 penalty on your Use the Force check for every time you have used Block or Deflect since the beginning of your last turn. You may use the Block talent to negate melee area attacks, such as those made by the Whirlwind Attack feat. If you succeed on the Use the Force check, you take half damage if the attack hits and no damage if the attack misses. You may spend a Force point to use this talent to negate an attack against an adjacent character. You must have a lightsaber drawn and ignited to use this talent, and you must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. [You may stop an attack that rolled a natural 20. You may not use this against an opponent who used a DP to auto-crit. Unless you specifically attack an opponent's weapon, it does not take damage (such as from Block). Someone using an unarmed strike does not take damage from being blocked.] [[It seems you can't use Block or Deflect while raging. Block does not do damage when used to block a melee attack. Conceptually, I look at it like this:  As the Jedi swings his lightsaber around to block the attack, the opponent quickly jerks his weapon/limb out of the way, saving himself from the harmful side effects of lightsaberage.]]

talents_list.name: Bloodthirsty
talents_list.description: perform coup de grace as move, if kill with coup de grace all allies in LOS +2 Atk for encounter
talents_list.full_text_description: You can perform a coup de grace as a move action. Whenever you successfully perform a coup de grace action and kill the target, all allies within you line of sight gain a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls for the duration of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Blowback
talents_list.description: push target 1 square if you exceed target's threshold

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make an attack with a rifle that deals damage in excess of your target’s damage threshold, you can choose to push the target 1 square away from you.

talents_list.name: Boarder
talents_list.description: ignore cover with character-scale ranged attacks aboard a starship or space station

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at boarding hostile vessels. You ignore cover (but not improved cover) with your character-scale ranged attacks while aboard a starship or space station.

talents_list.name: Body Control
talents_list.description: add Cha mod instead of Con mod to Fort Def, can spend FP to become immune to poison, radiation & disease until end of enc
talents_list.full_text_description: You can add your Charisma modifier instead of your Constitution modifier to your Fortitude Defense. Additionally, you can spend a Force Point as a swift action to become immune to poison, radiation, and disease until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Bodyguard I
talents_list.description: 1/turn redirect attack to attracted minion

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are adjacent to a minion gained with the Attract Minion talent, once per turn as a reaction to being attacked you can redirect the attack against that minion. Compare the attack roll to the minion's defenses and resolve the attack as normal.

talents_list.name: Bodyguard II
talents_list.description: 1/turn redirect attack to attracted minion, minion +Ref Def = half your class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you redirect an attack to a minion using the Bodyguard I talent, that minion's relevant defense score gains a bonus equal to half your class level.

talents_list.name: Bodyguard III
talents_list.description: 1/turn redirect attack to attracted minion, minion +Ref Def = your class level & free Atk v. attacker
talents_list.full_text_description: When you redirect an attack to a minion using the Bodyguard I talent, that minion can make an immediate melee or ranged attack against your attacker, if the attacker is within range. Additionally, the bonus provided by the Bodyguard II talent increases to your full class level.

talents_list.name: Bodyguard's Sacrifice
talents_list.description: take any or all damage for adjacent ally rest goes to target, cannot use it again until end of next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can interfere with any successful attack against an adjacent ally. You can choose to take any or all of that attack’s damage, and the remainder is dealt to the target as normal. Once you use this talent, you may not use it again until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Bolster Ally
talents_list.description: +1 CT & hp = their level if under half HP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can bolster an ally within line of sight, moving him +1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148) and giving him a number of bonus hit points equal to his character level if he's at one-half his maximum hit points or less. Damage is subtracted from the bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. You can't bolster the same ally more than once in a single encounter, and you can't bolster yourself. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Bolstered Numbers
talents_list.description: if successfully Recruit Enemy, allies gain +2 atk until end of enc

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use Recruit Enemy on a target, you and all allies within line of sight gain a +2 morale bonus to attack rolls until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Bomb Thrower
talents_list.description: +5 to Mechanics checks for handling explosives & create frag grenade from spare parts

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled in making and handling impromptu explosives. You gain a +5 bonus to Mechanics checks for the purposes of handling explosives. In addition, you can spend a full-round action to craft the equivalent of a frag grenade from spare parts you have on hand. You must have access to the appropriate supplies, such as an old blaster, a toolkit, or materials found inside a hangar bay.

talents_list.name: Bonded Mount
talents_list.description: mount shares an empathic link, when you ride your mount has your Ref & Will Def, you gain senses

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you encounter a domesticated beast with a friendly or helpful attitude toward you, you can spend a Force Point as a full-round action to bond the beast to you as a mount. A bonded mount shares an empathic link with you, allowing you to sense its emotions as a free action. When you ride a bonded mount, your mount uses your Reflex Defense and Will Defense instead of its own. Additionally, if your mount has any special senses (such as scent, darkvision, or low-light vision) that you do not possess, you gain the benefits of its special senses as long as you are riding that mount.

talents_list.name: Born Leader
talents_list.description: once per encounter, all allies +1 Atk, if in LOS and if N conscious

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a swift action, you grant all allies within your line of sight a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls. This effect lasts for as long as they remain within line of sight of you. An ally loses this bonus immediately if line of sight is broken or if you are unconscious or dead. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Bothan Resources
talents_list.description: DC20 Gather Info can purchase standard equipment at 50% rate or exotic at 75%
talents_list.full_text_description: Your status within the Spynet gives you access to additional resources, and you know the best sources for restricted or rare items. With a successful DC 20 Gather Information check, you can purchase standard weapons, equipment, and transport services at 50% of the going rate, or exotic and restricted weapons, equipment, and transport services at 75% of the going rate.

talents_list.name: Breach Cover
talents_list.description: ignore cover if you fire or throw a weapon with burst or splash

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you fire or throw a weapon with a burst or splash radius at a target with cover, you ignore that cover.

talents_list.name: Breaching Explosive
talents_list.description: ignore threshold of doors & walls when using mines & non-grenade explosives

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You ignore the damage threshold of doors and walls when using mines and fixed (non-grenade) explosives.

talents_list.name: Break Program
talents_list.description: Use Computer v. droid's Will Def & override behavioral inhibitors for # rnds = your Int bonus

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your ability to circumvent behavioral inhibitors to temporarily break the programming of a droid that you have a data link with. Make a Use Computer check opposed by the droid’s Will Defense. Breaking the droid’s programming overrides its behavioral inhibitors for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence bonus.

talents_list.name: Bring Them Back
talents_list.description: revivify on a target that has died a number of rounds = half heroic level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the revivify application of the Treat Injury skill on a target that has died anytime within a number of rounds equal to one-half your heroic level.

talents_list.name: Brutal Attack
talents_list.description: if you do dam over thresh add +1 die dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group you are proficient with. Attacks with such weapons that deal damage that exceeds an opponent's damage threshold deal +1 die of damage on that attack. You determine damage (including doubling damage from a critical hit) and compare it to your target’s damage threshold first, then add the extra die of damage when applicable. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, it applies to a different exotic weapon or weapon group.

talents_list.name: Brutal Unarmed Strike
talents_list.description: reroll any damage dice that has a "1" as a result
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you roll the damage for an unarmed attack, you reroll any dice that come up with a result of 1.

talents_list.name: Bugbite
talents_list.description: +1 die damage with razor & thud bugs

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You deal +1 die of damage on attacks made with razor bugs and thud bugs.

talents_list.name: Bullseye
talents_list.description: 1/enc designate 1 target in you aimed at not in PB, with ranged atk target denied Ref to Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can designate a single target that you have aimed at and that is not within point-blank range. When making a ranged attack roll against that target, the target is denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense when determining the effect of your attack.

talents_list.name: Bunker Blaster
talents_list.description: if adjacent to object that provides cover to target you can aim at target as move action
talents_list.full_text_description: If you are adjacent to an object that can provide you with cover from a target, you can aim at that target as a move action.

talents_list.name: Buried Presence
talents_list.description: immune to Force detection for 1 hour, may use as a reac v. Sense Force
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to become immune to detection by the Force for 1 hour. During this time, you always avoid detection by characters who are using the sense force application of the Use the Force skill, and you cannot be the target of the farseeing power. You may use this as a reaction to another character attempting to locate you with Sense Force (but before the character locates you), and if you make a Use the Force check this power's effect immediately ends.

talents_list.name: Burning Assault
talents_list.description: expend a charge as an attack, treat as flame thrower, not while flying

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action you can expend one of your jet pack's charges to make an attack with the jet pack, treating it as a flame thrower (see page 128 of the Saga Edition core rulebook). You cannot use this talent when you are flying. You are considered proficient in the flame thrower for the purpose of making this attack.

talents_list.name: Burst Transfer
talents_list.description: double data sent in a rnd & cut Access Info time in half with Use Computer to find info

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can double the amount of data transferred with the Binary language in a single round (see page 191 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) when communicating with other droids with Burst Transfer, and you cut Access Information time in half when making Use Computer checks to find general or specific information (see page 76 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Call Out
talents_list.description: as Personal Vendetta but designate one opponent to be -5 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Personal Vendetta talent, you may designate one target of that talent to take a -5 penalty to attacks against targets other than you instead of the normal -2.

talents_list.name: Call Weapon
talents_list.description: call & ignite a lightsaber you built as a free action if in LOS
talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Move Light Object application of the Use the Force skill to call a lightsaber you built into your hand and ignite it as a free action. The weapon must be in your line of sight to call it to your hand.

talents_list.name: Cantina Brawler
talents_list.description: if flanked +2 on unarmed attack & damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: While flanked, you gain a +2 bonus on unarmed attack rolls and damage rolls.

talents_list.name: Capture Droid
talents_list.description: 1/enc v. adjacent droid reduced to 0 hp, Mechanics v. Will Def for +2 CT & d8 hp & friendly

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can use this talent on an adjacent enemy droid that has been reduced to 0 hit points or moved to the bottom of the condition track but not destroyed. As a standard action, make a Mechanics check against the droid’s Will Defense. If your result equals or exceeds the droid’s Will Defense, the droid moves +2 steps on the condition track, regains 1d8 hit points, and becomes your ally, and its attitude toward you immediately shifts to friendly. The droid fights on your side until the end of the encounter, at which point it is destroyed.

talents_list.name: Cargo Hauler
talents_list.description: double carrying capacity & +5 to Str-based skill checks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +5 bonus on Strength-based skill checks. Additionally, you double your carrying capacity.

talents_list.name: Cast Suspicion
talents_list.description: one enemy in LOS loses all insight/morale bonuses on atk & can't be aided until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can select one enemy within your line of sight. That enemy loses all morale and insight bonuses on attack rolls and cannot be aided (using the aid another action) by its allies until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Castigate
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def to impose -2 to all of target's def until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You deliver a scathing rebuke against a target to erode its will and fill it with doubt. Make a Persuasion check as a standard action against the target's Will Defense. If successful, you impose a -2 penalty to all the target's Defenses until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability only against targets that can clearly hear you and understand your language.

talents_list.name: Cause Mutation
talents_list.description: transform to Sith Abomination (J22) or Chrysalis Beast (J133), domesticated for you, days = new CL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your mastery of Sith alchemy to create mutated abominations. You must have access to a willing (or unconscious) creature to which you will apply the Sith Abomination template (see the sidebar) or the Chrysalis Beast template (see page 133). You also need a medical lab outfitted for the process, which requires a number of days equal to the creature’s modified CL. You must spend a Force Point at the completion of the process to complete the transformation. A creature you have mutated is considered to be a domesticated creature, but for you only (unless it was already a domesticated creature before its mutation).

talents_list.name: Champion
talents_list.description: 1/enc each: 1. w/2nd Wind +1 CT & remove fear/mind effects & normal, 2. when hit & dam target over thresh can Disarm v. target as free, 3. w/successful unarmed or melee atk (not lightsaber) + dam = every 5 pts atk is over Ref Def
talents_list.full_text_description: You fight for protection, honor, or glory for yourself and others. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: •Champion’s Pride: Your pride and dedication drives you on in the most difficult moments. When you use your second wind, you move + 1 step on the condition track and remove one fear effect or mind-affecting effect in addition to the normal benefit of second wind. •Disarming Hit: When you hit and damage a creature and that damage equals or exceeds the target’s damage threshold, you can make a Disarm Attack (CR page 152) against that target as a free action. If using a ranged weapon, you must also have the Ranged Disarm feat. •Masterful Strike: You land an impressive blow against your enemy. When making a successful unarmed or melee attack (except when using a lightsaber), increase your damage by 2 for every 5 points by which your attack roll exceeds your target’s Reflex Defense.

talents_list.name: Channel Aggression
talents_list.description: Atk vs. flanked opp or one denied Dex to Def, extra dam = 1d6 per class lvl (10d6 max

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you succeed on an attack against a flanked opponent or any target that is denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense , you may spend a Force Point as a free action to deal additional damage to the target equal to 1d6 per class level (maximum 10d6).

talents_list.name: Channel Anger
talents_list.description: +2 melee Atk & damage for rounds equal to 5 + Con mod, then move-1 CT, no patience
talents_list.full_text_description: You let your anger swell into a rage. As a swift action, you may spend a Force Point to gain a +2 rage bonus on melee attack rolls and melee damage rolls for a number of rounds equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier. At the end of this duration, you move -1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). While raging, you cannot use skills that require patience and concentration, such as Mechanics, Stealth, or Use the Force.

talents_list.name: Channel Energy
talents_list.description: convert energy to activate any power in your suite

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the negate energy Force power to successfully negate the damage from an energy weapon attack, you can spend a Force Point as a reaction to immediately activate any Force power currently in your Force suite.

talents_list.name: Channel Vitality
talents_list.description: move -1 CT to gain 1 Force Point until the end of your turn

effects.target_description: ce point until the end of your turn

talents_list.full_text_description: You can fuel your mastery of the Force with your own vitality. As a swift action, you can move -1 step down the condition track to gain a temporary Force Point. This temporary Force Point lasts until the end of your turn, at which point it is lost if it has not been used.

talents_list.name: Charm Beast
talents_list.description: UseForce replaces Persuasion w/animal Int 2 or less, -5 if animal doesn't understand doesn't apply

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may make a Use the Force check in place of a Persuasion check when attempting to change the attitude of an undomesticated creature with an Intelligence of 2 or less. Additionally, you do not take the normal -5 penalty on the check if the creature can't speak or understand your language.

talents_list.name: Charm Beast
talents_list.description: UseForce replaces Persuasion w/animal Int 2 or less, -5 if animal doesn't understand doesn't apply

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may make a Use the Force check in place of a Persua sion check when attempting to change the attitude of an undomesticated creature with an Intelligence of 2 or less. Additionally, you do not take the normal -5 penalty on the check if the creature can't speak or understand your language.

talents_list.name: Charm Beast
talents_list.description: UseForce replaces Persuasion w/animal Int 2 or less, -5 if animal doesn't understand doesn't apply

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check in place of a Persuasion check when attempting to change the attitude of an undomesticated creature with an Intelligence of 2 or less. Additionally, you do not take the normal -5 penalty on the check if the creature can’t speak or understand your language. (This talent is identical to the Dathomiri Witch talent of the same name, and both are considered to be the same talent for the purposes of satisfying prerequisites).

talents_list.name: Cheap Shot
talents_list.description: once per encounter make an atk of opp against an opponent that withdraws from an ally in PB range

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can make an attack of opportunity against an opponent that takes the withdraw action to withdraw from a space threatened by one of your allies within point-blank range.

talents_list.name: Cheap Trick
talents_list.description: when you use Deception to feint against an enemy w/in 6sq you can roll twice

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a Deception check to feint (see page 66 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) against an enemy within 6 squares of you, you can roll twice, keeping the better of the two results.

talents_list.name: Cleanse Mind
talents_list.description: once per turn you can remove an ongoing mind-affecting effect from 1 ally in LOS
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn as a swift action, you can remove one ongoing mind-affecting effect (such as the effects of Demand Surrender or Weaken Resolve talents, or the effect of being moved to the end of the condition track by the Adept Negotiator talent, or the ongoing effects of the mind trick Force power) from a single allied target within line of sight.

talents_list.name: Clear Mind
talents_list.description: may reroll Use the Force check to avoid detection
talents_list.full_text_description: You may reroll any opposed Use the Force check made to avoid being detected by other Force-users. You must take the result of the reroll, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Clip
talents_list.description: when ramming take damage as though your ship is 2 sizes smaller, rammed ship is normal damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the ram action, you reduce the size of your ship by two categories for the purposes of taking collision damage. The rammed ship takes damage appropriate to the actual size of your ship.

talents_list.name: Cloak of Shadow
talents_list.description: until end of encounter when you move 3 sq from start you gain concealment from all targets
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to bend light around you, veiling yourself in shadows. Until the end of the encounter, whenever you move and end your movement at least 3 squares away from your starting position, you gain concealment from all targets until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Close Contact
talents_list.description: PB range increased by 5 sq, Short range begins 5 sq later but ends at same distance

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The point-blank range of any rifle or carbine you use is increased by 5 squares. Short range for the weapon begins 5 squares later, but still ends at the same distance. You can take this talent up to two times; each time you take this talent, you increase the point-blank range of any rifle or carbine you use by an additional 5 squares, up to a maximum of 10 squares.

talents_list.name: Close Cover
talents_list.description: if you occupy the same space as a larger vehicle +5 cover bonus

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you occupy the same space as a vehicle that is larger than the vehicle you are piloting, your vehicle gains a +5 cover bonus from the larger vehicle.

talents_list.name: Close Maneuvering
talents_list.description: 1/turn designate a target, your move does not provoke Atk of Opp from target if you move adjacent
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, you can use a swift action to designate a target. Until the start of your next turn, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from that target, provided that you end your movement adjacent to that target.

talents_list.name: Close Scrape
talents_list.description: Colossal size or smaller, Pilot check turns crit into normal (still hit, not crit)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are piloting a vehicle of Colossal size or smaller, you may make a Pilot check as a reaction to turn a critical hit into a normal hit. The DC for the Pilot check is equal to the attack roll total of the critical hit. If you are successful, the damage from the attack is not doubled (though it is still considered an automatic hit).

talents_list.name: Close-Combat Assault
talents_list.description: each follower gains PB Shot feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Each of your followers gains the Point Blank Shot feat.

talents_list.name: Close-Quarters Fighter
talents_list.description: if adjacent or in same sq, +1 melee atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you occupy the same square as your target or are adjacent to your target, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your melee attack rolls against that target.

talents_list.name: Closed Mind
talents_list.description: mind-affecting effects must be rolled twice against you taking the lower result

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever a creature uses a mind-affecting effect on you that targets your Will Defense, it must roll the attack roll or skill check twice, taking the lower result.

talents_list.name: Collective Visions
talents_list.description: other Force-users with farseeing can aid another as a reac within 6sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Developed by Krynda Draay, this talent is used by Jedi Covenant WatchCircles to sharpen their visions through the Force. When you use farseeing or a Force power or talent that has farseeing as a prerequisite, other Force-users with farseeing in their Force-power suite can aid another (page 151 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) on your Use the Force check as a reaction if they are within 6 squares of you.

talents_list.name: Combat Repairs
talents_list.description: 1/day use Mechanics to repair self instead of 1 hour

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, as a full-round action, you can use the Mechanics skill to repair yourself (using the repair droid application of the skill), as opposed to the normal 1 hour. [[Mechanics DC 20; restores HP = droid’s level & removes persistent conditions. Droid repairing itself takes –5 penalty]]

talents_list.name: Combat Trance
talents_list.description: battle strike applies to the first attack you make each round until the end of the encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the battle strike power, you gain the power’s bonus on attack rolls on your first melee attack made each round until the end of the encounter. If you do not attack in a round, this effect ends.

talents_list.name: Combined Fire
talents_list.description: +2 dam against targets damaged by an ally since end of your last turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on attacks against targets that have been damaged by an ally since the end of your last turn.

talents_list.name: Combined Fire
talents_list.description: designate single vehicle, object or creature in LOS, extra die for batteries every 2, not 3 on roll with tactical fire, may designate one weapon or battery to make a single attack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you may designate a single creature, vehicle, or object within your line of sight as the target of combined fire. Any weapon batteries attacking that target deal an extra die of damage for every 2 points their attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense (instead of every 3 points). In addition, when using the tactical fire option for a capital ship (see ship descriptions in Chapter 4), you may designate a weapon or weapon battery to make a single attack.

talents_list.name: Combustion
talents_list.description: +1d6 fire dam to any force power that affects a single target & catches it on fire

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to add 1d6 points of fire damage to any Force power that causes damage to a single target. A target that takes fire damage also catches on fire (see page 256 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Command Beast
talents_list.description: treat animal as domesticated and can Ride

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.
