talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you manage to shift the attitude of a beast to indifferent or friendly, you may treat that creature as a domesticated animal-but for you only (it remains undomesticated in its response to other creatures). Additionally, you may use this beast as a mount, as per the Ride skill (see page 72), provided that it is at least one size category larger than you and has a comfortable place for you to sit. For more information on beasts, see page 273.

talents_list.name: Command Beast
talents_list.description: treat animal as domesticated and can Ride

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you manage to shift the attitude of a beast to indifferent or friendly, you may treat that creature as a domesticated animal-but foryou only (it remains undomesticated in its response to other creatures). Additionally, you may use this beast as a mount, as per the Ride skill (see CR page 72), provided that it is at least one size category larger than you and has a comfortable place for you to sit. For more information on beasts, see CR page 273.

talents_list.name: Commander's Prerogative
talents_list.description: after surprise rnd take your turn before allies but must share talent (special quality, Commando, Leadership or Military Tactics), next rnd return to normal spot in Init order

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: During the first round of combat in an encounter (after the surprise round, if any), you can take your turn before any of your allies, but you must use either the Share Talent prestige class ability or a talent from one of the following talent trees as part of your turn: Commando, Leadership, or Military Tactics. On the subsequent round, you return to your normal place in the initiative order.

talents_list.name: Commanding Officer
talents_list.description: gain 1 follower with AP feat & WP (rifles), can be taken max 3 times

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a single follower. Choose either the aggressive, defensive, or utility follower template for your follower, generating the follower's statistics using the rules on CW page 32. This follower gains one Armor Proficiency feat of your choice and Weapon Proficiency (rifles), in addition to those provided by the follower templates. The follower must meet the prerequisites for the Armor Proficiency feat you select. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do, you gain one additional follower (maximum of three followers).

talents_list.name: Commanding Presence
talents_list.description: each 1/enc make ranged or melee atk for 1. if hits all allies w/in 6sq +2 to all Def until end of next turn, or 2. if hits all allies w/in 6sq & LOS +2 atk & dam until end of next turn, or 3. if dam target allies = Cha mod can move half spd as free
talents_list.full_text_description: You excel at leading others into battle, issuing quick commands, demonstrating a gift for strategy, decimating your enemies, and impressing your peers. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a standard action: • Hold the Line!: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If your attack hits, all allies within 6 squares of you a gain a +2 morale bonus to their Defense scores until the end of your next turn. • Lead the Assault: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If your attack hits, all allies within 6 squares of you and within your line of sight gain a +2 morale bonus to their attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of your next turn. • Turn the Tide: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If you successfully damage the target, a number of allies equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) can immediately move up to half their speed as a free action. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Commanding Presence
talents_list.description: once per encounter all enemies -2 Will Def, Persuasion is now a class skill

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can activate this talent as a swift action. Until the end of the encounter, all your enemies within 6 squares of you take a -2 penalty to their Will Defense. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. Additionally, Persuasion is now considered a class skill for you.

talents_list.name: Competitive Drive
talents_list.description: once per encounter reroll one Wis Int or Cha based skill except Use the Force
talents_list.full_text_description: You are driven to compete and succeed. Once per encounter, you can reroll any Wisdom-, Intelligence-, or Charisma-based skill check (except Use the Force) and take the better result.

talents_list.name: Competitive Edge
talents_list.description: when you and allies are not surprised, # allies = Cha mod benefit from Quick Draw

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you and your allies are not surprised, you and a number of allies equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) that you designate on your first turn gain the benefit of the Quick Draw feat for the remainder of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Computer Language
talents_list.description: Persuasion replaces Use Computer, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Persuasion modifier instead of your Use Computer modifier when making Use Computer checks. You are considered trained in the Use Computer skill for the purpose of using this talent. If you are entitled to a Use Computer check reroll, you can reroll your Persuasion check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Computer Master
talents_list.description: reroll opposed Use Computer checks
talents_list.full_text_description: You can reroll any opposed Use Computer check, using the better result.

talents_list.name: Comrades in Arms
talents_list.description: if within 3 sq of ally, +1 atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are within 3 squares of an ally, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all melee and ranged attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Conceal Force Use
talents_list.description: with Use the Force to make a Deception check to conceal the effects of your Force use

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have learned to use the Force without telltale gestures, reducing the disturbance created in the process. Whenever you make a Use the Force check, as a swift action you can make a Deception check to convey deceptive appearances in order to conceal the effects of your Force use. Normal modifiers for the deception's complexity still apply.

talents_list.name: Conceal Other
talents_list.description: you can use Buried Presence or Vanish on one extra person

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use either the Buried Presence talent or the Vanish talent, you affect one other willing adjacent target, granting it the effect of that talent as well. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, it increases the number of adjacent willing targets you affect by one.

talents_list.name: Concealed Weapon Expert
talents_list.description: 1/round with unarmed, hold-out, dagger or vibrodagger reroll attack
talents_list.full_text_description: You are deadly with an unarmed strike, hold-out blaster, dagger, or vibrodagger or other small, concealable weapon (as determined by the Gamemaster). Once per round you can use a swift action to reroll an attack using one of these weapons, but you must take the second result, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Concentrate All Fire
talents_list.description: +1 die dam when aid another's atk with vehicle weapon, an ally can only benefit once per atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the aid another action to aid an ally’s attack roll with a vehicle weapon, if the attack hits, it deals +1 die of damage. Any ally can only benefit from this talent once per attack roll, regardless of how many allies with this talent aid on the attack.

talents_list.name: Confounding Attack
talents_list.description: 1/encounter forgo extra move to atk, if hit & dam with melee you switch places with opponent
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, whenever you would use Uncanny Instincts, you can forgo the movement to make an immediate melee or ranged attack against the opponent that hit you. If your attack is a melee attack that hits and deals damage, you and your opponent immediately switch places, if both you and your opponent can end in a legal space.

talents_list.name: Connections
talents_list.description: acquire equipment, CLx1000 credits, reduce black market multiplier by 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are able to obtain licensed, restricted, military, or illegal equipment without having to pay a licensing fee or endure a background check, provided the total cost of the desired equipment is equal to or less than your character level x 1,000 credits. In addition, when obtaining equipment or services through the black market, you reduce the black market cost multiplier by 1. See Restricted Items (CR page 118) for details.

talents_list.name: Consular's Vitality
talents_list.description: 1/round grant one ally in 12 sq & LOS hp = 5+Cha mod, you take -5 Use the Force until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Jedi during the Clone Wars learn to call upon the Force not only for their own strength but also to aid the clone troopers and other allies under their command. Once per round as a swift action, you grant one ally within 12 squares of you (and in your line of sight) bonus hit points equal to 5 + your Charisma modifier. These bonus hit points last until the beginning of your next turn (at which point any remaining bonus hit points are lost), and any damage dealt to that ally comes out of bonus hit points first. You take a -5 penalty on all Use the Force checks until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Consular's Wisdom
talents_list.description: 1/encounter 1 ally in LOS, until end of encounter ally adds your Wis bonus to Will Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can choose one ally within your line of sight that can hear and understand you. Until the end of the encounter, that ally adds your Wisdom bonus to its Will Defense against mind-affecting effects.

talents_list.name: Consumed by Darkness
talents_list.description: take -5 to Will Def for +2 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Sometimes your anger consumes you. As a swift action, you can take a -5 penalty to your Will Defense to gain a +2 Force bonus on attack rolls. The penalty and bonus last until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Contingency Plan
talents_list.description: 1/enc move your speed when you fail an attack, skill, or opposed check
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, if you fail an attack roll, a skill check, or the use of a talent that requires an opposed check, you can move your speed as a reaction .

talents_list.name: Controlled Burst
talents_list.description: autofire or Burst Fire penalty reduced to -2, if you brace, no penalty

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your penalty when making an autofire attack or using the Burst Fire feat is reduced to -2. In addition, if you brace an autofire-only weapon, you have no penalty on your attack roll.

talents_list.name: Coordinate
talents_list.description: all allies in LOS get +1 with aid another, +5 max

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: A noble with this talent has a knack for getting people to work together. When you use this talent as a standard action, all allies within your line of sight grant an additional +1 bonus when they use the aid another action until the start of your next turn (see Aid Another, page 151). You may select this talent multiple times; each time you do, the bonus granted by the coordinate ability increases by +1 (to a maximum of +5). This is a mind-affecting effect. [You may take this talent a maximum of 5 times.]

talents_list.name: Coordinated Effort
talents_list.description: +2 damage when aiding your Dedicated Protector on an atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the aid another action to grant a bonus on attack rolls, if you are aiding the target of your Dedicated Protector talent that ally also gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls on the attack you aided.

talents_list.name: Coordinated Leadership
talents_list.description: 1 talent from Leadership tree stacks w/bonuses from others

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You coordinate your actions with other leaders. Choose one talent you possess from the Leadership talent tree. The bonuses you provide with this talent are now considered to be untyped bonuses, allowing them to stack with the bonuses granted by your allies. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Coordinated Tactics
talents_list.description: each follower gains Coordinated Attack feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Each of your followers gains the Coordinated Attack feat (see page 83 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), provided he meets the prerequisite. If your follower later meets the prerequisite for the feat, he gains the feat at that time.

talents_list.name: Corporate Clout
talents_list.description: 1/encounter Persuasion v. Will w/in LOS target cannot attack you, if over by 5 can't attack allies

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are adept at making deals that make enemies question which side they should be on. Once per encounter, as a standard action, you can make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of an enemy within line of sight. If your check equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, the target cannot attack you for the remainder of the encounter. If your check exceeds the Will Defense by 5 or more, the target will not attack you or your allies for the remainder of the encounter, and retreats from the encounter. If your check exceeds the Will Defense by 10 or more, the target's attitude toward you is now Friendly, and the target becomes your ally for the remainder of the encounter, remaining under the control of the Gamemaster. If you or one of your allies attacks the target, the target once again becomes hostile. If the target is higher level than you, it gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

talents_list.name: Cortosis Defense
talents_list.description: +2 on opposed unarmed melee attack roll v. lightsaber

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are adept at using a cortosis gauntlet to parry lightsaber attacks. You gain a +2 bonus when making an opposed unarmed melee attack roll against a lightsaber attack.

talents_list.name: Cortosis Gauntlet Block
talents_list.description: can use Block with cortosis gauntlets, deactivates lightsabers on successful Block

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may negate a melee attack when wearing a cortosis gauntlet by making a successful Use the Force check as a reaction. The DC of the skill check is equal to the result of the attack roll you wish to negate, and you take a cumulative –5 penalty on your Use the Force check for every time you have used Block or Deflect since the beginning of your last turn. You must be aware of the attack and not be flat-footed to use this talent. You may spend a Force Point to use this talent to negate an attack against an adjacent character. If you successfully use this talent against a melee area attack (such as those made by the Whirlwind Attack feat), the attack deals half damage if the attack hits and no damage if it misses. Additionally, if you successfully block an attack made with a lightsaber with a cortosis gauntlet, the attacker’s lightsaber is deactivated.

talents_list.name: Cortosis Retaliation
talents_list.description: when you successfully parry lightsaber atk you may make immediate atk v. attacker

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use a cortosis gauntlet to parry an attack made with a lightsaber, you may make an immediate attack of opportunity against the attacker.

talents_list.name: Counterpunch
talents_list.description: if fight defensively any adjacent creature provokes an attack of opportunity

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you fight defensively, any adjacent creature that attacks you provokes an attack of opportunity from you.

talents_list.name: Cover Bracing
talents_list.description: brace autofire weapon with one swif if near an object that provides you with cover from target squares

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can brace a weapon set on autofire as a single swift action (instead of two) if you are adjacent to an object (including walls, barriers, and vehicles) that provides you with cover from all of the target squares.

talents_list.name: Cover Escape
talents_list.description: when you successfully spend FP to negate atk with Negate or Block ally can move 2 sq w/no AofO
talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully spend a Force Point to negate a melee attack against an adjacent ally with the Block or Deflect talents, that ally can move up to 2 squares as a free action. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Cover Fire
talents_list.description: with a ranged attack, allies w/in 6 squares get +1 Def until your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a ranged attack with a pistol or rifle, all allies within 6 squares of you when the attack is made gain a +1 bonus to Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. Allies within range don't need to be within your line of sight to gain the bonus.

talents_list.name: Cover Your Tracks
talents_list.description: Gather Information checks against you are -5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are adept at living beneath society’s radar. Anyone who attempts to locate you using the Gather Information skill suffers a -5 penalty on their Gather Information checks.

talents_list.name: Cower Enemies
talents_list.description: Persuasion to intimidate 6sq cone not single target.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Persuasion skill to intimidate, you can intimidate all targets in a 6-square cone (originating from your square) instead of intimidating a single target. All other limitations to the intimidation use of the Persuasion skill still apply.

talents_list.name: Cramped Quarters Fighting
talents_list.description: Ref Def +2 when adjacent to obstacle or barrier

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When adjacent to an obstacle or barrier, you gain a +2 cover bonus to your Reflex Defense.

talents_list.name: Creeping Approach
talents_list.description: designate unaware target in 12sq, until next turn target may not make Perception against you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can designate a single opponent within 12 squares that is unaware of you as the target of this talent. Until the beginning of your next turn, that target may not make Perception checks to notice you, even if you enter the target's line of sight. If you or any of your allies attack the target, the effect of this talent ends.

talents_list.name: Crippling Hit
talents_list.description: if Atk moves ship down CT, target loses: hyperdrive, weapon, or communications
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make an attack that causes a vehicle to move -1 or more steps down the condition track, you may also cause it to lose one of the following systems: hyperdrive, one weapon or weapon battery, or communications. The system remains inoperative until the target regains all steps on the condition track.

talents_list.name: Crippling Strike
talents_list.description: on a Crit, can reduce target speed by half until fully healed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you score a critical hit, you may spend a Force Point to also reduce the target's speed by half until he is fully healed (that is, restored to maximum hit points).

talents_list.name: Critical Skill Success
talents_list.description: When you roll nat 20 on a skill, choose different skill. Gain +5 before end of next turn as free
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you roll a natural 20 on a skill check, choose one other skill. Once before the end of your next turn, you can choose to gain a +5 competence bonus to a check with that skill as a free action.

talents_list.name: Crowd Control
talents_list.description: Grab 2 adjacent targets at once

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can grab two adjacent creatures at a time.

talents_list.name: Crucial Advice
talents_list.description: 1/encounter reroll failed skill check with +2
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you fail a skill check, you can reroll the skill check with a +2 circumstance bonus. (In the case of skill checks with multiple possible results, such as when activating a Force power with multiple effects, failing a skill check is defined achieving less than the minimum DC for that check.)

talents_list.name: Crushing Assault
talents_list.description: if damage opp with bludgeoning Atk, +2 Atk & dam on next atk v. opponent before end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You use your attacks to beat down your opponents' defenses. When you successfully damage an opponent using a bludgeoning weapon that you have the Weapon Specialization talent for, your next attack against that opponent made before the end of the encounter gains a +2 bonus to the attack roll and to the damage roll. The effects of multiple Crushing Assaults do not stack.

talents_list.name: Cunning Distraction
talents_list.description: if you feint in combat you can move half your speed
talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully feint an opponent in combat, you can immediately move up to one-half your speed.

talents_list.name: Cunning Strategist
talents_list.description: each 1/enc after you Atk: if dam target -5 Ref, or target -2 spd, v. 2 opp w/in 2sq -5 Atk but 1 dam roll

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can create opportunities to chip away at your opponents' defenses. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a standard action: •Create Opening: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If you damage the target, the target takes a -5 penalty to its Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. •Crippling Attack: Make a single melee or ranged attack against an opponent within your range. Until the start of your next turn, the target takes a -2 penalty to its base speed. •Vicious Attack: Make a melee or ranged attack within your range against two opponents that are within 2 squares of each other. Make a separate attack roll at a -5 penalty against each target, but roll damage once only.

talents_list.name: Curved Throw
talents_list.description: ignore cover (not total) with razor & thud bugs

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a swift action to ignore cover (but not total cover) with your next attack with a thud bug or a razor bug made before the end of your turn.

talents_list.name: Custom Model
talents_list.description: add one modification from Tech Specialist of Improvised Device & does not affect value of item

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you create a device with the Improvised Device talent, you can apply one modification granted by the Tech Specialist feat (see page 21 of Starships of the Galaxy) to the device. This customization does not affect the value of the item being created.

talents_list.name: Cycle of Harmony
talents_list.description: ally in 12 sq & LOS takes dam or moves down CT another ally w/in 12 & LOS gets hp = 5 + Cha mod
talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight takes damage or moves down the condition track by any means, you can designate a different ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight as a reaction. The ally you designate gains bonus hit points equal to 5 + your Charisma modifier (minimum +1). Damage is subtracted from bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter are lost.

talents_list.name: Damage Reduction 10
talents_list.description: DR 10 for one minute
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to gain damage reduction 10 for 1 minute (see Damage Reduction, page 158).

talents_list.name: Damaging Deception
talents_list.description: Deception v. Will Def in LOS, the next attack by your ally against the target deals +2 dice damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to distract a target, exposing weak spots that your allies can exploit. As a standard action, you can make a Deception check against the Will Defense of any target within your line of sight that can see, hear, and understand you. If successful, the next attack made before the start of your next by one of your allies turn that hits your target deals an additional +2 dice of damage.

talents_list.name: Damaging Disarm
talents_list.description: When you disarm with a ranged attack, deal half damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you successfully disarm an opponent using a ranged attack, the target also takes half damage from the attack.

talents_list.name: Dampen Presence
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will Def it does not remember interacting with you (+5 if opp higher level)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you interact with another sentient creature, you can use a swift action to reduce the impression you leave on it. When you have finished interacting with the creature, you make a Use the Force check, and if the check result exceeds the target's Will Defense, it does not remember interacting with you once you are gone. A target that is higher in level than you gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense to resist this ability. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Dark Deception
talents_list.description: with attempts to sense you with force you can act as if Dark Side = Wis, Deception is a class skill
talents_list.full_text_description: You can cloak your intentions with a veil of anger and hate. When another character attempts to sense you through the Force in any way, you can choose to act as though your Dark Side Score equals your Wisdom score. Additionally, Deception is now a class skill for you.

talents_list.name: Dark Healing
talents_list.description: life from creature w/in 6 squares, ranged Atk v. target's Fort Def, deals & heals d6 dam per class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to heal wounds by drawing life energy from another creature within 6 squares of you. Using this ability is a standard action, and you must succeed on a ranged attack roll. If the attack equals or exceeds the target's Fortitude Defense, you deal 1d6 points of damage per class level [use the sum of your Sith Apprentice and Sith Lord levels, as well as any other levels tha have access to the talent] to the target and you heal an equal amount. If the attack fails, there is no effect. [It can critical and be deflected (it is a ranged attack), but it cannot be redirected (since it is not a blaster bolt)]. [[Since you are using the Force to attack and not a weapon, you should not be allowed to add +1/2 level damage. Feats and talents that enhance ranged attacks may be allowed with GM discretion (ex: Bantha Herder, Dirty Fighting, Fortune's Favor.)]]

talents_list.name: Dark Healing Field
talents_list.description: life from 3 creatures w/in 12sq, 1/encounter UtF if = Fort target d6 dam per class level & you heal half if attack fails target takes half dam & you heal that amount

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to heal wounds by drawing life energy from up to three targeted creatures within 12 squares of you. Once per encounter, make a Use the Force check. If the attack equals or exceeds a target's Fortitude Defense, the target takes 1d6 damage per class level. You heal half the total damage dealt (cumulative from all targets). If the attack fails, the targets take half damage and you heal that amount.

talents_list.name: Dark Presence
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Cha 13, Power of the Dark Side
talents_list.description: you and allies within 6 squares +1 Def until end of encounter as long as conscious

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you grant yourself and all allies within 6 squares of you a +1 Force bonus to all defenses until the end of the encounter. These bonuses are lost if you fall unconscious or die. Affected allies that move out of range lose the benefits for as long as they remain out of range.

talents_list.name: Dark Preservation
talents_list.description: increase Dark Side Score by one to stop moving down CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an effect would normally move you down the condition track, you may spend a Force Point and increase your Dark Side Score by 1 to negate that movement down the condition track.

talents_list.name: Dark Retaliation
talents_list.description: once an encounter activate a force power as a reaction if targeted by dark side power
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can spend a Force Point to activate a Force power as a reaction to being targeted by a power with the [dark side] descriptor.

talents_list.name: Dark Scourge
talents_list.description: +1 Atk v. Jedi

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have dedicated your life to wiping out the Jedi, and your hatred of them knows no bounds. Against Jedi characters, you gain a +1 dark side bonus on attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Adept
talents_list.description: reroll any Dark side skill
talents_list.full_text_description: Force powers that are strongly tied to the dark side flow through you more easily. You can reroll any Use the Force check made when activating Force powers with the [dark side] descriptor, but you must keep the result of the reroll, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Bane
talents_list.description: damage dealing Force power against creature with Dark Side Score 1+ deal dam = Cha mod (min 1)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a damage-dealing Force power against a creature with a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher, you deal extra damage on a successful hit equal to your Charisma bonus (minimum +1).

talents_list.name: Dark Side Manipulation
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when you spend a Force Point & get a dark side point, treat the FP as if rolled the max

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your Sith sorcery experimentation has provided you with a method of manipulating the dark side. Once per encounter, when using a Force Point in an act that would give you a dark side point, you may treat the Force Point as though you had rolled the maximum on the die.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Master
talents_list.description: reroll any Dark side skill
talents_list.full_text_description: As Dark Side Adept (see above), except that you can spend a Force Point and keep the better of the two Use the Force checks.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Savant
talents_list.description: 1/encounter return one dark side power to suite without Force Point

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can return one Force power with the [dark side] descriptor to your Force suite without spending a Force Point. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select it, you can use it one additional time per encounter.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Scourge
talents_list.description: extra damage on melee attacks v. Dark Side equal to Cha mod (min +1)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Against creatures with a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher, you deal extra damage on melee attacks equal to your Charisma bonus (minimum +1).

talents_list.name: Dark Side Sense
talents_list.description: may reroll Use the Force check to sense Dark Side
talents_list.full_text_description: Jedi following the path of the sentinel become exceptionally talented at rooting out evil. You may reroll any Use the Force check made to sense the presence and relative location of characters with a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher. You must take the result of the reroll, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Dark Side Talisman
talents_list.description: +2 on one Def against light-side powers

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to imbue a weapon or some other portable object with the dark side of the Force, creating a talisman that grants you protection from the light side. Creating the dark side talisman takes a full-round action. While you wear or carry the talisman, you gain a +2 Force bonus to one of your defenses (Reflex, Fortitude, or Will) against Force powers with the [light side]descriptor. You can have only one dark side talisman active at a given time (though you can have both a dark side talisman and a Force talisman active at the same time), and if your dark side talisman is destroyed, you cannot create another one for 24 hours.

talents_list.name: Dash and Blast
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Dual Weapon Mastery I, Running Attack
talents_list.description: 1/encounter with two pistols can move twice your speed & attack with each
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a full-round action, when you are wielding two pistols, you may move up to twice your speed and make a ranged attack with each pistol. The normal penalties for attacking with two weapons apply to these attacks.

talents_list.name: Dastardly Strike
talents_list.description: Atk against opp denied Dex to Def moves -1 CT
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make a successful attack against an opponent that is denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense , the target moves -1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148).

talents_list.name: Deadly Repercussions
talents_list.description: when you reduce an opponent to 0 hp all opp in LOS of you & target -2 Atk until your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you reduce a target to 0 hit points or move the target to the bottom of the condition track, all your opponents within line of sight of both you and your target take a -2 penalty on attack rolls until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Debilitating Shot
talents_list.description: aim before attacking moves target -1 CT if attack deals damage
talents_list.full_text_description: If you aim before making a ranged attack (see Aim, page 154), you move the target character -1 step along the condition track if the attack deals damage. (SotG) This talent can be used only against characters, not objects or vehicles.

talents_list.name: Deception Awareness
talents_list.description: Will Def +5 v. Deception, UtF replaces Perception to sense deception & influence, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Realizing how the devastating the consequences would have been if the Sith had successfully deceived herand her companions during the Jedi Civil War, Shasa has developed a technique for using the Force to detect deceptions. You gain +5 to your Will Defense against uses of the Deception skill. Additionally, you can make a Use the Force check instead of a Perception check to sense deception and sense influence. You are considered trained in Perception for the purpose of using this talent. If you are entitled to a Perception check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Deceptive Shot
talents_list.description: target in LOS & 6 squares, Deception v. Will, remove Dex to Def until next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: Select one target in line of sight within 6 squares. You can spend two swift actions on the same turn to make a Deception check; if the check result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, the target is denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense against your attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Dedicated Guardian
talents_list.description: 1/enc each for Dedicated Protector: 1. swif to grant Evasion & if has Evasion dam is 1 die less, 2. move down CT for ally as reac, 3. swift to gain flank on target if you are adjacent to both
talents_list.full_text_description: You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: •Blast Shield: Spend a swift action. Until the end of your next turn, the ally who is under the effects of your Dedicated Protector talent is treated as having the Evasion talent for the purposes of determining damage from an area attack. If the ally already has Evasion, the damage from a successful area attack is reduced by 1 die. •Take the Pain: Whenever your Dedicated Protector target would move down the condition track, you can, as a reaction, choose to move the same number of steps down the condition track instead (preventing the ally from moving down the track). •Team Effort: Spend a swift action. Until the end of your next turn, while you are adjacent to your Dedicated Protector target, any enemy that is adjacent to you and to that ally is considered flanked.

talents_list.name: Dedicated Protector
talents_list.description: 1/enc designate ally within 6 sq ally & ally gains +1 Ref Def while adjacent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can designate one ally within 6 squares of you. Until the end of the encounter, that ally gains a +1 morale bonus to Reflex Defense as long as it remains adjacent to you. Any individual can only be the target of this talent once per encounter.

talents_list.name: Deep Space Raider
talents_list.description: 1/enc each: 1. fighting aboard a starship as stan w/ranged atk if hit next turn target must move its spd to sq not adjacent or vehicle disengages from dogfight, 2. as full if pilot move vehicle spd x2 & 1 atk - if hit & deal dam target -2 atk v. you until end of your next turn, 3. make ranged atk w/vehicle if hit & deal dam choose 1 effect until end of next turn - a. 1 weapon doesn't function, b. target's SR 0, c. target's spd reduced to 2
talents_list.full_text_description: Whether you are taking on military targets on behalf of a resistance movement or you are out for personal gain, you are experienced at raiding starships and similar targets. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: • Clear a Path: Your attack forces an enemy to alter course or move out of your way. You must be fighting aboard a starship to use this action. As a standard action, make a ranged attack. If the attack hits, on its next turn your target must move its speed to a square that is not adjacent to you. If the target is an enemy starfighter engaged in a dogfight, the target instead must attempt to disengage from the dogfight. • Covering Fire: You squeeze off several shots as you escape pursuing enemies. As a full-round action, if you are the pilot of a vehicle, you may move the vehicle up to twice its speed and make a single ranged attack with one of the pilot-controlled weapons at any point during that movement. If you hit and deal damage to a vehicle with this attack, the target vehicle takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against your vehicle until the end of your next turn. • Disabling Fire: Make a ranged attack with a vehicle weapon. If you make this attack against a vehicle and hit and deal damage, you can choose one of the following to take effect until the end of your next turn: one of the target’s weapons ceases to function, the target’s SR is reduced to 0, the target’s hyperdrive is disabled, or the target’s speed is reduced to 2 squares.

talents_list.name: Deep-Space Gambit
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when you or vehicle is target of an atk, can force opponent to reroll, must take worse result

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you or a vehicle you occupy are the target of an attack roll, you can force your opponent to reroll the attack. The opponent must take the worse result.

talents_list.name: Defense Boost
talents_list.description: DC 15 Use the Force to gain +1 Fort Def until end of encounter, or DC 20 for +1 all Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can make a DC 15 Use the Force check. If the check succeeds, you gain a +1 Force bonus to your Fortitude Defense until the end of the encounter. Before you make your Use the Force check, you can increase the target number to DC 20 to gain a +1 Force bonus to all your defenses.

talents_list.name: Defensive Acuity
talents_list.description: when you fight defensively you deal +1 die dam with lightsaber & +2 to Block & Deflect

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you take the fight defensively action, you deal +1 die of damage with lightsaber attacks and gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Use the Force checks made to negate an attack with the Block or Deflect talents. These benefits last until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Defensive Circle
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Battle Meditation, Block or Deflect, Jedi Battle Commander
talents_list.description: you & allies affected by Battle Med +2 Ref Def, you +1 on UtF to Block/Deflect for ea adjacent ally

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you and any allies affected by your Battle Meditation gain a +2 insight bonus to Reflex Defense, lasting as long as they are affected by Battle Meditation. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to your Use the Force checks to Block and Deflect (as per the talents) for each adjacent ally wielding a lightsaber.

talents_list.name: Defensive Electronics
talents_list.description: add class level to Will Def if someone tries to reprogram you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You defend your independence from all. When someone tries to reprogram you, add your class level to your Will Defense.

talents_list.name: Defensive Jab
talents_list.description: unarmed & fight defensively make single unarmed atk as free against adjacent
talents_list.full_text_description: When you are unarmed and take the fight defensively action, you can make a single unarmed attack as a free action against an adjacent target.

talents_list.name: Defensive Measures
talents_list.description: all enemies treat your safe zone as difficult terrain

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: All enemies treat your safe zone as difficult terrain.

talents_list.name: Defensive Position
talents_list.description: when you have benefit of cover spend 2 swif to treat as improved cover until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you have the benefit of cover, you can spend two swift actions to treat it as improved cover until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Defensive Protection
talents_list.description: add results of Force Point to any one of your Def or to 1 adjacent ally until your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a reaction and add the results of the Force Point roll to anyone of your defenses, or to one of the defenses of an adjacent ally. This bonus lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Deflect
talents_list.description: negate ranged attack with Use the Force check, DC = Atk roll, -5 every time used in round must have activated lightsaber, aware and not flat-footed, vs. autofire = 1/2 or no damage spend a Force Point for an adjacent character.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you may negate a ranged attack by making a successful Use the Force check. The DC of the skill check is equal to the result of the attack roll you wish to negate, and you take a cumulative -5 penalty on your Use the Force check for every time you have used Block or Deflect since the beginning of your last turn. You may spend a Force Point to use this talent to negate an attack against an adjacent character. You must have a lightsaber drawn and ignited to use this talent, and you must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. You can use this talent to deflect some of the barrage of shots fired from a ranged weapon set on autofire, or the Force lightning Force power. If you succeed on the Use the Force check, you take half damage if the attack hits [[House rule: and you don't move -1 CT from FL if you exceed the roll by 5]] and no damage if the attack misses. This talent cannot be used to negate attacks made by Colossal (frigate) or larger-size vehicles unless the attack is made with a point-defense weapon. [You may stop an attack that rolled a natural 20. You may not use this against an opponent who used a DP to auto-crit.] [[It seems you can't use Block or Deflect while raging. You can Deflect a weapon set for stun, but you cannot Redirect it. You may not use Deflect on most other area weapons, such as grenades and missiles. Successfully Deflecting attacks also negates secondary effects such as splash or talents triggered when an attack hits, such as a gunslinger's Debilitating Shot.]]

talents_list.name: Demand Surrender
talents_list.description: once per encounter, Persuasion if opp has 1/2 hp, vs. Will (+5 if opp higher level), cannot attack unless attacked or allies attacked

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can make a Persuasion check as a standard action to demand surrender from an opponent who has been reduced to one-haIf or less of its hit points. If your check result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, it surrenders to you and your allies, drops any weapons it is holding, and takes no hostile actions. If the target is higher level than you, it gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense. If you or any of your allies attack it, it no longer submits to your will and can act normally. You can only use this talent against a particular target once per encounter. This is a mind-affecting effect. (SotG) Unlike other mind-affecting effects, you need only to hail a vehicle to demand surrender. You can demand surrender of a vehicle that has been reduced to one-half or fewer of its hit points, even if the crew is uninjured. You make your check against the vehicle's commander; all nonunique crews are assumed to have a Will Defense of 10. If the CL of the target vehicle is greater than your heroic level or the CL of your vehicle, the target gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense. You can't use this talent to demand surrender from a vehicle that is more than one size larger than yours under any circumstances-Star Destroyers don't surrender to X-wings.

talents_list.name: Demolitionist
talents_list.description: using Mechanics skill to set explosives = +2 dice dam, take multiple and stack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Mechanics skill to place an explosive device, the explosion deals +2 dice of damage. You may take this talent multiple times; its effects stack.

talents_list.name: Demoralizing Defense
talents_list.description: v. an enemy you just hit with melee atk, takes half dam & takes -5 Atk v. you until next turn, 1 per rnd

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can designate an enemy you have just hit with a melee attack. The enemy takes only half damage from the attack, but takes a -5 penalty on attacks made against you until the end of your next turn. A single target may only be affected by this talent once per round. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Deny Move
talents_list.description: with a crit target cannot move next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: When you score a critical hit with a melee or ranged attack, your target cannot move on its next turn.

talents_list.name: Deployment Tactics
talents_list.description: DC15 Tactics, allies +1 Atk vs. flanked, or +1 Def v. AoO next turn, Born Leader/Battle Analysis +2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your tactical knowledge to direct allies in battle. As a move action, you can make a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check. If the check succeeds, you and any allies that can see, hear, and understand you gain a +1 competence bonus on attack rolls against flanked opponents or a +1 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against attacks of opportunity (your choice). The bonus lasts until the start of your next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect. If you have the Born Leader talent (page 44) or the Battle Analysis talent (page 52), the bonus granted by this talent increases to +2.

talents_list.name: Desperate Measures
talents_list.description: 1/encounter all allies w/in 12 sq & LOS may make an immediate atk at -5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Desperation stems from fear. Once per encounter as a swift action, you instill desperation in all allies within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight, allowing each of them to make an immediate attack at a -5 penalty.

talents_list.name: Destructive Ambusher
talents_list.description: +1 die dam v. prime target until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: After you designate a prime target, you deal + 1 die of damage on attacks against the prime target until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Detective
talents_list.description: DC to locate specific person with Gather Info is -10 & bribe amount & time are half

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled in locating individuals and using research and surveillance to learn some of their most intimate secrets. When you make a Gather Information check to locate an individual, the DC is reduced by 10, and the time and bribery cost are reduced by half.

talents_list.name: Detonate
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Ref Def in 2sq of target of Force blast, they take full or half dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Force blast power, you can spend a Force Point to compare the result of your Use the Force check to the Reflex Defense of all other characters, creatures, and droids within 2 squares of your target. If you exceed the Reflex Defense of those secondary targets, they also take damage from the Force blast, and if you fail to exceed their Reflex Defense, they take half damage instead. This is considered to be an area attack against the secondary targets (but not against the original target).

talents_list.name: Devastating Attack
talents_list.description: opponent's damage threshold is 5 less, single weapon group

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group with which you are proficient. Whenever you make a successful attack against a target using such a weapon, you treat your target's damage threshold as if it were 5 points lower when determining the result of your attack. You may select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, it applies to a different exotic weapon or weapon group. (SotG) If you select heavy weapons as the weapon group these talents apply to, you may use the talents with vehicle weapon attacks. Unleashed: When you make an attack (either as a single attack or part of a full attack action), you can spend a Destiny Point to treat every attack as though it exceeded the target’s damage threshold, regardless of whether or not the attack normally would, until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Devastating Melee Smash
talents_list.description: once per encounter, before making atk, add half level to dam not +1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can attempt a devastating melee smash. You must declare this special melee attack before making the attack roll. If the attack roll succeeds add half your level to the damage instead of the normal +1 for Melee Smash. The damage from this talent does not stack with any damage bonus provided by the Powerful Charge feat. [[Weak talent option: You can declare use of this talent after the attack hits]].

talents_list.name: Device Jammer
talents_list.description: DC20 Mechanics v. item, if successful all items of the type don't function within 12sq, 1 at a time

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can construct a short-range jammer that affects a specific type of electronic device such as a personal shield generator, comlink, computer, or datapad. As a full-round action, you select a particular piece of personal, portable electronic equipment (any item listed as equipment, excluding droids, vehicles, and weapons, that has an electronic component) and make a DC 20 Mechanics check. If the check is successful, all devices of the chosen type cease to function while within 12 squares of your position for the remainder of the encounter. You may only have one jammer (device or droid) active at a time.

talents_list.name: Difficult to Sense
talents_list.description: reroll opposed Use the Force check to conceal presence
talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at concealing your presence from other Force-users. You may reroll any opposed Use the Force check made to conceal your presence from someone who attempts to sense other Force-users, keeping the better result.

talents_list.name: Dig In
talents_list.description: when prone gain concealment unless you move or stand
talents_list.full_text_description: When prone, you can spend a swift action to gain concealment until the start of your next turn. If you stand up or move, you lose this benefit.

talents_list.name: Direct
talents_list.description: return one Force power to any ally within 6 sq & LOS (one ally spent)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can return one spent Force power to the Force suite of any ally within 6 squares of you and in your line of sight. The Force power must have been spent by the ally you designate.

talents_list.name: Direct Fire
talents_list.description: 1/turn designate 1 ally & 1 target w/out cover from you, ally ignores target's cover bonus to Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a swift action, you can designate one ally and one target that does not have cover from you. Until the start of your next turn, the ally you designate ignores that target’s cover bonuses to Reflex Defense.

talents_list.name: Directed Action
talents_list.description: allow 1 droid to make Deception, Mechanics, Persuasion, Pilot, Ride, Treat Injury, or Use Computer check as free, droid replaces mod with your Int mod
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you allow one droid that can hear and understand you to make a Deception, Mechanics, Persuasion, Pilot, Ride, Treat Injury, or Use Computer check immediately as a free action. The droid can replace its relevant ability score modifier for that check with your Intelligence modifier.

talents_list.name: Directed Movement
talents_list.description: allow 1 droid to move its spd & use Acrobatics, Climb, Jump, Stealth or Swim & can replace its mod with your Int mod
talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you allow one droid that can hear and understand you to move up to its speed. The droid can make Acrobatics, Climb, Jump, Stealth, or Swim checks during this movement, and can replace its own relevant ability score modifier for that check with your Intelligence modifier.

talents_list.name: Dirty Fighting
talents_list.description: once per encounter if you damage an opp reduce target's thresh by 2 for encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, if you successfully damage an opponent with a melee or ranged attack, you reduce the target's damage threshold by 2 for the remainder of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Dirty Tactics
talents_list.description: 1/encounter +4 flank bonus to allies in LOS to melee attacks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a standard action, you can grant a tactical advantage to all allies within your line of sight. When any ally flanks an opponent, that ally gains a +4 flanking bonus on melee attack rolls instead of the normal +2 bonus. Allies lose this benefit immediately if line of sight is broken or if you are unconscious or dead, or at the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Dirty Tricks
talents_list.description: can use feint as 2swif against opp you threaten

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are not above using a few dirty tricks to win. You can use the feint application of the Deception skill as two swift actions against an opponent you threaten.

talents_list.name: Disarm and Engage
talents_list.description: When successfully disarm, make immediate free -5 atk w/ disarmed weapon or -10 if not proficient
talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully disarm an opponent, you can make an immediate free attack with the disarmed weapon at a -5 penalty. If you are not proficient with the weapon, you take the penalty for non proficiency as well.

talents_list.name: Disarming Attack
talents_list.description: ignore target's armor bonus to Ref Def when disarming, 1/encounter as free +10 Atk when disarming
talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group with which you are proficient. You ignore a target's armor bonus to Reflex Defense when disarming with such a weapon. Additionally, as a free action, once per encounter, you can grant yourself a +10 bonus on your attack roll when attempting to disarm an opponent while using such a weapon.

talents_list.name: Discblade Arc
talents_list.description: make area atk with discblade v. 3 targets if all in PB range, make 1 attack roll

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you can make an area attack with your discblade, striking three targets, all of which must be within point blank range for your discblade. This attack uses the area attack rules; you make one attack roll and apply the result to every target you designate.

talents_list.name: Disciplined Strike
talents_list.description: area effect can exclude a number of targets = to Wis mod

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use a Force power that has an area effect (such as Force slam), you may exclude a certain number of targets from the effects of that power. The number of targets that you may exclude in this manner is equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

talents_list.name: Disciplined Trickery
talents_list.description: 1/turn allow 1 ally w/in 12 sq to reroll Deception or Stealth
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn as a reaction, you allow one ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight to reroll one Deception or Stealth check, but the ally must keep the second result, even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Disruptive
talents_list.description: suppress morale and insight bonuses until your next turn to all in LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: By spending two swift actions, you can use your knack for causing trouble and instigating chaos to disrupt your enemies. Until the start of your next turn, you suppress all morale and insight bonuses applied to enemies in your line of sight.

talents_list.name: Distant Command
talents_list.description: does not lose Born Leader if out of LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any ally who gains the benefit of your Born Leader talent (see above) does not lose the benefit if their line of sight to you is broken.  This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Distant Discblade Throw
talents_list.description: treat thrown discblade as pistol for range

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a discblade, you treat it as a pistol (instead of a thrown weapon) for the purpose of determining range.

talents_list.name: Distracting Apparition
talents_list.description: any enemy w/in 3 sq -2 Will Def & -2 atk v. you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you have a manifested guardian spirit, the spirit also discourages your enemies and distracts them from their goals. Any enemy within 3 squares of your guardian spirit takes a -2 penalty to Will Defense and a -2 penalty on attack rolls against you.

talents_list.name: Distracting Attack
talents_list.description: if do dam, compare Atk to Will Def, if meet or exceed target -2 Ref Def until end of your turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you deal damage to a target with a melee or ranged attack, compare the attack roll to the target's Will Defense. If the attack roll also meets or exceeds the target's Will Defense, the target takes a -2 penalty to Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Distracting Shout
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when ally attacked, your Deception check replaces their Def, if fail not used

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction to one of your allies being attacked, you can make a Deception check, replacing the defense scores of that ally with the result of your Deception check for the resolution of that attack. If any defense scores are higher than the Deception check result, your ally can use that defense score instead. If the attack still hits, this does not count as the one use per encounter of this talent.

talents_list.name: Distress to Discord
talents_list.description: when ally in LOS takes 2nd Wind all enemies within 2sq loses Dex to Def until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You encourage your allies to sow discord among your enemies by fighting with renewed vigor. Whenever an ally within your line of sight takes its second wind, all enemies within 2 squares of that ally lose their Dexterity bonuses to Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Djem So
talents_list.description: once per round if hit in melee, make an immediate attack against opponent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round when an opponent hits you with a melee attack, you may spend a Force Point as a reaction to make an immediate attack against that opponent. [[Weak talent options: (1) once per encounter, you may use this talent without spending a FP. OR (2) You treat the Djem So attack as an AoO or an immediate free attack where you resolve the Djem So attack and damage first before resolving the opponent’s damage OR (3) replacing the wording on Djem So to read something like: "You can use the Riposte talent once per round instead of once per encounter.]]

talents_list.name: Dogfight Gunner
talents_list.description: no penalty with vehicle weapons even if not pilot

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: While your vehicle is engaged in a dogfight, you take no penalty on your attack rolls with vehicle weapons even if you are not the pilot.

talents_list.name: Done It All
talents_list.description: Choose two talents you meet reqs. Spend FP to gain access 1/turn until the end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you select this talent, choose two talents (from any non prestige class) that you do not possess but for which you meet the prerequisites. Once per turn on your turn, you can spend a Force Point as a free action to gain the benefits of one of those talents until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Double Agent
talents_list.description: when you roll Initiative & Deception v. Will Def in LOS, cannot be attacked until you harm an ally

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you roll Initiative at the beginning of combat, also roll a Deception check, comparing the result to the Will Defense of all enemies in line of sight. If your Deception check is successful, that target cannot attack you and does not believe you to be an enemy (though they do not consider you an ally) while this effect is active. If you attack or otherwise obviously harm or hinder a target under the effect of this talent, or one of that target's allies, this effect ends. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Double Up
talents_list.description: 1/enc forgo extra swif to atk, if hit & dam w/ranged count your & ally's atk as one for DR/SR/thresh

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, whenever you would use Seize the Moment, you can forgo the extra swift action to make an immediate melee or ranged attack against the damaged opponent. If your attack is a ranged attack that hits and deals damage, you treat the damage dealt by you and your ally as though it was one attack for the purposes of overcoming DR, SR, and determining whether the damage exceeded the target's damage threshold.

talents_list.name: Drain Force
talents_list.description: once per encounter when you damage a Force-sensitive opp regain 1 force power & target loses 1 FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction when you damage a Force-sensitive opponent, the dark taint of your power allows you to sap some of the opponent's strength and covert it to personal power, regaining one spent Force power. Additionally, the target loses one Force Point.

talents_list.name: Drain Knowledge
talents_list.description: drain knowledge by touch (DC=Will Def), gain trained skill or SF if own skill, target down CT, DSP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can spend a Force Point to drain the knowledge of an enemy you touch; you must succeed on a Use the Force check (DC equal to the target's Will Defense) to activate this talent, and if you fail to activate this talent, you may not try again on the same target for one day. If successful, you immediately become trained in one skill that the target is trained in; if you are already trained in that skill, you instead gain Skill Focus in that skill. This training or focus lasts for one day. Additionally, your target moves -1 persistent step along the condition track, and the persistent condition can be removed only by resting for 8 hours. Additionally, you can choose to instead sift through the mind of the target, looking for a specific piece of knowledge or information. Doing so requires you to make a Perception check against the target's Will Defense; success indicates that you pull the relevant information from the target's mind. When you do so, you do not gain the training or focus normally granted by this talent, but otherwise the talent functions as normal. Using this talent increases your Dark Side Score by 1.

talents_list.name: Draw Fire
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will, cannot attack anyone within 6 squares if you don't have cover

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can distract opponents and convince them that you are the most tempting (or most dangerous) target in an area. As a swift action, make a Persuasion check and compare the result to the Will Defense of all opponents within line of sight. If the check result exceeds an opponent's Will Defense, that opponent cannot attack any character within 6 squares of you until the start of your next turn as long as you do not have cover against that opponent. (The affected opponent may still attack you, however.) (SotG) If you are the pilot of a vehicle, you may use this talent to protect allied vehicles. You may use it to protect vehicles no more than one size category larger than your own.

talents_list.name: Draw a Bead
talents_list.description: 1/rnd designate target not in PB, with successful ranged atk add your Dex mod to dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round, you can spend a single swift action to designate a single enemy who is not within point-blank range. When you make a successful ranged attack roll that deals damage against the designated enemy, add your Dexterity bonus (minimum +1) to the damage roll. This effect lasts until the target is unconscious, dead, or leaves your line of sight. You can have only one enemy designated in this manner.

talents_list.name: Dread
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def of Hunter's Target, opp takes -5 on Will Def as long as keep LOS

effects.target_description: will def as long as keep los

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can instill bone-chilling fear in an opponent whom you selected for Hunter's Target. Make a Persuasion check against your opponent's Will Defense. If you equal or exceed your opponent's Will Defense, that opponent takes a -5 penalty to Will Defense. This is a mind-affecting effect. The penalty remains as long as you have line of sight to your opponent and immediately ends if the line of sight is broken.

talents_list.name: Droid Defense
talents_list.description: all droid allies who can hear you, bonus to one Def = Int mod (you choose Def)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can transmit tactical information to all droid allies that can hear and understand you, granting them a bonus equal to your Intelligence modifier to one of their defenses (your choice) until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Droid Duelist
talents_list.description: opponent is flat-footed against your next attack with a lightsaber before end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are wielding a lightsaber, you can spend a Force Point as a swift action to cause an opponent to be flat-footed against your next attack made with a lightsaber before the end of your turn.

talents_list.name: Droid Expert
talents_list.description: repair droids +1 hp for every point over Mechanics DC 20

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you repair a droid, you repair 1 additional hit point for each point by which your Mechanics check beats the base DC of 20.

talents_list.name: Droid Jammer
talents_list.description: Mechanics v. droid's Will Def within 6sq, if successful droid can take only swif actions, 1 at a time

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can construct a short-range jammer that affects droids. As a full-round action, you make a Mechanics check to build the jammer. When a droid comes within 6 squares of you, compare the result of your Mechanics check to the droid's Will Defense. If your check result equals or exceeds the droid's Will Defense, the droid can take only swift actions as long as it remains within the radius of the jammer. Droids that are immune to the effect of a restraining bolt are immune to the effect of this talent. The jammer functions for the remainder of the encounter. You may only have one jammer (device or droid) active at a time.

talents_list.name: Droid Mettle
talents_list.description: 1/turn single droid ally in LOS gains hp = 10 + CL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action once per turn, you can designate a single droid ally within your line of sight. That droid ally gains bonus hit points equal to 10 + your class level.

talents_list.name: Droid Smash
talents_list.description: add 2x Str bonus to melee damage rolls with a weapon in one hand

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your mechanical strength when wielding a melee weapon. You add 2 x your Strength bonus to melee damage rolls when wielding a weapon in one hand.

talents_list.name: Dual Weapon Flourish I
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Dual Weapon Mastery I, Weapon Finesse
talents_list.description: with 2 light melee or lightsabers & single atk with one you get free atk with other
talents_list.full_text_description: When wielding only two light melee weapons or two lightsabers, whenever you make a single attack as a standard action with one weapon you can make a single attack with the other weapon as a free action against the same target. You apply the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons with this attack.

talents_list.name: Dual Weapon Flourish II
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Dual Weapon Mastery I, II, Dual Weapon Flourish I, Master of Elegance, Weapon Finesse
talents_list.description: with 2 light melee or lightsabers make full atk as stan as long as you use both weapons, 1 per turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are wielding only two light melee weapons or two lightsabers, once per turn on your turn, you can make a full attack as a standard action instead of a full-round action, provided you attack with both weapons during the attack. You apply the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons to both of these attacks.

talents_list.name: Dull the Pain
talents_list.description: DC15 Treat Injury check to move adjacent living creature +1 CT
talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you can make a DC 15 Treat Injury check on an adjacent living creature to move it +1 step along the condition track.

talents_list.name: Dumb Luck
talents_list.description: each 1/enc after you Atk: if dam target +2 Ref Def v., or if damaged move 2sq, if you miss +2 next Atk
