talents_list.full_text_description: You are possessed of incredible luck and an uncanny ability to succeed where others would fail. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a standard action: •Elude Enemy: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If you damage the target, you gain a +2 bonus to your Reflex Defense against this target until the beginning of your next turn. •Escape: Make a single melee or ranged attack against any target within your range. If that target successfully damages you before the start of your next turn, you can immediately move 2 squares as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. •Make your Own Luck: Make a single melee or ranged attack against a target within range. If you miss this target, you gain a +2 bonus on your next attack roll.

talents_list.name: Durable
talents_list.description: first time in enc moved to bottom of track you can stop at -10 & can spend FP to move just -1 CT not multiple
talents_list.full_text_description: You are particularly durable and continue to function when a lesser droid would become disabled. The first time during an encounter that you would be moved to the bottom of the condition track by any effect, you instead stop at the -10 step. Additionally, if a single attack causes you to move multiple steps down the condition track, you can spend a Force Point as a reaction to only move -1 step down the condition track.

talents_list.name: Earth Buckle
talents_list.description: create 3x3 sq difficult terrain around you & you ignore difficult terrain you create

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to create a 3x3 square area of difficult terrain centered on you. You ignore any penalties for moving on difficult terrain that you create using this talent.

talents_list.name: Easy Prey
talents_list.description: when you successfully hit an enemy you can reduce dam by half to deny target Dex to Ref Def v. your atks until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make an attack as a standard action and successfully hit an enemy, you can choose to reduce the damage you deal by half. That target is then denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense against your attacks until the end of your next turn. [[House rule: you can use this with area attacks, however, if you miss the target's Ref, then you cannot use it because you will not deal any damage at all. We will interpret a missed area attack dealing half damage as dealing no damage.]]

talents_list.name: Echani Expertise
talents_list.description: unarmed increase crit range by 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When making an unarmed attack, you extend your critical threat range by 1 (for example, 19-20 instead of 20). However, anything other than a natural 20 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll anything other than a natural 20 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Echoes in the Force
talents_list.description: use farseeing on a location & standing in location viewed, DC 20 + 1 per day into the past

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the farseeing power on a location instead of on an individual creature, peering into the location’s past to view events that occurred there. Unlike the normal use of the farseeing power, you are actually looking into the location’s past (at a time you designate), and you must be standing in the location being viewed. The target DC for your Use the Force check is 20, +1 for each day into the past that you attempt to scry. When you look into the past, you need only specify a time in a number of days, as you can sense tremors in the Force that focus your visions on meaningful events that day.

talents_list.name: Educated
talents_list.description: make Knowledge untrained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Thanks to your well-rounded education, you may make any Knowledge skill check untrained to answer a question that requires expert knowledge. [[*Weak talent option: In addition, you can spend a full round action to make the Knowledge check and add a +5 competence bonus to your check.]]

talents_list.name: Electronic Forgery
talents_list.description: Use Computer replaces Deception with forged documents

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Use Computer modifier in place of your Deception modifier to create a deceptive appearance with forged electronic documents.

talents_list.name: Electronic Sabotage
talents_list.description: Use Computer result replaces computer's Will Def to change its attitude & considered unfriendly

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You excel at causing havoc with computers and electronics. As a standard action, you can lock down a computer terminal by making a Use Computer check, making it potentially difficult for anyone else to access. That computer is considered unfriendly to anyone other than you who attempts to use it, and the result of your Use Computer check replaces the computer's Will Defense on an attempt to change its attitude. This effect ends if anyone else succeeds in adjusting the computer's attitude to indifferent. You cannot take 20 on this Use Computer check.

talents_list.name: Electronic Trail
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Nowhere to Hide, trained Use Comp
talents_list.description: once you've found a target w/Gather Info, 1/day gain info on target if have network or HoloNet

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once you have located a target using Gather Information, you can track its electronic presence. Once per day, you receive a catalog of the target’s electronic trail, which includes the amount and location of credits spent, the routes of any public transportation taken, and the sites viewed on the HoloNet while the target was logged in using its primary identity. To receive this information, you must have access to a computer or data pad plus access to a network or the HoloNet. The electronic trail does not reveal bank balances or other secret information, which requires a separate Gather Information check.

talents_list.name: Elusive Dogfighter
talents_list.description: opposed pilot check, opponents in dogfight are -10 to Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When engaged in a dogfight, any enemy pilot engaged in the same dogfight takes a -10 penalty on attack rolls when you succeed on the opposed Pilot check (see Attacking in a Dogfight, CR page 171).

talents_list.name: Elusive Target
talents_list.description: if in a melee, ranged attacks are -10 not -5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When fighting an opponent or multiple opponents in melee, other opponents attempting to target you with ranged attacks take a -5 penalty. This penalty is in addition to the normal -5 penalty for firing into melee (see Shooting or Throwing into a Melee, CR page 161), making the penalty to target you -10. [This talent grants no benefit when you are attacked by autofire and area attacks. Area attacks target the area, not the opponent.]

talents_list.name: Embrace the Dark Side
talents_list.description: reroll Dark side skills/Use the Force, no longer able to use light side
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use a Force power with the [dark side] descriptor, you may reroll your Use the Force check, but you must accept the result of the reroll even if it is worse. Upon choosing this talent, you can no longer use Force powers with the [light side] descriptor (must take re-roll).

talents_list.name: Emergency Team
talents_list.description: allies automatically aid another

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at working on and managing an emergency medical team. Allies automatically succeed on aid another attempts when assisting you with Treat Injury checks. [[Weak talent option: Additionally grant +2 insight bonus when aiding another]]

talents_list.name: Empower Siang Lance
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Siang Lance Mastery, base attack bonus +7.
talents_list.description: +1 die damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to empower a siang lance, which takes a full-round action. After the siang lance is empowered, it deals an additional die of damage when you wield it. Others who wield the weapon do not gain the bonus damage die.

talents_list.name: Empower Weapon
talents_list.description: +1 die damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may spend a Force Point to empower a melee weapon. Empowering the weapon takes a full-round action. From that point forward, the empowered weapon deals an additional die of damage, but only when wielded by you. (For example, an empowered lightsaber deals 3d8 points of damage instead of 2d8 points of damage.) Others who wield the weapon do not gain the bonus damage die.

talents_list.name: Enemy Tactics
talents_list.description: when an enemy within 12sq & LOS gains a bonus, you also gain that bonus & any limitations

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an enemy within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight receives an insight or morale bonus from any source, you can also gain that bonus, subject to all the same limitations as the bonus provided to that enemy.

talents_list.name: Engineer
talents_list.description: trained in Mechanics, time reduced 25% when installing new systems to vehicle

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are trained in the Mechanics skill. Additionally, when installing new systems into a vehicle, the efficiency of your designs reduces the time it takes to install the system by 25%.

talents_list.name: Enhance Cover
talents_list.description: 1 ally in LOS & has cover is considered to have improved cover as long as they still have cover

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can designate a single ally within your line of sight who has cover from one or more enemies. That ally is considered instead to have improved cover against those enemies until the start of your next turn as long as the ally still has cover.

talents_list.name: Enhanced Danger Sense
talents_list.description: +10 Perception to avoid being surprised, spend FP to act in surprise round even if surprised

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +10 bonus on Perception checks made to avoid being surprised. Additionally, you can spend a Force Point to act in the surprise round, even if you are surprised.

talents_list.name: Enhanced Manipulation
talents_list.description: take 10 on Dex based skill checks even if you normally could not
talents_list.full_text_description: You have improved appendage manipulation routines. You can take 10 when making any Dexterity-based skill check, even if you are threatened or would not normally be able to take 10.

talents_list.name: Enhanced Vision
talents_list.description: Perception as swif not stan

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When actively looking for hidden enemies, you can make a Perception check as a swift action instead of a standard action.

talents_list.name: Entangler
talents_list.description: When grabbing, you take -2 to attacks not -5, target takes -5 to all attacks

effects.target_description: attacks not -5, target takes -5 to all

talents_list.full_text_description: When grabbing a target, you take a -2 penalty to your attack roll (instead of the normal -5 penalty). Until the target breaks the grab, it takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls, including those made with natural and light weapons (instead of the normal -2 penalty).

talents_list.name: Entreat Aid
talents_list.description: 1/turn one adjacent ally to aid another as reac to assist you if they have not aided already

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn as a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to let one adjacent ally use the aid another action (as a reaction) to assist you with a skill check. You must make the skill check before the end of your turn, or the benefit of the aid another action is lost. An ally that has already used the aid another action to assist you since the end of your last turn may not be targeted by this talent.

talents_list.name: Entreat Beast
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will Def of indifferent or better beast to perform a minor task within 30 sq, see J18

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Force to convince a small beast to carry objects, deliver messages, or perform other minor tasks for you. If you are near a beast that is at least indifferent to you (whether this be a pet you bring with you or a beast encountered in the wild), you can make a Use the Force check against the beast’s Will Defense as a swift action. If your skill check equals or exceeds the beast’s Will Defense, the beast performs one task for you from the following list: deliver one object from your person to another target within 30 squares of you; retrieve one unattended object within 30 squares of it and in its line of sight and bring it to you; or press a button, pull a lever, or otherwise perform some minor activation of an unattended item within 30 squares.

talents_list.name: Environmentally Shielded
talents_list.description: +5 Fort Def against environmental hazards

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +5 equipment bonus to your Fortitude Defense against environmental hazards, including extreme atmospheric conditions and corrosion.

talents_list.name: Equilibrium
talents_list.description: remove debilitating condition affecting you and return to normal, inc. up to top of CT
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to remove all debilitating and persistent conditions (including poison and disease) affecting you and return to a normal state at the top of the condition track.

talents_list.name: Escort Fighter
talents_list.description: 1 adjacent ally if you move that ally moves & ends adjacent, can't exceed ally's move
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a swift action to designate one adjacent ally. Until the start of your next turn, if you move, that ally can also move the same number of squares, provided that the ally ends its movement adjacent to you. You cannot move a distance greater than the ally’s speed.

talents_list.name: Escort Pilot
talents_list.description: +10 threshold of you and ally when adjacent to Colossal or smaller ally

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When a vehicle that you are piloting is adjacent to a vehicle of Colossal size or smaller that is piloted by an ally, both vehicles gain a +10 bonus to their damage thresholds.

talents_list.name: Esoteric Technique
talents_list.description: when you spend a Force Point to activate a technique or secret you gain hp = 10 + class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you spend a Force Point to activate a Force technique or Force secret, you gain bonus hit points equal to 10 + your class level until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Etiquette
talents_list.description: when change attitude, adjust one additional step

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you succeed on a Persuasion check to change attitude, you adjust the target's attitude by one additional step.

talents_list.name: Evasion
talents_list.description: if hit with area attack, take half or no damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are hit by an area attack (see Area Attacks, page 155), you take half damage if the attack hit you. If the area attack misses you, you take no damage. [You may use both Deflect and Evasion against an attack. It does not deal 1/4 damage, it negates the remainder altogether.] (SotG) If you are the pilot, this talent applies to your vehicle.

talents_list.name: Excellent Kit
talents_list.description: all gear you purchase has +50% hp & +5 DR more & +2 Mechanics check made with objects

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You always make sure that your allies have the best gear available. Whenever you purchase weapons, armor, or other equipment (either legally or through the black market), all gear you purchase has 50% more hit points than normal and has 5 more DR than normal. In addition, whenever one of your allies makes a Mechanics check on an object that you purchased, that ally gains a +2 equipment bonus to the check.

talents_list.name: Exceptional Skill
talents_list.description: when you roll a nat 2-7, treat as 8.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you select this talent, choose one skill. Whenever you roll a skill check with that skill, a result of 2-7 on the die is always treated as though you had rolled an 8. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different skill to gain the benefits of this talent.

talents_list.name: Exotic Weapon Mastery
talents_list.description: proficient with any exotic weapon FEAT even if don't possess

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are considered proficient with any exotic weapon, even if you don't possess the appropriate Exotic Weapon Proficiency feat.

talents_list.name: Exotic Weapons Master
talents_list.description: treats all exotic weapons as a single weapon group

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You treat all exotic weapons as a single weapon group (exotic weapons). If you already have feats or talents that grant proficiency with or augment the use of one exotic weapon, those feats grant proficiency with or augment all exotic weapons. For example, if you already had Exotic Weapon Proficiency (shyarn) and Weapon Focus (shyarn) you now how Weapon Proficiency (exotic weapons) and Weapon Focus (exotic weapons), and the effects of both feats apply to all exotic weapons.

talents_list.name: Expanded Horizon
talents_list.description: with Search Your Feelings can sense consequences 1 hour in future, spend FP for 8 hours, DP 24 hrs

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the Search Your Feelings application of the Use the Force skill, you can sense the consequences of your actions out to 1 hour into the future (instead of the normal 10 minutes). You can spend a Force Point when you do so to expand this window out to 8 hours, or a Destiny Point to expand this window out to 24 hours.

talents_list.name: Expanded Sensors
talents_list.description: if you or droid allies has LOS & is aware of a target, all droid allies have LOS to target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you or any of your droid allies has line of sight to and is aware of a target, all droid allies that can hear and understand you are also considered to have line of sight (but not necessarily line of effect) to that target.

talents_list.name: Expedient Mending
talents_list.description: can mend a damaged or disabled biotech device as stan not full

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can temporarily mend a damaged or disabled biotech device using the Treat Injury skill (see page 32) as a standard action instead of a full-round action.

talents_list.name: Experienced Brawler
talents_list.description: each 1/enc after you Atk: +5 dodge, or +5 Fort or Will Def, or move 2 sq w/out Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to fight when the odds are against you. You can use each of the following actions as a standard action once per encounter. •Avoid Attack: Make a single melee attack against an opponent within your reach. Until the beginning of your next turn, you gain a +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against a single attack as a reaction. •Fortified Mind: Make a single melee attack against an opponent within your reach. Until the beginning of your next turn, you gain a +5 bonus to Fortitude or Will Defense against a single attack as a reaction. •Focused Stance: Make a single melee attack against an opponent within your reach. At any time until the beginning of your next turn, as a reaction, you can move up to 2 squares. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Expert Grappler
talents_list.description: +2 opposed Grapple checks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 competence bonus on opposed grapple checks [not the attack roll needed to initiate the grapple]

talents_list.name: Expert Gunner
talents_list.description: +1 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls made using vehicle weapons.

talents_list.name: Expert Rider
talents_list.description: reroll Ride
talents_list.full_text_description: You can reroll any Ride check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Expert Shaper
talents_list.description: reroll Treat Injury to repair or modify biotech
talents_list.full_text_description: You may reroll any Treat Injury check made to repair or modify a biotech object, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Expert Tracker
talents_list.description: no penalty on Survival checks to track at normal speed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take no penalty on Survival checks made to follow tracks while moving your normal speed. (Without this talent, you take a -5 penalty on Survival checks made to follow tracks while moving your normal speed.)

talents_list.name: Exploit Weakness
talents_list.description: when you use Assault Tactics, target takes cumulative -1 Ref Def each time damaged (max -5)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Assault Tactics talent (see page 221 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) on an enemy, the target takes a cumulative -1 penalty to Reflex Defense each time it is damaged by one of your allies (maximum -5). This penalty applies until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Exposing Strike
talents_list.description: when you dam opp w/lightsaber, can spend FP to make opponent flat-footed until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a lightsaber to deal damage to a target, you can spend a Force Point to make that target flat-footed until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Extended Ambush
talents_list.description: during surprise rnd if make ranged atk v. surprised aim as free
talents_list.full_text_description: During a surprise round, if you make a ranged attack against a target that is surprised, you can aim at that target as a free action.

talents_list.name: Extended Critical Range (heavy weapons)
talents_list.description: weapon's crit range extended by 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are using a heavy weapon, you extend the weapon's critical range by 1 (for example, 19-20 instead of 20). However, anything other than a natural 20 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll anything other than a natural 20 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Extended Critical Range (rifles)
talents_list.description: weapon's crit range extended by 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are using a rifle, you extend the weapon's critical range by 1 (for example, 19-20 instead of 20). However, anything other than a natural 20 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll anything other than a natural 20 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Extended Critical Range (simple weapons)
talents_list.description: weapon's crit range extended by 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you attack with a simple weapon, you extend the weapon’s critical range by 1 (for example, 19-20 instead of 20). However, anything other than a natural 20 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll anything other than a natural 20 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Extended Threat
talents_list.description: threaten all squares w/in 2sq radius w/ranged weapon eligible for Atk of Opp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When using a ranged weapon eligible to make attacks of opportunity, you threaten all squares within a 2-square radius.

talents_list.name: Extra First Aid
talents_list.description: you can perform first aid one additional time a day on a target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the first aid application of the Treat Injury skill one additional time per day on a target that has already received first aid for the day.

talents_list.name: Extreme Effort
talents_list.description: +5 Str check in same round

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend two swift actions to gain a +5 bonus on a single Strength check or Strength-based skill check (climb, jump, swim) made during the same round. Unleashed: When you use the Extreme Effort talent, you can spend a Destiny Point to increase the bonus provided by the talent to +20.

talents_list.name: Extreme Explosion
talents_list.description: increase blast radius by 1 square

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to set large charges and use dozens of charges for extremely large explosions. You increase the blast radius of any mines or explosives by 1 square.

talents_list.name: Face the Foe
talents_list.description: +1 atk v. target if you do not have cover from target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you do not have cover from a target, you gain a +1 morale bonus to attack rolls against that target.

talents_list.name: Fade Away
talents_list.description: 1/turn when damaged by atk, move half speed with no Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn when you are damaged by an enemy’s attack, as a reaction you can move up to half your speed. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Fade Out
talents_list.description: Stealth replaces Deception to create diversion to hide, +5 if trained in Deception

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to make yourself scarce when dealing with suspicious or hostile beings. You can use your Stealth skill, not Deception, to create a diversion to hide (see page 73 of the Saga Edition core rulebook). If you are trained in the Deception skill, you gain a +5 bonus to your skill check for the purposes of creating a diversion.

talents_list.name: Fall Back
talents_list.description: all squad members move 2 sq w/no atk of opp (squad = you & # = or less than cl + Cha mod, must be on foot, have LOS & be able to communicate)
talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you can enable each member of your squad to immediately move two squares. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Familiar Enemies
talents_list.description: apply familiar foe to 2nd target, spend single full-rnd observing if can see both

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can apply your familiar foe bonus against a second enemy. If you can see both enemies simultaneously in the same round, you need to spend only a single full-round action observing them. Otherwise, you must spend a separate full-round action on each enemy.

talents_list.name: Familiar Situation
talents_list.description: apply familiar foe to your Fort & Will Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can apply your familiar foe bonus to your Fortitude and Will Defenses against attacks and actions taken against you by the target of your familiar foe special quality.

talents_list.name: Fast Attack Specialist
talents_list.description: 1/enc w/Gargantuan or smaller vehicle make full atk as stan, spend FP for 1 additional time/enc

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when piloting a vehicle of Gargantuan size or smaller, you can make a full attack as a standard action. You can spend a Force Point to use this action one additional time in an encounter.

talents_list.name: Fast Repairs
talents_list.description: jury-rig = hp for vehicle = to result of Mechanics check

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you jury-rig an object or vehicle, the vehicle gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the result of your Mechanics check. Damage is subtracted from these temporary hit points first, and temporary hit points go away at the conclusion of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Fast Talker
talents_list.description: once per day take 20 on Deception check as stan when attempting to deceive

effects.target_description: deception check as stan when attempting to deceive

talents_list.full_text_description: Smugglers must be quick to explain discrepancies in their cover stories. Once per day, you can take 20 on a Deception check as a standard action when attempting to deceive.

talents_list.name: Fear Me
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Inspire Fear I & II, Attract Minion
talents_list.description: 1/encounter if minion down CT you can reduce by 1 & target regains hp = your HL, unless 0 hp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Such is the fear you instill in your minions that when in your presence, they would rather die than disappoint you. Once per encounter, as a reaction to one of your minions being moved down the condition track, you can reduce the number of steps the minion moves down the condition track by 1. Additionally, the target regains hit points equal to your heroic level. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points or moved to the bottom of the condition track, you cannot use this talent on that target.

talents_list.name: Feared Warrior
talents_list.description: when you reduce enemy to 0hp, Persuasion v. targets in 6sq, -2 Atk rest of encounter (once only)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your abilities on the battlefield are well known and feared. When you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points with an attack, you can make a Persuasion check as a free action against all targets within 6 squares. If your Persuasion check exceeds a target's Will Defense, that target takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls for the remainder of the encounter. This talent affects any given target only once per encounter. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

talents_list.name: Fearless Leader
talents_list.description: +5 Will vs. fear if in LOS and N conscious

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can provide a courageous example for your allies. For the remainder of the encounter, your allies receive a +5 morale bonus to their Will Defense against any fear effect. Your allies lose this benefit if they lose line of sight to you, or if you are killed or knocked unconscious. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Fearsome
talents_list.description: opponents level equal or lower to your heroic level within 6sq -1 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your reputation precedes you, striking fear in your target. Any opponent within 6 squares whose level is equal to or less than your heroic level takes a -1 penalty on attack rolls made against you.

talents_list.name: Feed Information
talents_list.description: grant one enemy +1 Atk, one ally gets +2 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can grant one enemy a +1 bonus on its next attack roll made before the beginning of your next turn. Additionally, until the beginning of your next turn, you can designate one ally who receives a +2 bonus on its next attack roll.

talents_list.name: Feel the Force
talents_list.description: ignore all concealment for 1 minute

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can spend a Force Point to ignore all concealment for 1 minute.

talents_list.name: Ferocious Assault
talents_list.description: 1/enc w/autofire atk treat atk as 6 sq cone, consumes 20 shots

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when making an autofire attack, you can treat the attack as a 6 square cone. Making this attack consumes 20 shots from the weapon’s power pack. [[Weak talent option: You can use this talent with the Burst Fire feat.]]

talents_list.name: Field Detection
talents_list.description: DC15 can detect presence, general strength, & origin of energy fields within 12sq, reduce shields by 5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, make a DC 15 Use the Force check. If the check succeeds, you can detect the presence, general strength, and origin (or direction of origin if the source is out of range) of electromagnetic and energy fields within 12 squares of you. You can also determine the type of field, allowing you to detect communications devices, sensors, and other electronic equipment. When dealing damage to a person or droid using a personal shield, or to a vehicle with shields active, a successful check allows you to detect minute fluctuations in the shield, reducing their SR by -5 against your attacks until the end of your turn.

talents_list.name: Field Tactics
talents_list.description: DC15 Tactics, allies w/in 10 squares get +10 Cover bonus if in cover, until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to use existing terrain to best advantage. By using a move action, you can make a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check. If the check succeeds, you and all allies within 10 squares of you can use whatever cover is available to gain a +10 cover bonus to Reflex Defense (instead of the normal +5 cover bonus). Allies must be able to hear and understand you to gain this benefit, and the bonus lasts until the start of your next turn. This talent provides no benefit to anyone who doesn't have cover. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Fight to the Death
talents_list.description: 1/encounter all allies in 6 sq heal hp = your HL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a swift action, you can fill your companions with renewed vigor. All allies within 6 squares of you heal damage equal to your heroic level.

talents_list.name: Find Openings
talents_list.description: if missed by an atk, +2 on next atk before end of next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are missed by an attack, you gain a +2 morale bonus to your next attack roll before the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Find an Opening
talents_list.description: forgo extra swif action to aim with 1 swif on your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you would use Seize the Moment, you can forgo the swift action to be able to aim as a single swift action on your next turn.

talents_list.name: Findsman Ceremonies
talents_list.description: 1/day 10 min spend FP & can reroll Perception, Stealth, farseeing, Atk roll, regain unspent FP
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes performing rituals that enhance your connection with the Force, receiving visions and portents as a result. At that time, you can spend any number of Force Points in the performance of the ritual, up to the total number you have remaining. For the remainder of the day, whenever you make a Perception or Stealth check, make a Use the Force check to use the farseeing Force power, or make an attack roll, you can choose to reroll but must keep the second result, even if it is worse. You may do this a number of times per day equal to the number of Force Points you spent during the casting of the ritual. At the end of the day, you regain Force Points equal to the number of rerolls you have remaining

talents_list.name: Findsman's Foresight
talents_list.description: can roll two dice for Perception to avoid surprise & keep better

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The visions you receive sometimes provide clues about dangerous situations. Whenever you make a Perception check to avoid surprise, you may roll two dice and keep the better result.

talents_list.name: Fire at Will
talents_list.description: you and 1 follower can make ranged atk v. target in LOS with you each taking -5 on atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you and one of your followers can make a ranged attack against one target (each) in line of sight. You each take a -5 penalty to your attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Flanking Fire
talents_list.description: if flanked & with two pistols, attack flankers as stan instead of full, must attack two targets

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are flanked by two (or more) opponents and are wielding two pistols, you can make a full attack action as a standard action instead of a full-round action. This is provided that you target only opponents that flank you and attack at least two targets.

talents_list.name: Flee
talents_list.description: designate single opp & move away +2 speed, no Atk of Opp from that opponent
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can designate a single opponent and move up to your speed away from that opponent; this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from that opponent, though it might provoke as normal for all other opponents. In addition, your speed increases by 2 until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Fleet Deployment
talents_list.description: a number of vehicles = to your class level & LOS may move a number of squares = speed
talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you can designate a number of vehicles equal to your class level and within your line of sight. Those vehicles may immediately move a number of squares equal to their speed.

talents_list.name: Fleet Tactics
talents_list.description: DC15 Tactics, designate single vehicle, allied gunners in LOS +1 die damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you may designate a single vehicle as the target of a large-scale assault. If you succeed on a DC 15 Knowledge (tactics) check, all allied gunners within line of sight deal 1 additional die of damage to the target with each successful ranged attack until the start of your next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Flight
talents_list.description: fly speed double land speed, ascend 1/2 speed, descend double speed, until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to fly. You gain a fly speed equal to your land speed, and you can ascend at half speed or descend at double speed. The flight lasts until the start of your next turn; if you're still airborne at that time, you fall.

talents_list.name: Fluidity
talents_list.description: UtF for Acrobatics & can reroll UtF if can reroll Acrobatics, spend FP to be one size larger w/grapple
talents_list.full_text_description: You use your Use the Force check modifier instead of your Acrobatics check modifier when making Acrobatics checks. If you are entitled to an Acrobatics check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations). Additionally, when you attempt a grapple or attempting to break free of a grapple, you can spend a Force Point to be treated as if you were one size category larger.

talents_list.name: Flurry Attack
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Weapon Proficiency feat for chosen weapon

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Weapon Proficiency feat for chosen weapon
prerequisites_structured.name: Weapon Proficiency  for chosen weapon

talents_list.description: with a crit make an additional attack against a target in range, once per turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single weapon group or exotic weapon you are proficient with. When you score a critical hit with a weapon from that group, you can make one immediate extra attack (in addition to the other effects of a critical hit) against a single target within range. You may only use this talent once per turn. You can select this talent multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the talent, it applies to a new weapon group or exotic weapon.

talents_list.name: Flurry of Blows
talents_list.description: multiple unarmed atk with full atk have penalty reduced by 2, can be taken multiple times

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make multiple unarmed attacks as a full attack action (see page 154 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), you reduce the penalty to your attack roll by 2. You can take this talent multiple times. Each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty to your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Fluster
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, intimidate check opp in LOS vs. Will, can take only swif next turn (+5 if opp higher level)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You get under an enemy's skin. Once per encounter, make a Persuasion check to intimidate one creature within line of sight as a standard action. On a success, instead of the normal effect of an intimidate application of the Persuasion skill, the affected creature can take only a single swift action on its next turn. If the target is higher level than you, it gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense against the skill check. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Focus Terror
talents_list.description: 1/encounter all allies w/in 12 sq & LOS move +2 CT but are -2 atk & skills for rounds = CL
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can harness the fear felt by your allies and transform it into a powerful motivational tool. All allies within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight move +2 steps along the condition track, but suffer a -2 penalty on attack rolls and skill checks for a number of rounds equal to your character level.

talents_list.name: Focused Attack
talents_list.description: reroll an attack against opponent with Dark Side score 1+
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to reroll an attack against a creature with a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher, keeping the better of the two rolls.

talents_list.name: Focused Force Talisman
talents_list.description: select a single Force power & if you use power spend Force Point to return all spent uses to suite

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you create a Force talisman (see page 214 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), you can select a single Force power from your Force suite. Whenever you are wearing this talisman and activate the selected Force power, you can spend a Force Point to immediately regain all your expended uses of that spent power, adding it to your Force suite.

talents_list.name: Focused Targeting
talents_list.description: if you damage opponent all allies within 3 sq gain +2 dam v. that target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you damage a target with a melee or ranged attack, all allies within 3 squares gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls against that target until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Focused Warrior
talents_list.description: when you deal damage you get +5 Will Def until next turn unless you are surprised or flat-footed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your training makes you confident and disciplined in combat. When you successfully deal damage to an opponent in combat, you gain a +5 morale bonus to Will Defense until the start of your next turn. You lose this bonus to Will Defense if you are surprised or flat-footed for any reason.

talents_list.name: Folded Space Mastery
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Use Computer to astrogate if you move object of sufficient size, no hyperdrive
talents_list.full_text_description: While you are the pilot of a vehicle, you can use the fold space Force power (see page 25) to move the vehicle across long distances. If your Use the Force check to activate the power is sufficient to move an object of the same size as your vehicle (or larger), you can use the power to move your vehicle and all of its occupants safely to the desired destination. You use your Use the Force check result instead of a Use Computer check, as though calculating a hyperspace jump. This otherwise uses the normal rules for hyperspace travel, though travel is instantaneous and requires no hyperdrive.

talents_list.name: Fool's Luck
talents_list.description: for rest of encounter: +1 Atk, +5 competence to skills or +1 Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can spend a Force Point to gain one of the following benefits for the rest of the encounter: a +1 competence bonus on attack rolls, a +5 competence bonus on skill checks, or a +1 competence bonus to all your defenses. (SotG) If you use this talent to grant yourself a luck bonus to your defenses, this bonus also applies to the defenses of any vehicle you are on (even if you are not the pilot).

talents_list.name: For the Cause
talents_list.description: If you or ally w/in 6sq takes dam over thresh you & all allies in 6 sq +2 attack 7 dam until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you or an ally within 6 squares of you takes damage that exceeds that character’s damage threshold, you and all allies within 6 squares of you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Force Blank
talents_list.description: Use the Force -10 when someone uses Sense Surroundings to detect you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are especially hard to detect using the Force. Attempts to detect you using the Sense Surroundings aspect of the Use the Force skill suffer a -10 penalty.

talents_list.name: Force Cloak
talents_list.description: blocks electronic surveillance until next turn or spending standard action
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can surround yourself with an invisible bubble of Force power that shields you and anything you're carrying from electronic surveillance. The bubble also blocks all electronic sensors and communications. The Force cloak lasts for as long as you concentrate (a standard action) or until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Force Cloak Mastery
talents_list.description: expands bubble to number of creatures = to character level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As the Force Cloak talent, except that you can expand the bubble to envelop a number of creatures (including yourself) equal to your character level.

talents_list.name: Force Deception
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Deception, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Use the Force check modifier instead of your Deception check modifier when making Deception checks, as you use the Force to cloak your vile treachery. You are considered trained in the Deception skill. If you are entitled to a Deception check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Force Delay
talents_list.description: 1/encounter Persuasion v. Will Def of Int 3 or higher & understand, target loses move, FP for stan
talents_list.full_text_description: Jal Shey verbally startle opponents with a little help from the Force. Once per encounter, make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of a target of Intelligence 3 or higher that can understand you as a reaction. If successful, the target loses its move action on its next round. If you spend a Force Point, the target loses its standard action instead.

talents_list.name: Force Directed Shot
talents_list.description: choose 1 sq w/in 12sq & LOS, treat as origin sq for next ranged energy atk, must have LOS to target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You use the Force to alter the flight of your blaster bolt, projectile, or similar missile from a thrown or ranged weapon. As a swift action, select one square within 12 squares of you and within your line of sight. You treat that square as the origin square for your next ranged attack with [[a ranged weapon (or similar projectile, or similar missile from a thrown or ranged weapon)]] made before the end of your next turn, and determine cover and concealment as though you were firing from that square. You must have line of sight to the target of the attack from the square you occupy.

talents_list.name: Force Direction
talents_list.description: always add +3 to ranged attacks with a Force Point (+4 with d8s)
talents_list.full_text_description: You use the Force to guide your ranged attacks to their target. Whenever you spend a Force point to add to a ranged attack roll, you can always add +3 (or +4, if you roll d8s for Force Points) instead of rolling the die.

talents_list.name: Force Exertion
talents_list.description: designate one force power, remove one power for the designated power, you -1 CT for 1 min
talents_list.full_text_description: When you select this talent, choose one Force power that you have in your Force power suite. As a reaction, you can remove any one Force power from your active suite to add an extra use of the Force power designated by this talent. Doing so moves you -1 persistent step along the condition track. This persistent condition is removed by resting for 1 minute. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you choose a different Force power to be gained by using this talent.

talents_list.name: Force Fighter
talents_list.description: if you spend a Force Point to add to an attack roll, heal hp = Force Point result

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you spend a Force Point to add to an attack roll, you heal a number of hit points equal to the Force Point result if the attack hits.

talents_list.name: Force Flow
talents_list.description: when you roll a natural 1 on Atk or Use the Force roll gain +1 FP until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: For reasons unknown to you, the Living Force flows through you in an irregular fashion. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on an attack roll or Use the Force check, you gain one temporary Force Point. If you do not spend this Force Point before the end of the encounter, it is lost.

talents_list.name: Force Focus
talents_list.description: DC15 Use the Force, regain one Force Power
talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you may make a DC 15 Use the Force check. If the check succeeds, you regain one spent Force power of your choice.

talents_list.name: Force Fortification
talents_list.description: negates crit, take normal damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can spend a Force Point to negate a critical hit scored against you and take normal damage instead. You can spend this Force Point even if you've already spent a Force Point earlier in the round. [You could use this talent to take normal damage instead of critical damage if you are targeted by a DP auto-crit.]

talents_list.name: Force Harmony
talents_list.description: 1/encounter activate a Force talent that requires a Force Point without spending one

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can activate one Force talent that requires a Force Point to use without spending a Force Point. [Force Tradition talents are also Force talents.]

talents_list.name: Force Haze
talents_list.description: hide you and allies equal to class level, Use the Force v. Will, 1min or if attack from haze

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to create a "haze" that hides you and your allies from the perceptions of others. You can hide a number of creatures in line of sight equal to your class level. Make a Use the Force check and compare the result to the Will Defense of any opponent that moves into line of sight of any creature hidden by your Force haze. If your check result beats the opponent's Will Defense, all hidden creatures are treated as if they had total concealment against that opponent. The Force haze lasts up to 1 minute but is dismissed instantly if anyone hidden by the Force haze makes an attack. (SotG) You may use this talent to hide a single vehicle while you are on board. The vehicle can't have a size penalty to Reflex Defense, Initiative, or Pilot checks greater than your heroic level. Thus, a Gargantuan starship (size penalty of -5) can be hidden only by a character of 5th level or higher.

talents_list.name: Force Immersion
talents_list.description: sneak from Stealth from electronic devices, use same roll for Perception & Use Computer

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the sneak application of the Stealth skill to hide from electronic surveillance and sensors. Any opponent attempting to detect you with sensors or electronic surveillance must beat your Stealth check with a Use Computer check. You need only roll a single Stealth check to avoid both electronic notice and notice by conventional means, using the same result as the DC for both Perception checks and Use Computer checks made to detect you.

talents_list.name: Force Interrogation
talents_list.description: when you damage an opponent with a Force Power, Persuasion to intimidate

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you deal damage to one or more creatures by using a Force power, you can immediately make a Persuasion check as a free action to intimidate a single target you damaged.

talents_list.name: Force Intuition
talents_list.description: Use the Force instead of Initiative, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Use the Force check modifier instead of your Initiative modifier when making Initiative checks. You are considered trained in the Initiative skill. If you are entitled to an Initiative check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations). (SotG) You may use this talent to determine the Initiative of a starship if you are the pilot.

talents_list.name: Force Momentum
talents_list.description: when you spend a Force Point for a melee attack, add the roll to damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You use the Force to add to the impact of your melee weapon, increasing your damage. Whenever you spend a Force point to add to a melee attack roll, if the attack hits you can also add the Force point's result to the damage roll.

talents_list.name: Force Perception
talents_list.description: UseForce replaces Perception avoid surprise/notice enemies/sense deception or influence, trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check instead of a Perception check to avoid surprise, notice enemies, sense deception, or sense influence (see the Perception skill, page 70). You are considered trained in the Perception skill. If you are entitled to a Perception check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Force Persuasion
talents_list.description: Use the Force instead of Persuasion check, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Use the Force check modifier instead of your Persuasion check modifier when making Persuasion checks. You are considered trained in the Persuasion skill. If you are entitled to a Persuasion check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Force Pilot
talents_list.description: Use the Force instead of Pilot, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Use the Force check modifier instead of your Pilot check modifier when making Pilot checks. You are considered trained in the Pilot skill. If you are entitled to a Pilot check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Force Power Adept
talents_list.description: on a selected Force power, you may reroll Use the Force checks
talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at using a particular Force power. Select one Force power you know. When using that Force power, you have the option of spending a Force Point to make two Use the Force checks, keeping the better result. This talent may be selected multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you select this talent, you must choose a different Force power.

talents_list.name: Force Recovery
talents_list.description: with second wind, gain additional hp: d6 per Force Point possessed (10d6 max)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use your second wind (see Second Wind, page 146), you regain a number of additional hit points equal to 1d6 per Force Point you possess (maximum 10d6).

talents_list.name: Force Reflexes
talents_list.description: when activating starship maneuver, reroll Pilot Check
talents_list.full_text_description: When activating a starship maneuver, you may spend a Force Point to reroll your Pilot check, keeping the better result. See Chapter 2 for more information on starship maneuvers.

talents_list.name: Force Repair
talents_list.description: can use Force Trance & receive vital transfer & gain additional hp = Cha mod (min 1)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Force Trance application of the Use the Force skill to recover hit points through natural healing. You can also receive hit points from the vital transfer Force power. Whenever you receive bonus hit points from any source, you gain additional bonus hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1).

talents_list.name: Force Revive
talents_list.description: ally affected by Battle Med is reduced to 0 hp allows ally to take 2nd Wind as reac & falls uncon

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally affected by your Battle Mediation is reduced to 0 hit points, you can spend a Force Point as a reaction, allowing that ally to take its Second Wind as a reaction immediately (though the target still falls unconscious before the Second Wind is triggered).

talents_list.name: Force Stabilize
talents_list.description: 1/turn ally within 12 sq & LOS can take 2nd Wind if they have not already

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can designate an ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight once per turn as a swift action; that ally immediately takes its second wind if it has not yet done so in this encounter.

talents_list.name: Force Suppression
talents_list.description: if fail to rebuke, lessen affect by one step, only works with powers with variable effects

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you use the rebuke Force power to attempt to negate or redirect a Force power used against you but fail to overcome your opponent's Use the Force check result, you instead lessen the effect of the Force power by one step. For example, if an opponent attempted to use the slow Force power on you and rolled a 21, if you fail to rebuke the power you only suffer the DC 15 effect instead of the DC 20 effect. This talent only affects Force powers that have variable effects based on your opponent's Use the Force checks, and powers with static DCs without variable effects (such as Force lightning) are unaffected.

talents_list.name: Force Talisman
talents_list.description: +1 on one Def, can not remake for 24 hours, only one at a time

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may spend one Force Point to imbue a weapon or some other portable object with the Force, creating a talisman that provides protection to you. Creating the talisman takes a full-round action. While you wear or carry the talisman on your person, you gain a +1 Force bonus to one of your defenses (Reflex, Fortitude, or Will). You may only have one Force talisman active at any given time, and if your Force talisman is destroyed, you may not create another Force talisman for 24 hours. [[Weak talent option: Increase benefit to 2 defenses. Option 2: Give this the benefits Greater Focused Force Talisman, and delete GFFT. Option 3: Increase +1 bonus to +2 (this may make GFFT overpowered)]]

talents_list.name: Force Throw
talents_list.description: if within 6 squares, can pull back as a swift action w/DC20 Use the Force
talents_list.full_text_description: You can hurl a simple or advanced melee weapon your size or smaller as a standard action, treating it as a thrown weapon. You are considered proficient with the thrown weapon. The thrown weapon deals normal weapon damage if it hits. If the weapon deals piercing or slashing damage, it becomes embedded in your target, remaining there and causing an additional die of damage each round at the end of the target's turn, and also when it is removed (removing the embedded weapon is a swift action and an adjacent ally can remove the embedded weapon for you). Your target must be within 6 squares of you. The weapon does not automatically return to you, but you can retrieve it with move object (dealing an additional die of damage in the process, if the weapon is embedded in the target, as above).

talents_list.name: Force Treatment
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Treat Injury, can treat without a medkit or medpac, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check in place of a Treat Injury check (see the Treat Injury skill, page 74). You are considered trained in the Treat Injury skill. If you are entitled to a Treat Injury check reroll, you may reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations). In addition, you can administer first aid, treat disease, treat poison, and treat radiation without the requisite medical kit or medpac.

talents_list.name: Force Treatment
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Treat Injury, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check in the place of a Treat Injury check. You are considered trained in the Treat Injury skill. If you are entitled to a Treat Injury check reroll, you can reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Force Veil
talents_list.description: the radius to which you can be detected is 10km not 100km

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your ability to conceal yourself from other Force-users allows you to reduce the radius within which you can be detected to 10 kilometers (instead of 100 kilometers).

talents_list.name: Force Warning
talents_list.description: allies w/in 12sq can reroll Init, if allies surprised but not you, 1 ally per your Wis mod not surprise
talents_list.full_text_description: Allies within 12 squares can choose to reroll their Initiative checks at the start of combat but must take the second result, even if it is worse. Furthermore, if any allies within 12 squares are surprised at the start of an encounter, but you are not, you can designate a number of those allies equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1); those allies are no longer considered surprised and can act normally on the surprise round.

talents_list.name: Force of Will
talents_list.description: permanent Will Def +2, give all allies 6sq +2 Will Def for rest of encounter if within 6sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 insight bonus to Will Defense. Also, as a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to give all allies within 6 squares of you a +2 insight bonus to Will Defense that lasts for the remainder of the encounter. This bonus does not extend to allies outside the range of the effect, even if they move within 6 squares of you later on. Allies who benefit from this talent must remain within 6 squares of you to retain the insight bonus, and they lose it if you are knocked unconscious or killed. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Forceful Warrior
talents_list.description: with a crit using a lightsaber gain temp Force Point to be used before the end of the encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you score a critical hit with a lightsaber, you gain 1 temporary Force Point. If the Force Point is not used before the end of the encounter, it is lost.

talents_list.name: Foresight
talents_list.description: reroll Initiative Check, natural 20 = regain Force Point
talents_list.full_text_description: You may spend a Force Point to reroll an Initiative check, keeping the better of the two rolls. Additionally, if you roll a natural 20 on the Initiative check reroll, you immediately regain the Force Point spent to activate this talent.

talents_list.name: Forewarn Allies
talents_list.description: all allies w/in 12 sq +2 atk & dam for attacks of opportunity

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: All allies within 12 squares of you gain a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls for attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Form Up
talents_list.description: all squad members +2 Ref Def until next turn if w/in 6 sq of another squad member (squad = you & # = or less than cl + Cha mod, must be on foot, have LOS & be able to communicate)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you give all squad members a +2 morale bonus to their Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn, as long as they are within 6 squares of another squad member.

talents_list.name: Fortified Body
talents_list.description: immune to disease, poison and radiation
talents_list.full_text_description: The Force shields you against ailments, toxins, and radiation poisoning, making you immune to disease, poison, and radiation.

talents_list.name: Fortune's Favor
talents_list.description: with a Critical, gain a standard free action, take before next turn or lose
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee or ranged attack, you gain a free standard action. You must take the extra standard action before the end of your turn, or else it is lost.

talents_list.name: Forward Patrol
talents_list.description: at start of surprise round if you're not surprised designate 1 ally w/in 6 sq to retain Dex to Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: At the start of a surprise round in which you are not caught by surprise, you can designate one ally within 6 squares of you as able to retain his or her Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense during the surprise round.

talents_list.name: Friend or Foe
talents_list.description: 1/turn when ally in LOS missed by ranged atk compare missed atk to adjacent enemy to see if it hits

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an ally within your line of sight is missed by a ranged attack, you can (as a reaction, once per turn) designate one enemy adjacent to that ally. Compare the attack roll of the missed attack to the Reflex Defense of that enemy; if the attack would hit, the attack targets that enemy and is resolved as normal.

talents_list.name: Friendly Fire
talents_list.description: if melee combat & you are missed by a ranged Atk, that Atk target's opponent instead (same Atk roll)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are engaged in melee combat with an adjacent enemy and are the target of a ranged attack that misses you, compare the attack roll to the Reflex Defense of one adjacent enemy; if the attack equals or exceeds the target's Reflex Defense, that enemy becomes the new target of the attack, which is resolved as normal.

talents_list.name: Frighten
talents_list.description: 1/encounter force all enemies to move 1 sq away from one minion, no Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can designate a minion as a free action to spread fear among your enemies. At any point before the end of the encounter, you can activate this ability to force all enemies adjacent to your minion to move 1 square away from the minion. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Fringe Savant
talents_list.description: natural 20 on skill check = one extra Force Point for encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you roll a natural 20 on a skill check during an encounter, you gain one temporary Force Point. If the Force Point is not used before the end of the encounter, it is lost.

talents_list.name: Full Advance
talents_list.description: all squad members +2 dam until next turn (squad = you & # = or less than cl + Cha mod, must be on foot, have LOS & be able to communicate)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you give all squad members a +2 morale bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Full Control
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Directed Action, Directed Movement, Remote Attack
talents_list.description: allow 1 droid to take full atk & replace its mod with your Int mod

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you allow one droid that can hear and understand you to take the full attack action. The droid can replace its relevant ability score modifier to any attack rolls it makes with your Intelligence modifier.

talents_list.name: Full Throttle
talents_list.description: can take 10 to increase speed, all-out movement is x5 not x4
talents_list.full_text_description: You can take 10 on Pilot checks made to increase your vehicle's speed (see the Pilot skill description, page 71). In addition, when you use the all-out movement action while piloting a vehicle, your vehicle moves up to five times its normal speed (instead of the normal x4).

talents_list.name: Galactic Guidance
talents_list.description: 1/enc as reac if succeed on Know (galactic lore) enable 1 ally w/in 6sq & LOS to reroll failed Int or Wis based skill check (other than Perception)
talents_list.full_text_description: You share your considerable galactic knowledge to inform others’ actions and decisions. Once per encounter, as a reaction, if you succeed on a DC 25 Knowledge (galactic lore) check, you enable one ally within 6 squares of you and within your line of sight to reroll a failed Intelligence- or Wisdom-based skill check except Perception (Knowledge, Mechanics, Use Computer, Survival, Treat Injury).

talents_list.name: Gambler
talents_list.description: +2 Wisdom checks when gambling, take multiple times

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 competence bonus on Wisdom checks when you gamble (see the Gambling sidebar on the next page). You can select this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, the competence bonus increases by +2.

talents_list.name: Gang Leader
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when you intimidate gain +1 for every ally within 6sq & target's LOS (max +5)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you make a Persuasion check to intimidate, you gain a +1 bonus on the check for every ally within 6 squares of you and in the target’s line of sight (maximum +5 bonus).

talents_list.name: Gauge Force Potential
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will, detect Force sensitivity, force powers number, Force Points

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: By focusing on a specific creature in your line of sight, you can gauge how strong in the Force it is. This takes a standard action and requires a Use the Force check. If your check result meets or beats the target's Will Defense, you know whether or not it has the Force Sensitivity feat, you know how many Force powers it knows (but not which ones, specifically), and you know how many Force Points it has currently.

talents_list.name: Get Down
talents_list.description: when ally targeted by ranged atk, you allow them to drop prone as free action
talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, when an ally is targeted by a ranged attack, you can enable that ally to drop prone immediately (imposing the normal -5 penalty for a ranged attack against a prone target to the triggering attack roll) as a free action.

talents_list.name: Get Into Position
talents_list.description: one of your followers +2 speed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a move action, you can cause one of your followers to move up to his or her speed +2 squares.

talents_list.name: Get Some Distance
talents_list.description: 1/encounter make melee Atk then move your speed away without Atk of Opp
