talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a standard action you can make a melee attack against a target and then move your speed away from that target. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Get into Position
talents_list.description: 1/enc at the start of your first turn two allies in LOS and 12 sq move their speed as reac
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, at the start of your first turn, choose two allies within 12 squares and in your line of sight. Each ally can immediately move up to his or her speed as a reaction.

talents_list.name: Ghost Assailant
talents_list.description: if start turn in total concealment or cover, Stealth v. Perception or enemy is flat-footed v. you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you start your turn with total concealment or total cover from a target, during that turn you can make a Stealth check as a swift action, opposed by the target’s Perception check. If you succeed, the target is considered flat-footed against you until the end of your turn.

talents_list.name: Gimmick
talents_list.description: issue routine command to a computer

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can issue a routine command to a computer (see page 76) as a swift action.

talents_list.name: Grabber
talents_list.description: do not take -5 when using grab action

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You do not take a -5 penalty when using the grab action (see page 152 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Gradual Resistance
talents_list.description: if take dam from Force power +2 all Def against that power until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you take damage from the use of a Force power, until the end of the encounter you gain a +2 Force bonus to all defenses against that Force power.

talents_list.name: Grand Leader
talents_list.description: 1/encounter grant hp = 5 + 1/2 CL to all allies within 20 sq & LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, once per encounter, you can grant bonus hit points equal to 5 + one-half your character level to all allies within 20 squares of you and in your line of sight. Damage is subtracted from the bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points from multiple sources don’t stack.

talents_list.name: Great Shot
talents_list.description: reduces range penalties by one range category, ex. short = PB

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When firing a vehicle weapon, you treat the distance to the target as though it were one range category less than it actually is. For example, when targeting an enemy at short range, you treat it as though it were at point blank range for the purpose of determining bonuses or penalties.

talents_list.name: Greater Dark Side Talisman
talents_list.description: +2 on all Def against light-side powers

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Dark Side Talisman (above), except that the talisman’s Force bonus extends to all three of your defenses (Reflex, Fortitude, and Will).

talents_list.name: Greater Devastating Attack
talents_list.description: with proficient weapon, lower damage threshold by 10 (replaces Devastating Atk)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group with which you're proficient. Whenever you make a successful attack against a target using the chosen exotic weapon or a weapon from the chosen group, you treat your target's damage threshold as if it were 10 points lower when determining the result of your attack. This replaces the effects of the Devastating Attack talent (see page 53).

talents_list.name: Greater Focused Force Talisman
talents_list.description: as Focused Force Talisman but Force Point does not count toward "one per turn"

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Focused Force Talisman (see above), except that a Force Point spent to immediately recover the selected power does not count against the "one per turn" restriction on spending Force Points.

talents_list.name: Greater Force Talisman
talents_list.description: +1 on all Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Force Talisman (above), except that the talisman's Force bonus extends to all three of your defenses (Reflex, Fortitude, and Will). [[Weak talent option: Also add +1 to an additional defense. ]]

talents_list.name: Greater Penetrating Attack
talents_list.description: with proficient weapon, lower DR by 10 (replaces Penetrating Atk)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group with which you're proficient. Whenever you make a successful attack against a target using the chosen exotic weapon or a weapon from the chosen group, you treat your target's damage reduction as if it were 10 points lower when determining the result of your attack. This replaces the effects of the Penetrating Attack talent (see page 53).

talents_list.name: Greater Weapon Focus
talents_list.description: with proficient weapon, +1 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose one exotic weapon or weapon group with which you're proficient. You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls with the chosen exotic weapon or a weapon from the chosen group. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by the Weapon Focus feat (page 89). You must be proficient with the weapon to gain this benefit. You may select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, it applies to a different weapon group.

talents_list.name: Greater Weapon Focus (Fira)
talents_list.description: fira attack +1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have mastered the chosen weapon of the Order of Shasa. You gain a +1 bonus on melee attack rolls with a fira. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by the Weapon Focus feat.

talents_list.name: Greater Weapon Focus (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: +1 Atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +1 bonus on melee attack rolls with lightsabers. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by the Weapon Focus (lightsabers) feat.

talents_list.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
talents_list.description: with proficient weapon, +2 damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose one exotic weapon or one of the following weapon groups: advanced melee weapons, heavy weapons, pistols, rifles, simple weapons. You gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls with the chosen exotic weapon or a weapon from the chosen group. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by the Weapon Specialization talent (page 53). You must be proficient with the weapon to gain this benefit. You may select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, it applies to a different weapon group.

talents_list.name: Greater Weapon Specialization (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: +2 damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 bonus on melee damage rolls with lightsabers. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by the Weapon Specialization (lightsabers) talent.

talents_list.name: Grenade Defense
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. grenade atk roll to negate attack, you take -5 penalty on Use the Force until next turn

effects.target_description: use the force until next turn

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Move Light Object application of the Use the Force skill to cast aside grenades that are thrown at you. As a reaction when you are attacked by a grenade of any kind, you can make a Use the Force check with a DC equal to the attack roll of the incoming grenade attack. If your check equals or beats the DC, you hurl the grenade to a location where it explodes harmlessly, negating the attack. Whether or not you are successful, you take a -5 penalty on Use the Force checks until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Grizzled Warrior
talents_list.description: each 1/enc: 1. single ranged or melee atk & gain hp = Con score, or 2. Aid Another w/in 6 sq to atk add half cl to ally's dam roll if atk hits, or 3. single melee or ranged atk & gain +2 dodge to Ref Def until next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: You can draw upon your extensive battlefield experience to encourage your comrades and drive your enemies before you. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a standard action: • Defy the Odds: Make a single melee or ranged attack. You immediately gain a number of bonus hit points equal to your Constitution score. • Double the Pain: When you use the Aid Another action to provide an ally within 6 squares of you a bonus to his or her attack roll, add one-half your character level to the ally’s damage roll if the attack is successful. • Guarded Assault: Make a single melee or ranged attack. You gain a +2 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense against all attacks until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Group Perception
talents_list.description: all allies w/in 6 sq can roll Perception if you do taking the highest result

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you roll a Perception check, all allies within 6 squares of you can do so as well, taking the highest reroll result rolled by you or any ally.

talents_list.name: Guaranteed Boon
talents_list.description: If you spend FP on skill roll and fail regain FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you spend a Force Point to add to a skill roll in a skill challenge and accrue a failure for that skill check, you regain that Force Point.

talents_list.name: Guaranteed Shot
talents_list.description: with two pistols & attack, even if miss deal dam = half HL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are wielding two pistols and make a single ranged attack with one of those pistols as a standard action, even if you miss you deal damage equal to half your heroic level to the target. This consumes a single shot from the weapon not making the attack, and the weapon you attack with uses as many shots as required by the attack.

talents_list.name: Guard's Endurance
talents_list.description: whenever you begin turn adjacent to target of Ward gain hp = your character level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you begin your turn adjacent to the target of your Ward talent (see below), you gain bonus hit points equal to your character level until the start of your next turn. Damage is subtracted from the bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points from different sources do not stack.

talents_list.name: Guardian Spirit
talents_list.description: your guardian spirit can tell you the immediate consequences of your actions, gain 1 bonus FP/day after 6 hrs rest to improve Force power or activate technique or secret

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have a guardian spirit watching over you from the realm of the Force, providing you with insight and advice. You guardian spirit might be an old mentor or an ancient member of your Force tradition who has chosen to guide you to your destiny. When you use the Search Your Feelings application of the Use the Force skill, you can instead choose to consult your guardian spirit. When you do so, you learn more than just whether the results of your actions will be favorable or unfavorable; you also learn the nature of any immediate consequences, including potential encounters, and whether or not certain actions will bring you closer to achieving your destiny. Additionally, you gain one bonus Force Point each day (available after you rest for at least 6 hours). This bonus Force Point can only be used to improve a Force power or activate a Force technique or a Force secret. If you do not spend your bonus Force Point in a given day, it is lost at the start of the next day.

talents_list.name: Guardian Strike
talents_list.description: when you dam opp w/lightsaber, target is -2 Atk against anyone but you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use a lightsaber to deal damage to a target, that target takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls against any target other than you until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Guidance
talents_list.description: show ally in LOS to ignore effect of difficult terrain until your next turn, not you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to guide others through treacherous terrain. You may use a swift action to point out to an ally the path of least resistance to an ally within line of sight who can see, hear, and understand you. The ally ignores the effect of difficult terrain on its next turn. You may not use this talent on yourself.

talents_list.name: Guiding Strikes
talents_list.description: allies adjacent to target you dealt dam +2 melee atk v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you deal damage to a target by making a lightsaber attack on your turn, you can use a swift action before the end of your turn to activate this talent. If you do so, allies adjacent to the target at the time you made the attack gain a +2 circumstance bonus to melee attack rolls against that target until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Gun Club
talents_list.description: use gun as melee weapon w/out penalty, with bayonet, acts as blade and club

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use a ranged weapon as a melee weapon without taking a penalty on your attack roll. (Normally you take a -5 penalty on attack rolls made with an improvised weapon.) The weapon is otherwise treated as a club in all respects. If you are using a rifle with a mounted bayonet (see CR page 121) or vibro-bayonet (see CR page 124), you may wield that weapon as a double weapon. The bayonet or vibrobayonet end is treated normally, and the other end is treated as a club.

talents_list.name: Hailfire
talents_list.description: with two pistols attack as if autofire even without, autofire penalties apply

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are wielding two pistols, as a standard action you can make an autofire attack with one of the pistols as though the weapon were set to autofire, even if the pistol would not normally be capable of autofire. The normal penalties for autofire still apply to this attack roll, and you may split the number of shots consumed between the two pistols.

talents_list.name: Hammerblow
talents_list.description: if unarmed & holding no items double Str bonus on unarmed attacks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are unarmed and holding no items, you double your Strength bonus on unarmed attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Hard Target
talents_list.description: catch a Second Wind as a reaction not a swift action
talents_list.full_text_description: You can catch a second wind as a reaction instead of as a swift action.

talents_list.name: Hardened Strike
talents_list.description: reduce target's DR by 1 for enc if hit with unarmed atk, does not stack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you damage with an unarmed attack a creature or droid that has Damage Reduction, you reduce the value of that Damage Reduction by one until the end of the encounter. Cumulative attacks against the same target do not stack. [[Weak talent option: reduce DR by half instead of 1, max of 5]]

talents_list.name: Hardiness
talents_list.description: reduce swif actions to move up CT by 1
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to reduce the number of swift actions it takes you to move +1 step along the condition track by one.

talents_list.name: Harm's Way
talents_list.description: once per round, shield ally, any attacks targets you instead

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round, you may spend a swift action to shield a single adjacent ally from attacks, taking the damage and suffering the ill effects in your ally's stead. Until the start of your next turn, any attack made against the protected ally targets you instead. You may elect not to shield your protected ally against a given attack, provided the decision is made before the attack roll is made. [You can use Harm's Way with Deflect.] (SotG) If you are the pilot of a vehicle, you may use this talent to protect allied vehicles. You may use it to protect vehicles no more than one size category larger than your own. [[forums seem to indicate that Harm's Way doesn't work against area attacks, since they don't "target" your ally.]]

talents_list.name: Harrying Shot
talents_list.description: when you deal dam after aiming target can't use stan action to atk on their next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a successful ranged attack against an enemy that you have aimed at and the attack deals damage, the target cannot use a standard action to make an attack roll on his or her next turn. This counts as a stunning effect.

talents_list.name: Hasty Withdrawal
talents_list.description: 1/turn number of allies = Cha bonus (min 1) & w/in 12 sq & LOS, each may withdraw as free
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action once per turn, you target a number of allies equal to your Charisma bonus (minimum 1). Each targeted ally must be within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. Each ally you target can take the withdraw action immediately as a free action. The normal rules for withdrawing otherwise apply (see page 153 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Heal Droid
talents_list.description: can heal droids with vital transfer

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the vital transfer Force power to heal droids (including Shard-inhabited droids), which are normally immune to this power.

talents_list.name: Healing Boost
talents_list.description: damage healed with vital transfer increase by 1 point per class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When healing somebody through vital transfer, the amount of damage healed increases by 1 point per your class level.

talents_list.name: Heavy Fire Zone
talents_list.description: 1/turn designate 3x3 area w/in LOS, if a target moves in that area 1 ally in LOS can make Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a swift action, designate a 3x3 square area within your line of sight. Until the end of your next turn, if a target moves into that area you can enable one ally within your line of sight to make an attack of opportunity against that target. The ally you choose must be armed with a weapon capable of making attacks of opportunity, and this counts toward the ally’s normal limitations for attacks of opportunity made in a round.

talents_list.name: Heavy-Duty Actuators
talents_list.description: can double Str bonus to melee & unarmed dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your heavy-duty actuators allow you to release your power and speed in a quick burst. You can double your Strength bonus to your melee and unarmed damage rolls.

talents_list.name: Heightened Awareness
talents_list.description: add Cha bonus to Perception check

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to add your Charisma bonus to your Perception check. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, you add your Charisma bonus an additional time.

talents_list.name: Helpful
talents_list.description: 1/turn with aid another to adjacent ally on a skill check as a swif action not stan

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn you can use the aid another action to assist any adjacent ally on a skill check as a swift action instead of a standard action.

talents_list.name: Hesitate
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def within 12sq, -2 speed & must spend swif with stan, until target's next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can fill your opponent with doubt by making a Persuasion check as a standard action against a single target that can hear and understand you within 12 squares of you. If your check result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, the target takes a -2 penalty to its base speed, and if the target takes a standard action, it must also spend its swift action. This penalty lasts until the end of the target's next turn.

talents_list.name: Heuristic Mastery
talents_list.description: reroll any untrained skill check (must take re-roll) & 1/enc spend FP tor reroll any skill check & take better
talents_list.full_text_description: You understand the subtleties and limitations of your heuristic processor. You can reroll any untrained skill check (except Use the Force), keeping the second result, even if it is worse. Once per encounter, you can spend a Force Point to reroll any skill check (trained or untrained), taking the better result.

talents_list.name: Hidden Attacker
talents_list.description: snipe action of Stealth is swif not move
talents_list.full_text_description: Your shots seem to come from nowhere. Whenever you use the snipe application of the Stealth skill, you do so as a swift action instead of a move action.

talents_list.name: Hidden Eyes
talents_list.description: if have concealment v. target, +5 Perception v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you have concealment from a target, you gain a +5 circumstance bonus on all Perception checks made against that target.

talents_list.name: Hidden Movement
talents_list.description: no penalty to Stealth at normal movement
talents_list.full_text_description: You're very good at hiding when mobile. You take no penalty on your Stealth check when moving your normal speed. Ignore the -5 penalty on your Stealth check when moving twice your speed with 2 move actions. (Normally you take a -5 penalty to Stealth if you move more than your speed in a round.)

talents_list.name: Hidden Weapons
talents_list.description: if a weapon you draw is not noticed opp is flat-footed, can use Quick Draw as a swif

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you draw a concealed weapon and, before the end of the same round, make an attack against a target that failed to notice the item, the target is considered flat-footed against you. You can draw a concealed item or a stowed item as a move action. Additionally, if you have the Quick Draw feat, you can reduce this to a swift action.

talents_list.name: Hide in Plain Sight
talents_list.description: 1/encounter within 2sq of cover or concealment can move to & make Stealth check as single move
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you are within 2 squares of cover or concealment, you can move to that cover or concealment and make a Stealth check to hide as a single move action.

talents_list.name: High Impact
talents_list.description: DC 15 Use the Force to double Str bonus to next melee dam roll

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, make a DC 15 Use the Force check. If your check succeeds, double your Strength bonus to the next melee damage roll you make before the end of your turn. [[If wielding a weapon 2-handed, you likely triple your Str bonus to damage]]

talents_list.name: Higher Yield
talents_list.description: 1/encounter +1 die dam with grenade or explosive

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can choose to deal +1 die of damage with a single grenade or other explosive.

talents_list.name: Hijkata Expertise
talents_list.description: creature or droid damaged by unarmed atk takes penalty on next atk = your Str mod

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you damage a creature or droid with an unarmed attack, the target takes a penalty to its next attack roll equal to your Strength bonus.

talents_list.name: Hit the Deck
talents_list.description: allies take no or half dam from your area atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make an area attack, each ally in the area takes no damage if your attack roll fails to overcome his or her Reflex Defense, and takes half damage if the attack hits.

talents_list.name: Hive Mind
talents_list.description: telepathy of Use the Force as swif & auto success (no roll) if target is willing recipient in same planet

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the telepathy application of the Use the Force skill as a swift action, and you automatically succeed (no roll required) if your target is a willing recipient on the same planet.

talents_list.name: Hold Steady
talents_list.description: 1/enc move all squad members +1 CT (squad = you & # = or less than cl + Cha mod, must be on foot, have LOS & be able to communicate)
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a standard action, you move all members of your squad +1 step on the condition track.

talents_list.name: Hold the Line
talents_list.description: with a successful attack of opportunity, you stop the target's movement ending its action
talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a successful attack of opportunity against a target leaving your threatened area, you stop the target's movement, ending its action.

talents_list.name: Hot Wire
talents_list.description: can use Mechanics instead of Use Computer to improve access, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Mechanics check modifier instead of your Use Computer check modifier when making Use Computer checks to improve access to a computer system. You are considered trained in the Use Computer skill for purposes of using this talent. If you are entitled to a Use Computer check reroll, you may reroll your Mechanics check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Hotwired Processor
talents_list.description: hotwire processor +5 Int/Wis skill & +1 ranged atk, rounds = half level, move -1 CT after
talents_list.full_text_description: You gain temporary processing power, enhancing your mental attributes. When you hotwire your processor (a swift action), you gain a +5 circumstance bonus on Intelligence- and Wisdom-based skill checks and a +1 circumstance bonus on ranged attack rolls. A hotwiring lasts for a number of rounds equal to one-half your level (rounded down). When the hotwiring ends, you move -1 persistent step along the condition track. The penalties imposed by this condition persist until you receive repairs (using the repair droid application of the Mechanics skill).

talents_list.name: Hunker Down
talents_list.description: if benefit from cover you can increase cover by one step

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you benefit from cover, you can spend a standard action to hunker down and maximize the benefit of the cover. You increase the benefit of cover to improved cover and improved cover to total cover.

talents_list.name: Hunt the Hunter
talents_list.description: if looking for hidden enemies, can make one atk v. one enemy you notice

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a standard action to actively look for hidden enemies (as per the Notice Targets application of the Perception skill), you can make a single melee or ranged attack against any one enemy you notice with your Perception check.

talents_list.name: Hunter's Mark
talents_list.description: aim before attacking moves -1 CT if attack deals damage
talents_list.full_text_description: If you aim before making a ranged attack (see Aim, page 154), you move the target character -1 step along the condition track if the attack deals damage (see Conditions, page 148). (SotG) This talent can be used only against characters, not objects or vehicles.

talents_list.name: Hunter's Target
talents_list.description: once per encounter, designate an opponent, +dam=to BH level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a free action, you may designate an opponent. For the rest of the encounter, when you succeed on a melee or ranged attack against that opponent, you gain a bonus on damage rolls equal to your class level.

talents_list.name: Hyperdriven
talents_list.description: once a day, add class level to Atk, skill or ability roll

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day while aboard a starship, you can add your class level as a bonus on a single attack roll, skill check, or ability check. The decision to add this bonus can be made after the result of the roll or check is known.

talents_list.name: Hyperspace Savant
talents_list.description: Pilot replaces Use the Computer for astrogate or operate sensors

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can substitute your Pilot skill for [ie instead of] any Use Computer check made to astrogate or operate sensors while you are the pilot of a vehicle.

talents_list.name: Idealist
talents_list.description: add Cha bonus not Wis bonus to Will Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your confidence empowers you, giving you the ability to withstand the harmful influence of others. You can add your Charisma bonus in place of your Wisdom bonus to your Will Defense.

talents_list.name: Ignite Fervor
talents_list.description: if you hit, give an ally a dam bonus = to their level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you hit an opponent with a melee or ranged attack, you can (as a free action) choose to give one ally within your line of sight a bonus to damage on his next attack equal to his character level. Once his fervor has been ignited, the affected ally doesn't need to remain within line of sight of you; if his next attack misses, he loses the bonus to damage granted by this talent. You can't ignite fervor in yourself. This is a mind-affecting effect. Unleashed: When you use the Ignite Fervor talent, you can spend a Destiny Point to provide the damage bonus to all allies within line of sight.

talents_list.name: Ignore Armor
talents_list.description: 1/encounter ignore armor or equipment bonuses with melee atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you make a melee attack, you can ignore any armor or equipment bonuses granted by your target's armor.

talents_list.name: Ignore Damage Reduction
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Martial Arts I, Teras Kasi Basics
talents_list.description: if damage more than DR, ignore DR

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make an unarmed attack against a target that has damage reduction, and you deal more damage than the target's DR, you ignore the target's DR completely.

talents_list.name: Illicit Dealings
talents_list.description: reroll Persuasion when haggling for restricted, military or illegal goods
talents_list.full_text_description: Smugglers have a knack for locating and negotiating illicit deals. When using Persuasion to haggle for restricted, military, or illegal goods you may roll twice, keeping the better result.

talents_list.name: Illusion (F87 & J14)
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will Def, see K52 or F87 or J14

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can spend a Force Point to create an illusion that seems perfectly real to anyone who views it. You designate the form and complexity of the illusion, as well as its size and location, and make a Use the Force check. When a creature views the illusion, compare the result of your Use the Force check to the creature's Will Defense; if your check result exceeds its Will Defense, it believes the illusion to be real. Any physical interaction with the illusion (such as touching it, passing through it, or shooting it with a blaster) immediately reveals the true nature of the illusion, and the creature is no longer deceived. The illusion lasts for a number of minutes equal to your heroic level. The illusion's size also affects your Use the Force check, applying a penalty for exceptionally large illusions. The penalties are -1 for Huge illusions, -2 for Gargantuan illusions, -5 for Colossal illusions, and -10 for Colossal (frigate) or larger illusions. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Illusion Bond
talents_list.description: can see or hear as if you were standing in the space of your illusion if humanoid

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you create an illusion of a humanoid using the Illusion talent, you are able to see and hear as though you were standing in the space occupied by your illusion.

talents_list.name: Imbue Item
talents_list.description: swif to spend stored Force Point, can attune 1 item per 24 hours, only for you & one FP at a time

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to imbue a specially crafted weapon, item, armor, or article of clothing with the power of the Force. Imbuing the item requires a full round action. As a full-round action, the wearer of such an item can open himself to the Force, transferring one of their Force Points into the item. You can then use a swift action to spend a stored Force Point at any later time, even in the same round that you spend a Force Point of your own. You can attune only one item per 24 hours, the item functions only for you and a given item can only store one Force Point at a time. You cannot wear more than one attuned item at a time, and you can spend only up to a maximum of two Force Points in a round (one of your own plus one from an item).

talents_list.name: Immerse Another
talents_list.description: applies to ally also, spend Force Point to all adjacent allies

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make a Stealth check to sneak, you can use your check result in the place of one adjacent ally’s Stealth check to sneak (additionally, if you have the Force Immersion talent, that talent applies to the designated ally as well). Similarly, you can use your Use the Force check result in the place of an adjacent ally’s Use the Force check result to avoid detection by the Sense Force application of the skill. You can spend a Force Point to have this ability apply to all adjacent allies instead of just one.

talents_list.name: Immovable
talents_list.description: anyone attempting to move you involuntarily is -5 to their check/atk
talents_list.full_text_description: You can activate this talent as a swift action. Until the start of your next turn, anyone attempting to move you involuntarily (such as with a bantha rush or the move object Force power) takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls or skill checks made to use the effect that would move you. An enemy can only take the penalty from this talent once per attempt, regardless of how many targets have used this talent.

talents_list.name: Impaling Assault
talents_list.description: if damage opp with piercing Atk, opponent -2 speed until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can hit your opponents to slow them down. Whenever you successfully damage an opponent using a piercing weapon that you have the Weapon Specialization talent for, your opponent reduces its speed by 2 squares until the end of your next turn. The effects of multiple Impaling Assaults do not stack.

talents_list.name: Impart Knowledge
talents_list.description: aid on Knowledge checks of ally within 6 sq if you're trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can aid another on the Knowledge checks of any ally within 6 squares of you as a reaction for Knowledge skills you are trained in.

talents_list.name: Impel Ally I
talents_list.description: ally moves normal speed, must move immediately or wasted, can use 3 times a turn
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a swift action to grant one ally the ability to move its normal speed. The ally must move immediately on your turn, before you do anything else, or else the opportunity is wasted. You can use this talent up to three times on your turn (spending a swift action each time).

talents_list.name: Impel Ally II
talents_list.description: ally can make a standard or move action, immediately or wasted
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend two swift actions to grant one ally the ability to take a standard action or move action. The ally must act immediately on your turn, before you do anything else, or else the opportunity is wasted.

talents_list.name: Impel Ally III
talents_list.description: ally can make a standard & move action, immediately or wasted
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can spend three swift actions on consecutive turns to grant one ally the ability to take a standard action and a move action. The ally must act immediately on your turn when the final swift action is spent, before you do anything else, or the opportunity is wasted.

talents_list.name: Impenetrable Cover
talents_list.description: if in cover, gain DR = CL provided you still have cover when they attack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you have cover against a target, you gain DR equal to your class level against that target until the start of your next turn, provided you still have cover from the target at the time the attack is made.

talents_list.name: Impose Confusion
talents_list.description: Persuasion 12sq cone v. Will target loses swif action on next & no full, 1/encounter lose stan action

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Increase the area of Impose Hesitation to a 12-square cone. Also, once per encounter, after making the Persuasion check for Impose Hesitation, you can instead choose to have the targets lose a standard action on their next turn.

talents_list.name: Impose Hesitation
talents_list.description: Persuasion 6sq cone v. Will target loses swif action on next & no full

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, make a Persuasion check targeting all opponents in a 6-square cone. If you equal or exceed the target's Will Defense, the target loses a swift action on its next turn and cannot take full-round actions. This is a mind-affecting effect. Targets need to see, hear, and understand you to be affected by this attack.

talents_list.name: Improved Armored Defense
talents_list.description: Ref Def bonus = either heroic level + 1/2 armor bonus or armor bonus

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When calculating your Reflex Defense, you may add your heroic level plus one-half your armor bonus (rounded down) or your armor bonus, whichever is higher. You must be proficient with the armor you are wearing to gain this benefit. [The extra bonus from Attune Armor, Second Skin, and the Tech Specialist (protective armor) gets included.]

talents_list.name: Improved Attack Run
talents_list.description: do not have to move in straight line on attack run
talents_list.full_text_description: You do not have to move in a straight line when using the attack run action.

talents_list.name: Improved Battle Meditation
talents_list.description: activate Battle Meditation as swif not full, range 12sq, enemies within radius -1 attack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may activate your Battle Meditation talent as a swift action instead of as a full-round action. The range of the Battle Meditation extends out to 12 squares. Enemies within the radius of your Battle Meditation suffer a -1 penalty to all attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Improved Consular's Vitality
talents_list.description: when you damage an opponent, use Consular's Vitality as free action
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you damage a target with a successful lightsaber attack, you may use the Consular's Vitality talent as a free action instead of a swift action until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Improved Dark Healing
talents_list.description: range increases to 12 squares, failure deals and heals 1/2 damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your dark healing ability (see above) improves. The range of this ability increases to 12 squares, and even if the attack fails the target takes half damage while you heal an equal amount.

talents_list.name: Improved Force Sight
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Force sight, Use the Force skill
talents_list.description: can use Search (Perception) as swif, always succeed when using Sense Surroundings (no roll needed)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your natural Force sight is more precise than that of yourfellow Miraluka. You can use the Search application of the Perception skill as a swift action. Additionally, you always succeed when using the Sense Surroundings application of the Use the Force skill (no roll required).

talents_list.name: Improved Healing Boost
talents_list.description: damage healed with vital transfer increase by 2 points per class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When healing somebody through vital transfer, the amount of damage healed increases by 2 points per your class level.

talents_list.name: Improved Initiative
talents_list.description: reroll Initiative
talents_list.full_text_description: You may choose to reroll any Initiative check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Improved Jury-Rig
talents_list.description: Jury-Rig as stan not full, do not have to make check to jury-rig & move up +3 steps not +2
talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Jury-Rig application of the Mechanics skill as a standard action instead of as a full-round action. Additionally, you are not required to make a skill check to successfully jury-rig a device or vehicle, and the device or vehicle moves +3 steps on the condition track instead of +2.

talents_list.name: Improved Lightsaber Throw
talents_list.description: make a single ranged atk & compare to Ref Def of all targets in 6sq line, half on miss, DC20 return

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to throw your lightsaber at a group of opponents. You make a single ranged attack roll (treating the lightsaber as a thrown weapon) and compare the result to the Reflex Defense of all targets in a 6-square line originating in your square. If your attack roll result exceeds a target's Reflex Defense, you deal normal lightsaber damage to that target (dealing half damage if you fail to exceed the target's Reflex Defense). This attack is considered an area attack. You can pull your lightsaber back to your hand as a swift action by making a DC 20 Use the Force check. [[Weak talent option: remove FP requirement.]]

talents_list.name: Improved Manipulating Strike
talents_list.description: 1/turn when you dam target with non-area atk, Persuasion v. Will Def, you decide their move action
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use the Manipulating Strike talent, you determine what the target does with its move action on its next turn. You cannot move an opponent into a hazard (such as into lava or off a cliff).

talents_list.name: Improved Quick Draw
talents_list.description: may attack in surprise round

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are carrying a pistol (either in your hand or in a holster), you may draw the pistol and make a single attack during a surprise round even if you are surprised. If you are not surprised, you may take any single action of your choice, as normal.

talents_list.name: Improved Quick Draw (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: can draw ignite & attack with lightsaber even if surprised, can draw & ignite lightsaber as free
talents_list.full_text_description: If you are carrying a lightsaber (either in your hand or at your belt), you can draw the lightsaber, ignite it, and make a single attack during the surprise round even if you are surprised. If you are not surprised, you can take any single action of your choice, as normal. Additionally, once per turn you may draw and ignite a lightsaber as a free action on your turn.

talents_list.name: Improved Redirect
talents_list.description: once per turn when you redirect an attack do not count the initial deflect penalty

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, when you successfully redirect an attack with the Redirect Shot talent, do not count the Deflect use that triggered the redirected attack (thus, you take no cumulative penalty to Use the Force checks from that Deflect attempt). Subsequent Deflect attempts before the beginning of your next turn impose penalties as normal.

talents_list.name: Improved Riposte
talents_list.description: when you make a riposte do not count the initial block penalty

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully make a riposte attack using the Riposte talent, you do not count the Block use that triggered the riposte (thus, you take no cumulative penalty to Use the Force checks from that Block attempt). Subsequent Block attempts before the beginning of your next turn impose penalties as normal.

talents_list.name: Improved Sentinel Strike
talents_list.description: increase damage dice to d8 not d6

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Increase the damage dice of your Sentinel Strike to d8 instead of d6.

talents_list.name: Improved Sentinel's Gambit
talents_list.description: can use Sentinel's Gambit an additional number of times per encounter = half class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use Sentinel's Gambit an additional number of times an encounter equal to half your class level (minimum 1).

talents_list.name: Improved Skirmisher
talents_list.description: if move at least 2 sq & in a different square +1 all Def
talents_list.full_text_description: When you move at least 2 squares before your attack and end your move in a different square from where you started, you gain a +1 bonus to all your defenses until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Improved Sneak Attack
talents_list.description: use Sneak Attack for targets w/in 12 sq not 6

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Sneak Attack talent against a target within 12 squares, instead of within 6 squares.

talents_list.name: Improved Soft Cover
talents_list.description: if adjacent to a creature, +2 Ref Def until your next turn or  no longer adjacent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: While you occupy a square adjacent to another creature, you can use a swift action to gain a +2 cover bonus to your Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn or until you are no longer adjacent to another creature, whichever comes first.

talents_list.name: Improved Stealth
talents_list.description: reroll Stealth
talents_list.full_text_description: You may choose to reroll any Stealth check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Improved Stunning Strike
talents_list.description: if move opponent down CT with melee atk, target cannot take stan or full action its next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: When you damage an opponent with a melee attack that moves the target down the condition track, the target cannot take any action requiring a standard or full-round action on its next turn.

talents_list.name: Improved Suppression Fire
talents_list.description: when you suppress that enemy is -5 atk, if targeting with autofire each enemy -2 atk in area

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully suppress an enemy using the aid another action (see page 151 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), that enemy takes a -5 penalty on its attack rolls until the start of your next turn. When targeting an area with an autofire weapon, each enemy in the attack area takes a -2 penalty on its attack rolls until the start of your next turn, regardless of whether your attack hits.

talents_list.name: Improved Surveillance
talents_list.description: you and allies +1 on all defenses v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully use the Surveillance talent, you grant yourself and your allies a +1 insight bonus to all defenses against that target.

talents_list.name: Improved Trajectory
talents_list.description: increase fly speed 2sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You always use the proper trajectories to maximize efficiency of your rocket-pack burn rates. You increase your fly speed by 2 squares when using a jet pack.

talents_list.name: Improved Weaken Resolve
talents_list.description: same as Weaken but target keeps fleeing

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Weaken Resolve (see below), except that the target doesn't stop fleeing from you if it is wounded. (SotG) Unlike with other mind-affecting effects, you need only to hail a vehicle to weaken the crew's resolve. When you deal damage that equals or exceeds a vehicle's damage threshold, you may use this talent; in addition, you may ready an action to use this talent after any gunner on your vehicle deals damage that equals or exceeds a vehicle's damage threshold. You make your check against the vehicle's commander; all nonunique crews are assumed to have a Will Defense of 10. The effect is automatically negated if the target vehicle's Challenge Level is greater than your heroic level or your vehicle's Challenge Level.

talents_list.name: Improvised Device
talents_list.description: DC 25 Mechanics & 1 hour to create item = 200 credits x cl cannot be rare or illegal & must be familiar with item, destroyed after 24 hours, 1/day

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can create a temporary piece of almost any type of equipment from the spare parts you have around. To do so, you must make a DC 25 Mechanics check and spend one hour building the device. The object can have a maximum value of 200 credits x your class level, it cannot have an availability of rare or illegal, and it cannot be unique. The device you create must be something that you would reasonably be familiar with, and after 24 hours the object is destroyed. You can use this talent once per day.

talents_list.name: Improvised Weapon Master
talents_list.description: no penalty on improvised weapons

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take no penalty on attack rolls with improvised weapons.

talents_list.name: Incite Rage
talents_list.description: 1/encounter all allies w/in 12 sq & LOS +1 rage bonus on atk but -2 Ref Def until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can channel your anger and hatred into your allies. All allies within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight gain a +1 rage bonus on attack rolls but take a -2 penalty to their Reflex Defense. This effect lasts until the encounter ends, or you are knocked unconscious or killed.

talents_list.name: Incognito
talents_list.description: can reroll Deception for a deceptive appearance
talents_list.full_text_description: Spies are adept at concealing their identities, even if not using a physical disguise. You can reroll your Deception check for the purpose of creating a deceptive appearance, using the better result.

talents_list.name: Indomitable
talents_list.description: once per day, +5 CT, but not persistent conditions, can take multiple

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day as a swift action, you can move +5 steps on the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). This does not remove any persistent conditions that may be affecting you (see page 149). You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, you can use it one additional time per day. (SotG) This talent does not affect the condition track of a vehicle.

talents_list.name: Indomitable Will
talents_list.description: immune to all mind-affecting effects 1 minute

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to become immune to all mind-affecting effects for 1 minute.

talents_list.name: Influence Savant
talents_list.description: 1/encounter can return 1 Force mind-affecting force power w/out FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can return one Force power with the [mind-affecting] descriptor to your Force suite without spending a Force Point. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select it, you can use it one additional time per encounter.

talents_list.name: Influential Friends
talents_list.description: once per day friends take 20 on skill check with modifier 5+half your HL, takes 10*result min
talents_list.full_text_description: You have influential contacts within a certain organization, planet, or region who can provide concrete information to you on certain subjects. Once per day, you can have one of those contacts make a skill check on your behalf. The contact always takes 20 on the skill check (even if the skill would normally not allow taking 20) and has a skill modifier equal to 5 + one-half your heroic level. Contacting your influential allies and receiving the benefit of the skill check takes a number of minutes equal to 10 x the skill check result. (The Influential Friends talent grants a noble an automatic high skill check result that is the result of calling in favors from some well-connected allies. Some Gamemasters might wonder what the talent really represents. In essence, when a noble uses this talent, he calls in a favor from a contact, who sends a representative who has that skill (or just conveys the result of the skill check) to the heroes. For example, if the heroes need information on a crime lord but have no one trained in Gather Information, the noble uses this talent, and his contacts supply the heroes with the information from the resulting Gather Information check. Likewise, if the heroes need to get past a security checkpoint in a very important mission, the noble calls upon his influential friends to have a Deception check made to provide the heroes with high-quality fake identification and paperwork. The heroes must have access to planetary or interplanetary communications systems to use the talent.)

talents_list.name: Infuse Weapon
talents_list.description: weapon's DR doubled, lightsabers do not ignore, with Force Point on attack add 2xFP result to dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point to infuse an unpowered melee weapon (one that does not require an energy cell) with the strength of the Force, making it resistant to the attacks of other weapons. Infusing the weapon takes a full-round action. From that point forward, when you wield the weapon, its damage reduction is doubled, and lightsaber do not ignore the weapon's damage reduction. When you spend a Force Point to modify the attack roll of an infused weapon, you also add 2 x the Force Point's result to the damage roll if the attack is a success.

talents_list.name: Initiate of Vahl
talents_list.description: take half dam from heat or fire or no damage on a miss

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Having been formally initiated into Vahl’s priesthood, you are resistant to the effects of fire and extreme heat. You take half damage from attacks that deal fire damage, or no damage on a miss (if the fire damage is part of an area attack).

talents_list.name: Innocuous
talents_list.description: Deception v. Will Def in 6 sq & LOS target -5 Atk v. you until the start of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can make a Deception check against a single enemy within 6 squares of you and in line of sight. If the check equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, the target takes a -5 penalty on all attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Inquisition
talents_list.description: +1 attack rolls & +1 die damage vs. Force Sensitives

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are particularly adept at dealing with Force-sensitive foes. You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and deal +1 die of damage against targets that have the Force Sensitivity feat.

talents_list.name: Insight of the Force
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Knowledge if not trained, considered trained

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check in place of a Knowledge check for any Knowledge skill you are not trained in. You are considered trained in that Knowledge skill for the purposes of using this talent. If you are entitled to a Knowledge check reroll. you can reroll your Use the Force check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations).

talents_list.name: Insightful Aim
talents_list.description: substitute Use the Force mod for ranged attack bonus until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to substitute your Use the Force modifier for [ie instead of] your ranged attack bonus when making attacks with a ranged weapon until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Inspire Competence
talents_list.description: 1/turn one droid ally in LOS +Atk = 1/2 your CL, any in Networked Mind gains heuristic processor

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action once per turn, you can grant one droid ally within your line of sight a competence bonus on its next attack roll made before the start of your next turn equal to half your class level. Additionally, any droid designated as the target of your Networked Mind class feature is considered to have a heuristic processor whenever it is beneficial, even if it does not actually have a heuristic processor.

talents_list.name: Inspire Confidence
talents_list.description: all allies w/in sight, +1 Atk & skills for encounter or N unconscious

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can inspire confidence in all allies in your line of sight, granting them a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and a +1 morale bonus on skill checks for the rest of the encounter or until you're unconscious or dead. Once inspired, your allies don't need to remain within line of sight of you. You can't inspire confidence in yourself. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Inspire Fear I
talents_list.description: opponents of equal or lower level take -1 on Atk rolls, opposed skill checks, & Use the Force
talents_list.full_text_description: Your infamy and reputation are such that any opponent whose level is equal to or less than your character level takes a -1 penalty on attack rolls and opposed skill checks made against you, as well as Use the Force checks made to activate Force powers that target you. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

talents_list.name: Inspire Fear II
talents_list.description: -2 penalty

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Inspire Fear I (see above), except that the penalty increases to -2.

talents_list.name: Inspire Fear III
talents_list.description: -5 penalty

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As Inspire Fear I (see above), except that the penalty increases to -5.

talents_list.name: Inspire Haste
talents_list.description: ally makes skill check as move action, not standard
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can encourage one of your allies within line of sight to make haste with a skill check. On that ally's next turn, that ally can make a skill check that requires a standard action as a move action instead. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Inspire Loyalty
talents_list.description: gain 1 follower with AP feat & trained in Perception, can be taken max 3 times

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a single follower. Choose either the aggressive, defensive, or utility follower template for your follower, generating the follower's statistics based on the rules on CW page 32. This follower gains one Armor Proficiency feat of your choice and becomes trained in the Perception skill. The follower must meet the prerequisites for the Armor Proficiency feat you select. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do, you gain one additional follower (maximum of 3 followers).

talents_list.name: Inspire Wrath
talents_list.description: allies in LOS +2 Atk & skill checks v. your designated target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can designate a target to be the object of your allies' wrath. While your allies have line of sight to you or until you are unconscious or dead, your allies gain a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls against the target and a +2 morale bonus on skill checks against that target. You can designate a new target on any round by using another standard action. You can only use this talent against one opponent at a time.

talents_list.name: Inspire Zeal
talents_list.description: ally's attack moves target 1 more down CT
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an ally within line of sight of you makes an attack that moves an opponent down the condition track (such as by dealing damage that equals or exceeds the target's damage threshold), that ally moves the target an additional -1 step down the condition track. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Instinctive Navigation
talents_list.description: Use the Force replaces Use Computer for astrogation

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can substitute your Use the Force skill for [ie instead of] any Use Computer check made to astrogate or operate sensors while you are the pilot of a vehicle.

talents_list.name: Instruction
talents_list.description: once per encounter for one ally within 6sq can use your skill modifier for a skill check (not Use Force)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a standard action, you can boost the competence of one of your allies within 6 squares. That individual gains the ability to make a single skill check using your skill modifier (except Use the Force); this skill check must be made before the end of the encounter, or the benefit is lost. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you gain one additional use of this talent per encounter.

talents_list.name: Instrument of the Force
talents_list.description: when successfully Search Your Feelings gain FP & use before end of enc, if use w/unfavorable gain Dark Side Point, if use & gain Dark Side Point gain 2 points

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are particularly in tune with the living Force. When you successfully use Search Your Feelings, you gain a Force Point that must be used before the end of the encounter. If you use this Force Point in a manner that would end in unfavorable results (per Search Your Feelings), you raise your Dark Side Score by 1. If you use the Force Point in an action that would normally raise your Dark Side Score, you raise your Dark Side Score by 2 instead.

talents_list.name: Intentional Crash
talents_list.description: successful ram you take half from ram, if target is same size or smaller they cannot move next round
talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to intentionally crash an opponent's moving vehicle. When you successfully deal damage to a vehicle by ramming it, your vehicle takes half damage from the ram. Additionally, if the target vehicle is the same size as your vehicle or smaller, that vehicle cannot move in the following round.

talents_list.name: Interrogator
talents_list.description: v. adjacent, use Treat Injury instead of Persuasion to change attitude or intimidate

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can create an aura of unliving, emotionless menace that no biological creature can match, and combine it with the cruel application of medical knowledge. You can use your Treat Injury modifier on a Persuasion check to change attitude or intimidate. You must be adjacent to your target to use this ability, in addition to the normal requirements for these uses of the Persuasion skill.

talents_list.name: Intimate Knowledge
talents_list.description: 1/enc can take 20 on trained Knowledge or take 10 on untrained Knowledge even if can't

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Experienced spies and scouts remember many details from previous assignments, providing insights on later missions. Once per encounter as a standard action, you can take 20 on a check involving a Knowledge skill you are trained in, or take 10 on a check involving a Knowledge skill you are untrained in, even if circumstances would not normally allow you to take 10 or 20.

talents_list.name: Intimidating Defense
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, Persuasion if opp has attacked you, vs. Will then -5 that Atk (+5 if opp higher level)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction, you can make a Persuasion check to intimidate one creature that has made a melee or ranged attack against you if that creature is within line of sight. If you succeed, you impose a -5 penalty to that attack roll. If the target is higher level than you, it gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense against the Intimidating Defense. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Invisible Attacker
talents_list.description: if target is unaware of you, +1 die dam from ranged

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If your target is unaware of you, your ranged attacks deal +1 die of damage against that target.

talents_list.name: Ion Mastery
talents_list.description: with ion weapons +1 Atk & +1 die dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know the typical weaknesses of vehicles and droids, and you know how to preserve such targets for capture rather than destroying them. When attacking with ion weapons, you gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and deal +1 die of ion damage.

talents_list.name: Ion Resistance 10
talents_list.description: DR10 against ion dam
talents_list.full_text_description: You gain DR 10 against ion damage.

talents_list.name: Ion Turret
talents_list.description: 1/encounter, Tiny Init +4 Percep +4 Ref Def 10 10hp thresh 8 turret, 3d6 ion, you must be adjacent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can construct a turret that is highly effective against droids. The turret deals ion damage instead of normal damage.

talents_list.name: Irregular Tactics
talents_list.description: after using share talent Knowledge (tactics) as free to replace DC of any talents from this tree
talents_list.full_text_description: Your tactics confuse enemy commanders and tacticians that can see or otherwise observe your forces in action, such as when using sensors. After using the Share Talent special quality, make a Knowledge (tactics) check as a free action. The result replaces the DC of any talents that use Knowledge (tactics) from the Military Tactics talent tree used against your or your allies.

talents_list.name: It's a Trap!
talents_list.description: once per encounter, a single vehicle in LOS and immediate move action
talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at sensing the plans of enemy naval officers and counteracting them. Once per encounter as a reaction, you can grant the pilot of any single vehicle within line of sight (including a vehicle you are commanding) an immediate move action.

talents_list.name: Jar'Kai
talents_list.description: twice Lightsaber deflection bonus with two lightsabers

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Lightsaber Defense talent, you gain twice the normal deflection bonus to your Reflex Defense when you are wielding two lightsabers.

talents_list.name: Jedi Battle Commander
talents_list.description: your Battle Meditation grants +2 to attack not +1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are trained to direct Jedi in pitched battles. Your battle meditation grants a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls instead of the normal +1.

talents_list.name: Jedi Hunter
talents_list.description: Fort & Will Def +1 & you deal +1 die dam against Force Sensitives

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at fighting Jedi and other Force-users. You gain a +1 insight bonus to Fortitude and Will Defense and deal +1 die of damage against characters who have the Force Sensitivity feat.

talents_list.name: Jedi Network
talents_list.description: includes Acquire Equipment or Funds, Obtain Info, Receive Medical Attention, Secure Safe House

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have access to a network of Jedi sympathizers. While in a civilized area, you can call upon this network of allies once per game session for one of the following purposes: • Acquire Equipment or Funds: You can use your contacts to obtain material that might otherwise be licensed, restricted, military, or illegal, provided the total value of the equipment does not exceed your level in this class x 500 credits. Alternately, you can obtain a number of credits from your contacts equal to this amount to spend as you see fit. • Obtain Information: Your contacts provide you with information, automatically succeeding on a Gather Information check (and covering the credit cost of the check) provided that the DC does not exceed 20. • Receive Medical Attention: Your contacts provide you and up to three of your allies with medical attention as dispensed by a skilled physician or healer. The length of the treatment cannot exceed 24 hours, but is otherwise free of charge and completely private. •Secure Safe house: One of your contacts provides a safe redoubt for you and up to three of your allies, for a number of days equal to your Jedi Knight class level. While in hiding, you have no contact with anyone other than the individual who is hiding you. Once the allotted time is up, you must leave the safe house or risk discovery. For each day you remain in hiding past this deadline, the Gamemaster should roll 1d20. On a result of 15 or higher, your safe house is discovered, and your contact's complicity in keeping you hidden is exposed.

talents_list.name: Jedi Quarry
talents_list.description: +2 speed if you end move adjacent to target
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you designate a single target creature as the focus of your attentions. You gain a +2 bonus to your speed any time you spend a move action to move, provided that you end your movement adjacent to the target. You retain this bonus (and may not use this talent again) until your target surrenders, is reduced to 0 hit points, or moves to the bottom of the condition track, or until the encounter ends.

talents_list.name: Jet Pack Training
talents_list.description: activate as free, no Pilot check to land
talents_list.full_text_description: You can activate a jet pack as a free action on your turn. You need not make Pilot checks to land safely with a jet pack. [[Normally, activating a jet pack is a swift action, and you must make a DC 20 Pilot check if you land after moving more than 12 squares during the same turn; on a failure, you fall prone.]]

talents_list.name: Jet Pack Withdraw
talents_list.description: once per encounter when enemy moves adjacent expend one charge to fly or move speed or withdraw
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction when an opponent moves adjacent to you, you can expend one charge of your jet pack to fly and move your speed or withdraw.

talents_list.name: Juggernaut
talents_list.description: armor does not reduce speed or distance moved while running
talents_list.full_text_description: Your armor does not reduce your speed or the distance you can move while running. You must be proficient with the armor you are wearing to gain this benefit.

talents_list.name: Juke
talents_list.description: when fighting defensively, may negate one more attack per round with Vehicular Combat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you fight defensively as the pilot of a vehicle (see CR page 171), you may negate a weapon hit on your vehicle using the Vehicular Combat feat one additional time per round.

talents_list.name: Jury-Rigger
talents_list.description: reroll Mechanics check to jury-rig
talents_list.full_text_description: You may reroll any Mechanics check made to accomplish a jury-rigged repair (see the Mechanics skill, CR page 68). You must, however, accept the result of the reroll.

talents_list.name: Just What Is Needed
talents_list.description: restore +1d8 hp when use Repair of Mechanics & with aid another

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have a knack for finding the best quality replacement parts for broken equipment. Whenever you use the Repair application of the Mechanics skill, you restore an extra 1d8 hit points with a successful Mechanics check, in addition to what you would normally restore.
