If you use the aid another action to assist an ally with repairs, that ally also repairs an extra 1d8 hit points with a successful Mechanics check. Any ally can only benefit from this talent once per Mechanics check, regardless of how many allies with this talent aid on the check.

talents_list.name: Just a Droid
talents_list.description: 1/enc: use Sneak of Stealth in plain sight & considered trained; reroll Deception when acting atypical
talents_list.full_text_description: You are adept at passing yourself off as an ordinary droid. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter. •Just Another Droid: You are skilled at using Stealth to sneak past unwary enemies when moving in plain sight. You can use the Sneak application of the Stealth skill when in plain sight of an enemy, if the enemy has no reason to doubt that you are just another droid. You are considered trained in Stealth for this action. •Just a Normal Droid: You can reroll Deception checks for deceptive appearance to make observers believe that you are carrying out a standard function when attempting to do something atypical for your droid model or function. You may keep either result.

talents_list.name: Just a Scratch
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Equipped & proficient with medium or better armor

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Equipped & proficient with medium or better armor

talents_list.description: 1/enc as reac reduce dam from 1 atk that targets your Ref Def by the amount of your Fort Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction, you can reduce the damage from a single attack that targets your Reflex Defense by an amount equal to your Fortitude Defense.

talents_list.name: Juyo
talents_list.description: once per encounter, single enemy in LOS, may reroll your first Atk roll, keeping best
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you may spend a Force Point as a swift action to designate a single enemy in your line of sight. For the remainder of the encounter, you may reroll your first attack roll each round against that opponent, keeping the better result.

talents_list.name: K'tara Expertise
talents_list.description: 1/turn creature or droid damaged by unarmed atk, disarm as swif, do not take -5 if in two hands

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, when you damage a creature or droid with an unarmed attack, you can make an attack to disarm as a swift action. Also, you do not take the -5 penalty to your attack roll if the target is wielding a weapon with more than one hand.

talents_list.name: K'thri Expertise
talents_list.description: any enemy adjacent takes dam = your Str mod (min 1) if you can make Atk of Opp if you're in light or no armor

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any enemy that begins its turn adjacent to you takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1 point) if you are able to make an attack of opportunity against them. You can use this talent while wearing only light armor or no armor.

talents_list.name: Keen Shot
talents_list.description: no penalty vs. opponents in concealment (except total concealment)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take no penalty on your attack roll when attacking a target with concealment (but not total concealment).  Unleashed: When you make a ranged attack, you can spend a Destiny Point to ignore all cover on attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Keep It Going
talents_list.description: if you reduce your prime target to 0 hp, designate a new prime target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you reduce your prime target to 0 hit points, as a free action you can designate another target within your line of sight as your new prime target. This new target remains your prime target until the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Keep It Together
talents_list.description: once per encounter, vehicle avoids moving down CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully jury-rig a device or vehicle, the vehicle does not move -5 steps along the condition track at the end of the encounter, though it does move -2 persistent steps down the condition track.

talents_list.name: Keep Them Honest
talents_list.description: with Aid Another to suppress enemy, enemy takes -5 on all atk rolls until end of your next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: When using the aid another action to suppress an enemy (see page 151 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), the enemy instead takes a -5 penalty to all attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Keep Them Reeling
talents_list.description: make single melee atk v. within reach, if hits deal no damage but target must move/withdraw next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a single melee attack against a target within reach. If the attack hits, you deal no damage, but your target must move or withdraw away from you on its next turn.

talents_list.name: Keep Them Reeling
talents_list.description: 1/turn make opposed Initiative check v. prime target, if win prime target is flat-footed v. you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn as a swift action, you can make an Initiative check, opposed by the Initiative check of your prime target. If your check result equals or exceeds your prime target’s check result, your target is flat-footed against all attacks you make before the end of your turn.

talents_list.name: Keep Them at Bay
talents_list.description: if you aid another to suppress an attack, the enemy takes -5 on its atk not -2
talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the aid another action to suppress an enemy, that enemy takes a -5 penalty on its next attack instead of the normal -2 penalty. Only 1 character may gain the benefits of this talent against a given target at a time.

talents_list.name: Keep Together
talents_list.description: when hit or missed by attack move speed as reac & must end adjacent to ally, no AoO
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are hit or missed by a melee or a ranged attack, you can move up to your speed as a reaction, provided that you end your movement adjacent to an ally. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Keep it Together
talents_list.description: if you jury-rig vehicle moves -2 CT at end not -5
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when a vehicle you're piloting takes damage that equals or exceeds its damage threshold, your vehicle avoids moving down the condition track (see Conditions, page 148).

talents_list.name: Knack
talents_list.description: once a day, reroll skill check
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, you can reroll a skill check and take the better result. You can select this talent multiple times; each time you select this talent, you can use it one additional time per day. [[Weak talent option: make it 1/encounter instead of 1/day.]]

talents_list.name: Knight's Morale
talents_list.description: when ally w/in 12 sq hits with lightsaber you gain +1 all Def until end of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally within 12 squares of you and within your line of sight hits with a lightsaber attack, you gain a +1 morale bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Knockback
talents_list.description: with a crit move opponent back 1sq if they are not grabbed/grappled or into something, within 2 sizes
talents_list.full_text_description: When you score a critical hit against a target no more than two size categories larger than you are, you can choose to move that opponent 1 square in any direction as a free action. You cannot use this talent on an opponent that is being grabbed or grappled, and you cannot move your target into a solid object or another creature's fighting space.

talents_list.name: Knockdown Shot
talents_list.description: aim before attacking and knock target prone, no bigger than two size categories

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you aim before making a ranged attack (see Aim, page 154) and the attack hits, you knock the target prone in addition to dealing damage. You can't use this talent to knock down targets two or more size categories bigger than you.

talents_list.name: Know Weakness
talents_list.description: target of Adversary Lore takes +1d6 dam from successful attacks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use Adversary Lore on a target successfully, that target also takes an additional 1d6 points of damage from any successful attack made against it by you or an ally who can hear and understand you until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Know Your Enemy
talents_list.description: select an enemy in LOS & Knowledge (galactic lore) v. DC15+CL, can learn 2 pieces of info (see F25)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are well versed in the strengths and weaknesses of enemies of your cause. As a swift action, you can select a single enemy within line of sight and make a Knowledge (galactic lore) check against a DC equal to 15 + the target's CL. If the check is successful, you immediately learn any two (your choice) of the following pieces of information: target's base attack bonus or attack bonus with a particular weapon, any one defense score, any one skill modifier, or the presence of any one talent or feat (you choose the talent or feat, and the Gamemaster reveals whether or not it is present).

talents_list.name: Knowledge and Defense
talents_list.description: add Wis bonus to Ref Def if denied Dex

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You add your Wisdom bonus to your Reflex Defense whenever your Dexterity bonus would normally be denied to you .

talents_list.name: Knowledge is Life
talents_list.description: Knowledge (galactic lore) DC15+CL for +2 one defense v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can designate a single target within line of sight and make a Knowledge (galactic lore) check against a DC equal to 15 + the target's CL. If the check is successful, for the remainder of the encounter you gain a +2 morale bonus to the defense score of your choice against that target.

talents_list.name: Knowledge is Power
talents_list.description: Knowledge (galactic lore) DC15+CL for crit +1 range v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can designate a single target within your line of sight and make a Knowledge (galactic lore) check against a DC equal to 15 +the target's CL. If the check is successful, for the remainder of the encounter you score a critical hit against that target on a natural roll of 19 or 20. If you have another ability that increases your weapon's critical range against that target (such as the elite trooper's extended critical range talent, or the Jedi Knight's Vaapad talent), you increase this range by 1 (for example, from 19-20 to 18-20). However, anything other than a natural 20 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll anything other than a natural 20 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Knowledge is Strength
talents_list.description: Knowledge (galactic lore) DC15+CL for +2 atk v. target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can designate a single target within your line of sight and make a Knowledge (galactic lore) check against a DC equal to 15 + the target's CL. If the check is successful, for the remainder of the encounter you gain a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls against that target.

talents_list.name: Knowledge of the Force
talents_list.description: aid an ally in 6sq on Use the Force

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your scholarly knowledge of the Force to help others reach their full potential. You can spend a Force Point as a reaction to aid another ally within 6 squares on a Use the Force check, following the normal rules for the aid another action as usual.

talents_list.name: Known Dissident
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def 1 opponent in LOS, opponent may not attack until next turn (+5 if higher level)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are a well-known opponent of a large and influential government or organization (such as the Empire or the Corporate Sector Authority). Officials of any level are loath to take action against you, lest they inadvertently promote your cause. As a standard action, you can make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of a single opponent within line of sight that can hear and understand you. If your Persuasion check succeeds, that opponent may not attack you or any vehicle you occupy until the start of your next turn. If the target is of higher level than you, it gains a +5 bonus to its Will Defense, and the target must be able to hear and understand you. If the target is attacked, the effect of this talent ends. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Known Vulnerability
talents_list.description: DC 15 Knowledge (life sciences) for until end of enc target -2 atk after your successful melee atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know the vulnerable spots to hit on most species. As a free action, you make a DC 15 Knowledge (life sciences) check (DC 25 for rare species, DC 35 for unknown species, both as determined by the Gamemaster). If the check is successful, until the end of the encounter, whenever you make a successful melee or unarmed attack that deals damage against a target of that species, your target takes a -2 penalties to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Krath Illusions
talents_list.description: reduce penalty for large illusions by one half (min -1)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can reduce the penalty for large illusions by one half (rounded down, minimum -1).

talents_list.name: Krath Intuition
talents_list.description: once per encounter treat damage from a Sith alchemical weapon as if you rolled max on Force Point

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have a natural ability to use dark-side artifacts, such as Sith talismans and alchemical weapons. Once per encounter, you may spend a Force Point to treat the damage from a Sith alchemical weapon as though you had rolled the maximum damage on the dice.

talents_list.name: Krath Surge
talents_list.description: once per encounter add 1 die dam or extend range 6sq, adds "dark side" to descriptor

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, using rudimentary Sith sorcery, you channel dark side energy in a manner that boosts one use of a Force power. As a swift action, you can add 1 die of damage (if the power deals damage) or extend the range of the power by 6 squares (if it has a range beyond yourself or a single target). Using this talent automatically adds the [dark side] descriptor to the power used.

talents_list.name: Labyrinthine Mind
talents_list.description: 1/encounter you become immune to mind-affecting effects until your next turn, lose affects if choose

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction, you become immune to all mind-affecting effects until the end of your next turn (you can choose to ignore this for beneficial effects). Any mind-affecting effects currently affecting you are also removed, though you can choose to retain any beneficial effects you currently have.

talents_list.name: Launch Point
talents_list.description: any ally who starts in your safe zone & then exits it, +2 atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any ally who starts his or her turn within your safe zone and then exits the zone gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls before the end of that ally’s turn, provided that the ally is not within your safe zone when the attack is made.

talents_list.name: Lead From the Front
talents_list.description: if you do not have cover from target you dam with ranged atk, allies +2 atk v. target & +5 opposed Initiative checks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you do not have cover from a target that you damage with a ranged attack, all your allies gain a +2 morale bonus to attack rolls against that target and a +5 circumstance bonus to opposed Initiative checks against that target until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Lead by Example
talents_list.description: once per encounter when you deal dam all allies +1 Atk & +1 die dam on non-area atks for encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your bravery and skill inspires others to follow your lead. Once per encounter, when you successfully deal damage to an enemy, you can choose to grant all allies a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls and +1 die of damage on non-area attacks against that target for the remainder of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Lead by Example
talents_list.description: any character that would benefit from shared talent: 1. DC -5, 2. +2 atk Def or dam, 3. reduce dam taken by 10

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you have already used a talent in an encounter before granting the same talent to an ally with your Share Talent special quality in the same encounter, any character who benefits from Share Talent gains one of the following bonuses when using that talent: Reduce the talent’s DC by 5; gain an additional +2 bonus to any bonus to attack, Defense, or damage used by the talent; or reduce the amount of damage taken by the character through the use of the talent by 10 points. If the talent can be affected by more than one effect, the character using the talent selects the desired effect.

talents_list.name: Leading Feint
talents_list.description: when you dam an opp, Deception to feint, if successful, ally in 12sq, target as flat-foot v. your opp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully damage an opponent with a melee attack, you can make a Deception check to feint against that target as a swift action. If successful, you designate an ally within 12 squares; your target is treated as flat-footed against the first attack that ally makes against your target before the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Leading Skill
talents_list.description: When you succeed with skill in skill challenge, gain +2 on different skill roll in same challenge

effects.target_description: different skill roll in same challenge

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you earn a success in a skill challenge, you gain a +2 insight bonus to your next skill check made with a different skill in the same skill challenge.

talents_list.name: Learn from Mistakes
talents_list.description: When you fail check in skill challenge, next ally gains +2 with different skill
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you accrue a failure in a skill challenge, you grant the next ally to take an action in the skill challenge a +2 insight bonus to a skill check, provided that ally takes a different action (and uses a different skill) than you did.

talents_list.name: Legendary Commander
talents_list.description: gunners on your ship add 1/2 your HL or 1/2 their HL to dam & treat crew as one level higher calculate your capital ship's Ref Def as your HL+1/2armor (round down) if higher

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are the commander of a capital ship, calculate its Reflex Defense using your heroic level plus one-half the ship's armor bonus (round down), the pilot's heroic level, or the ship's armor bonus, whichever is more. In addition, all gunners on your ship add one-half your heroic level or one-half their heroic level, whichever is more, to damage rolls with vehicle weapons. Finally, you treat any generic crew as being one quality level higher (maximum of ace).

talents_list.name: Liberate
talents_list.description: one ally w/in 12 sq & LOS that is grabbed etc & release them & can move half spd as reac w/no AoO
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to designate one ally within 12 squares of you and in line of sight that is currently grabbed, grappled, or immobilized; that target automatically escapes from the grab or grapple (or the immobilizing effect is removed), and the target can move up to half its speed immediately as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Lifesaver
talents_list.description: 1/encounter if ally to 0 hp or over thresh you may move your spd to be adjacent and take dam instead
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a reaction, when an ally takes damage that equals or exceeds its damage threshold or reduces it to 0 hit points, you can move up to your speed provided you end your movement adjacent to that ally. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal, you take all of the damage that triggered this talent’s use, and your ally takes no damage.

talents_list.name: Lightsaber Defense
talents_list.description: +1 to Ref Def, must have activated lightsaber, aware and not flat-footed, +3 max

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can use your lightsaber to parry your opponents' attacks, gaining a +1 deflection bonus to your Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. You must have a lightsaber drawn and ignited to use this talent, and you don't gain the deflection bonus if you are flat-footed or otherwise unaware of the incoming attack. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, the deflection bonus increases by +1 (maximum +3). [[*Weak talent options: remove swift action requirement. Or change the +1 bonus to +2 bonus and remove the ability to select this talent multiple times OR the second time you pick the talent you gain a +1 bonus.]]

talents_list.name: Lightsaber Evasion
talents_list.description: when an enemy misses with a lightsaber you can move 2 sq without Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an enemy misses you with a melee attack with a lightsaber, you may move up to 2 squares in any direction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Lightsaber Form Savant
talents_list.description: 1/encounter return 1 lightsaber form to suite w/out spending FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you can return any one spent Force power with the [lightsaber form] descriptor to your Force suite without spending a Force Point. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select it, you can use it one additional time per encounter.

talents_list.name: Lightsaber Specialist
talents_list.description: +2 Block & Deflect with a lightsaber you built

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are armed with a lightsaber that you built, you gain a +2 morale bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Block and Deflect talents.

talents_list.name: Lightsaber Throw
talents_list.description: if within 6 squares, can pull back as a swift action w/DC20 Use the Force
talents_list.full_text_description: You can throw a lightsaber as a standard action, treating it as a thrown weapon (without this talent, a thrown lightsaber is considered an improvised thrown weapon). You are considered proficient with the thrown lightsaber, and you apply the normal range penalties to the attack roll (see Table 8-5: Range Penalties). The thrown lightsaber deals normal weapon damage if it hits. If your target is no more than 6 squares away, you can pull your lightsaber back to your hand as a swift action by making a DC 20 Use the Force check. [[Weak talent options: If a thrown lightsaber deals damage, it becomes embedded in your target, remaining there and causing an additional die of damage each round at the end of the target's turn, and also when it is removed (removing the embedded weapon is a swift action and an adjacent ally can remove the embedded weapon for you). Your target must be within 6 squares of you. When you retrieve it, it deals an additional die of damage in the process, if the weapon is embedded in the target, as above). This is similar to the Force Throw talent. Weak talent option 2: Increase range to retreive lightsaber to 12sq. Also make the throw an accurate weapon.]]

talents_list.name: Lingering Debilitation
talents_list.description: 1/enc target -1 CT & persistent condition

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when you successfully use Debilitating Shot to move a target character -1 step on the condition track, the target suffers a persistent condition requiring 4 hours of rest or a DC 25 Treat Injury check to remove.

talents_list.name: Link
talents_list.description: 1 ally w/in 12 sq & LOS & trained in UtF, as long as w/in 12 sq can aid another as a reac, -5 other UtF

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can lend your strength in the Force to another character, creating a bond between you through which the Force flows. As a standard action, you can designate one willing ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. This ally must be trained in the Use the Force skill. As long as you remain within 12 squares of each other, you can aid each other on Use the Force checks as a reaction. However, the character using the aid another reaction takes a -5 penalty on all Use the Force checks until the end of his next turn. This link lasts until the end of the encounter, or until you or your ally ends the link (a free action). You can have only one active link at a time.

talents_list.name: Linked Defense
talents_list.description: take up to -5 on Atk to give up to +5 Ref Def to ally in LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can take a penalty of up to -5 on your attack roll and add the same number (up to +5) as a Force bonus to an ally's Reflex Defense, provided the ally is within your line of sight when you activate this talent. The bonus you confer cannot exceed your base attack bonus. The changes to your attack rolls and your ally's Reflex Defense last until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Load Launcher
talents_list.description: proficient with improvised thrown weapons, objects 1 size larger than you can be thrown a number of sq = 2 x Str bonus (min 1) & add Str bonus to dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are considered proficient with improvised thrown weapons (see page 150 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) when making a ranged attack by throwing an object. Objects up to one size category larger than you can be thrown up to a number of squares equal to 2 x your Strength bonus (minimum 1 square). Additionally, you add your Strength bonus to any damage dealt.

talents_list.name: Lockdown Strike
talents_list.description: when you hit a moving opp that is one size larger or smaller with Atk of Opp, ends movement
talents_list.full_text_description: When you hit a moving opponent that is one size category larger than you or smaller with an attack of opportunity, you immediately end its current movement.

talents_list.name: Long Call
talents_list.description: reduce DC for telepathy by half w/willing, reroll w/unwilling & keep better, FP = # of targets = Cha mod (min 2) w/single UtF check
talents_list.full_text_description: When using the telepathy ability of Use the Force, you reduce the DC of the Use the Force check by half, as do those Force-users for whom you are a willing telepathic recipient. When attempting to contact an unwilling target, you can reroll and take the better result. By spending a Force Point, you can simultaneously contact a number of targets equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum two) with a single Use the Force check.

talents_list.name: Long Stride
talents_list.description: move +2 squares if wearing light or no armor
talents_list.full_text_description: Your speed increases by 2 squares if you are wearing light armor or no armor. If you have a natural fly, climb, or swim speed, it increases by 2 squares as well. You cannot use this talent if you are wearing medium or heavy armor.

talents_list.name: Lose Pursuit
talents_list.description: +5 to avoid dogfight of you and ally when adjacent to Colossal or smaller ally

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When a vehicle that you are piloting is adjacent to a vehicle of Colossal size or smaller that is piloted by an ally, both you and your ally gain a +5 circumstance bonus to Pilot checks to avoid being pulled into a dogfight as an attack of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Luck Favors the Bold
talents_list.description: gain hp = 5 + 1/2 level if 1 enemy in LOS is aware & you don't have cover v. that enemy

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If at least one enemy in your line of sight is aware of you and you do not have cover against that enemy, at the start of your turn if you are conscious you gain a number of bonus hit points equal to 5 + one-half your level. Damage is subtracted from bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter are lost. Bonus hit points do not stack.

talents_list.name: Lucky Shot
talents_list.description: once a day, reroll Atk roll
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, you can reroll an attack roll and take the better result. You can select this talent multiple times; each time you select this talent, you can use it one additional time per day. [[Weak talent option: make it 1/encounter instead of 1/day. ]]

talents_list.name: Lucky Stop
talents_list.description: once an encounter can negate damage a single attack that would normally reduce you to 0 hp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: A successful hit against you is mitigated by an item you just happen to be wearing or carrying, or glances off your armor or clothing in just the right way. Once per encounter, as a reaction, you can negate the damage from a single attack that would normally reduce you to 0 hit points.

talents_list.name: Luka Sene Master
talents_list.description: 1/encounter gain temp FP to spend w/ Luka Sene or Sense talents, to Search Feelings or Sense Force

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are a master of Luka Sene techniques and an expert in using sense-related talents and powers. Once per encounter, you gain a temporary Force Point that you must spend when activating a talent from the Sense or Luka Sene talent trees, using the farseeing Force power, or on a Use the Force check made to use the Search Your Feelings or Sense Force applications of the skill. The Force Point is lost if not used before the end of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Lure Closer
talents_list.description: 1/turn Deception v. Will Def of 1 enemy in 12 sq & LOS, target must move half its spd toward you but avoiding hazards (stops move if can't avoid hazard), does not provoke Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a move action, you can make a Deception check against the Will Defense of one enemy within 12 squares and within your line of sight. If your check result equals or exceeds the target’s Will Defense, the target must move a number of squares equal to half its speed, and each square of movement must bring the target closer to you (though the target does avoid hazards and obstacles). If the target cannot avoid a hazard (such as a pit), it stops moving in the nearest safe square. This movement is considered involuntary and does not provoke attacks of opportunity. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Maintain Focus
talents_list.description: 1/turn grant all droid allies in LOS to take Recover in 2 swif not 3

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action once per turn, you can grant all droid allies within your line of sight the ability to take the Recover action as two swift actions (instead of as three swift actions) until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Makashi
talents_list.description: lightsaber defense bonus increase by 2 (max of 5)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When wielding a single lightsaber in one hand, the deflection bonus you gain from the Lightsaber Defense talent (see page 41) increases by 2 (to a maximum of +5).

talents_list.name: Make Do
talents_list.description: no penalty with improvised weapons

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When fighting with an improvised weapon, you take no penalty on your attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Make a Break for It
talents_list.description: 1/encounter can move half your speed on a vehicle or half vehicle speed if pilot without Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, while on or in a vehicle, you can move up to one half your speed or move the vehicle up to one-half its speed if you are the pilot, as a swift action. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Make an Example
talents_list.description: when you hit with attack and damage exceeds thresh target takes -5 to hit you until end of your turn

effects.target_description: hit you until end of your turn

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you hit with an attack and deal enough damage to exceed a target’s damage threshold, that target takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Malkite Techniques
talents_list.description: if attack exceeds Fort Def, target is poisoned, poison makes Atk d20+HL v. Fort Def damage = d6+1/2HL & moves down CT, poison attacks until it misses or cured
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can apply a toxin to any nonenergy slashing or piercing weapon as a standard action. If an attack roll with that weapon also exceeds the target's Fortitude Defense, that target is poisoned. Each round on the creature's turn, the poison makes an attack roll (1d20 + your heroic level) against the target's Fortitude Defense. If the attack succeeds, the target takes damage equal to 1d6 + one-half your heroic level and moves -1 step along the condition track. A target moved to the end of the condition track by the poison is unconscious but continues to take damage as long as the poison continues to attack. The poison attacks each round until it misses or until the victim is cured with a Treat Injury check (DC 10 + your heroic level).

talents_list.name: Man Down
talents_list.description: if ally within 6sq reduced to 0 hp, move up to speed toward ally without Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an ally within 6 squares is reduced to 0 hit points, you can immediately move up to your speed toward that ally as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Mandalorian Advance
talents_list.description: once per encounter on your turn you move your speed as free before any other action
talents_list.full_text_description: Veteran Mandalorians know how to move on the battlefield. Once per encounter, on your turn, you can move up to your speed as a free action before any other action.

talents_list.name: Mandalorian Ferocity
talents_list.description: once per encounter with more than one atk you can add one die for each successful hit
talents_list.full_text_description: Mandalorians can be ferocious fighters. Select one weapon group or exotic weapon you are proficient with. Once per encounter, when making more than one attack in a round, you can add one damage die to each successful hit with the selected weapon group or exotic weapon. You can take this talent more than once, selecting a different weapon group each time.

talents_list.name: Mandalorian Glory
talents_list.description: once per encounter when you reduce opp hp to 0 gain +5 atk with next attack in same encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Above everything else, Mandalorians fight for glory in battle. Once per encounter, when you reduce an opponent's hit points to 0, you gain a +5 attack bonus with your next attack during the same encounter.

talents_list.name: Manifest Guardian Spirit
talents_list.description: guardian spirit present for enc w/in 6 sq of you, as long as w/in 12 sq you: +1 atk, +2 UtF, +2 Will Def you can move spirit 6 sq as swif action 1/turn
talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a swift action to have your guardian spirit manifest for the duration of the encounter. Your guardian spirit appears in any square within 6 squares of you. A guardian spirit occupies a space, but creatures can move through the guardian spirit without obstruction. As long as the guardian spirit remains within 12 squares of you, you gain a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls, a +2 morale bonus on Use the Force checks, and a +2 morale bonus to Will Defense. You can move the guardian spirit up to 6 squares as a swift action once per turn.

talents_list.name: Manipulating Strike
talents_list.description: 1/turn when you dam target with non-area atk, Persuasion v. Will Def, you decide their swif action

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn when you successfully damage a target with a non-area attack, make an immediate Persuasion check against the target's Will Defense. If successful, you can determine what the target does with its swift action on its next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Many Shades of the Force
talents_list.description: one force power no longer has dark or light side descriptor

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose one Force power with the [dark side] or [light side] descriptor in your Force suite. That power is no longer considered to have that descriptor for you. [[It is believed that the descriptor is removed for all instances of a Force power in your Force suite, even if you have multiple instances of that power]]

talents_list.name: Mark the Target
talents_list.description: when you damage target with non-area atk, 1 ally in LOS treats target as if flat-footed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you damage a target with a non-area ranged attack, you may designate one ally within your line of sight as a swift action. Your target is considered flat-footed against that ally's first attack made before the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Martial Resurgence
talents_list.description: recover all Force powers on a nat 20 on an unarmed attack

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You recover all spent Force powers, adding them to your Force suite again, whenever you roll a natural 20 on an unarmed attack.

talents_list.name: Mask Presence
talents_list.description: become immune to Sense Force & appear to be normal droid until you use the Force
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you become immune to the Sense Force application of the Use the Force skill, and appear to be nothing more than a regular droid in the Force. If you make a Use the Force check or use any Force power or Force talent, this effect immediately ends.

talents_list.name: Masquerade
talents_list.description: Use the Force = Deception for creating deceptive appearance

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Illusion talent to create a disguise for yourself. You use the result of your Use the Force check made to create the illusion for the purposes of creating a deceptive appearance, as per the application of the Deception skill. All other rules and restrictions for using the Illusion talent still apply.

talents_list.name: Master Advisor
talents_list.description: ally you use Skilled Advisor with gains Force Point to be spent before end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Skilled Advisor talent (see page 40 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), the ally you aid gains one temporary Force Point at the end of her next turn. If the Force Point is not spent before the end of the encounter, it is lost.

talents_list.name: Master Defender
talents_list.description: fight defensively = +5 Ref Def & -2 atk or +10 Ref Def & -5 atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you fight defensively, either your vehicle gains a +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense if you and your gunners take a -2 penalty to attack rolls, or it gains a +10 dodge bonus if you and your gunners take a -5 penalty to attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Master Manipulator
talents_list.description: w/successful persuasion check make  2nd Persuasion of any type

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are a master of making things happen the way you want them to. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a swift action on your turn: •Demand Recovery: Select one ally within 5 squares and in your line of sight. That ally moves +5 steps on the condition track and gains a +2 morale bonus to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of your next turn. •Exceptional Control: Roll a d20 and note the result. Once before the end of the encounter, as a reaction you can replace the result of any enemy's or ally's d20 roll with the result you rolled for this ability. The enemy or ally must be within your line of sight. •Word of Warning: Select one ally within 5 squares and in your line of sight. Once before the end of the encounter, as a reaction to that ally having any defense score targeted by a skill check or an attack, you can replace that ally's defense score with your same defense score until the attack or skill check is resolved.

talents_list.name: Master Manipulator
talents_list.description: 1/enc each: 1. ally w/in 5 sq & LOS +5 CT & +2 atk & skills, 2. roll d20 as reac can replace enemy or ally in LOS d20 roll, 3. ally w/in 5 sq & LOS can replace their def with your def as reac for next

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a successful Persuasion check, you can immediately make a second Persuasion check against the same target, even if it is not normally allowed. The second Persuasion check need not be for the same use of the Persuasion skill as the first. For example, if you successfully change the attitude of the target, you can immediately attempt to change it a second time, or you can attempt to intimidate the target instead.

talents_list.name: Master Mender
talents_list.description: when you temporarily mend biotech using Treat Injury moves +4 CT and only -3 down at end
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you temporarily mend a biotech device using the Treat Injury skill (see page 32), the mended device moves +4 steps on the condition track. In addition, the mended device only moves -3 steps down the condition track at the end of the scene or encounter, and is only disabled if this reduction brings it to -5 steps on the track.

talents_list.name: Master Negotiator
talents_list.description: target moves -2 CT
talents_list.full_text_description: If you successfully use the Adept Negotiator talent (see above), your target moves an additional -1 step along the condition track (-2 steps total). This is a mind-affecting effect. (SotG) You affect the condition track of a specific character (usually the vehicle's commander), not a starship.

talents_list.name: Master Slicer
talents_list.description: reroll Use Computer checks to improve access to computers
talents_list.full_text_description: You may choose to reroll any Use Computer check made to improve access on a computer, keeping the better of the two results.

talents_list.name: Master of Elegance
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Dual or Single Weapon Flourish I, Weapon Finesse

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Dual or Single Weapon Flourish I

talents_list.description: add Dex to melee dam with light melee weapon, double if two-handed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You may add your Dexterity bonus (instead of your Strength bonus) on damage rolls when wielding a light melee weapon. When you wield a light melee weapon two-handed, you may apply double your Dexterity bonus (instead of double your Strength bonus) to the damage.

talents_list.name: Master of the Great Hunt
talents_list.description: +1 atk & +1 die dam v. beast with Dark Side Score of 1+

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +1 Force bonus on attack rolls and deal +1 die of damage on lightsaber attacks made against a beast with a Dark Side Score of 1+.

talents_list.name: Master's Orders
talents_list.description: ally can reroll any atk or check made on an action granted by you
talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally uses an action granted to him or her by you, the ally can reroll any attack or check made during that action, taking the better result.

talents_list.name: Masterwork Lightsaber
talents_list.description: add one extra accessory, reroll one die of dam if you built, mentor another building (-5 their DC)
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you build a lightsaber, you do so with such expertise that it makes the weapon even more refined and elegant. When you build a lightsaber, you can choose to add one extra accessory to the lightsaber at the time of creation, and when you hit a target with a lightsaber that you built, you can always choose to reroll one damage die from your damage roll, but you must keep the second result, even if it is worse. In addition, you can mentor another character while he constructs his own lightsaber. When you do so, you reduce the Use the Force check DC for constructing the lightsaber by -5.

talents_list.name: Maximize Cover
talents_list.description: if opponent use aim to negate cover, Stealth v. attacker's Initiative to retain cover

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an opponent uses the aim action to negate your cover, you can make a Stealth check opposed by the attacker's Initiative check. If successful, you retain your cover bonus.

talents_list.name: Mechanics Mastery
talents_list.description: can always take 10 on Mechanics
talents_list.full_text_description: You can always take 10 on a Mechanics check, even if distractions or hazardous circumstances would normally prevent you from doing so.

talents_list.name: Mechanized Rider
talents_list.description: w/speeder can use Fast Mount or Dismount, Soft Fall, Stay in Saddle & Use Mount as Cover of Ride

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You use your riding experience to improve your skills on a speeder bike or a swoop. When riding a speeder bike or a swoop (or similar vehicle), you can use the following applications of the Ride skill (CR page 72): Fast Mount or Dismount, Soft Fall, Stay in Saddle, and Use Mount as Cover.

talents_list.name: Medical Analyzer
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Medical droid, Trained in Know (life sciences)
talents_list.description: add Int mod to Treat Injury for Treat Disease/Poison/Radiation

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You use your medical knowledge and advanced droid processor to improve your treatment of medical conditions. When making a Treat Injury check to Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Radiation, you can also add your Intelligence modifier to your roll.

talents_list.name: Medical Droid
talents_list.description: with a medpac for first aid, gain 2 hp for every point over DC instead of 1

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a medpac to perform first aid with the Treat Injury skill, the creature gains 2 hit points for every point by which your check exceeds the DC (rather than the normal 1 hit point).

talents_list.name: Medical Miracle
talents_list.description: DC20 Treat Injury on adjacent, target uses second wind even if above half hp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a DC 20 Treat Injury check on an adjacent target. If the check is successful, that target immediately uses its second wind, even if it is above half hit points. If the target has already expended all of its second winds for the day, this talent has no effect.

talents_list.name: Melee Assault
talents_list.description: with melee atk against target with your allies adjacent if also over Fort Def deal +1 die dam & prone

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a melee attack against a target that has one or more of your allies adjacent to it, compare the result to the target’s Fortitude Defense as well as its Reflex Defense. If the attack hits both defenses, the attack deals +1 die of damage and the target is knocked prone.

talents_list.name: Melee Brute
talents_list.description: w/melee atk against target w/your allies adjacent if also over Fort Def spd -2 & -2 Ref Def next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make a melee attack against a target that has one or more of your allies adjacent to it, compare the result to the target’s Fortitude Defense as well as its Reflex Defense. If the attack hits both defenses, the target’s speed is reduced by 2 squares and it takes a -2 penalty to its Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Melee Opportunist
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when ally makes successful melee atk against target adjacent to you, atk as reac & +2 atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, when an ally makes a successful melee attack against a target adjacent to you, you can make a melee attack against that target as a reaction, with a +2 bonus on the attack roll.

talents_list.name: Melee Smash
talents_list.description: +1 dam on melee attacks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You deal +1 point of damage with melee attacks.

talents_list.name: Mercenary's Determination
talents_list.description: double your speed for 1 round, must wait 5 rounds between uses

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a free action, on your turn, you can spend a Force point to double your speed for 1 round. You must wait 5 rounds between each use of this ability.

talents_list.name: Mercenary's Grit
talents_list.description: when affected by a debilitating condition, change penalty to bonus for 1 round, then move down CT
talents_list.full_text_description: When you are affected by any debilitating condition, you can convert the condition's modifier from a penalty to a bonus for 1 round as a swift action. At the end of your next turn, move -1 step along the condition track.

talents_list.name: Mercenary's Teamwork
talents_list.description: +2 dam against targets damaged by an ally since end of your last turn (+10 max)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls (to a maximum of +10) for each ally that has damaged your target since the end of your last turn.

talents_list.name: Mind Probe
talents_list.description: touch & creature must have Int 3+, Use the Force v. Will Def if unwilling as Gather Info

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you touch a living creature with an Intelligence of 3 or higher, you can use the Force to probe its mind for secrets. You must be adjacent to the target, and using the mind probe is a full-round action. If the target is unwilling, you must succeed on a Use the Force check, equaling or exceeding the target’s Will Defense. This ability otherwise functions exactly as the Gather Information skill’s Learn News and Rumors, Learn Secret Information, and Locate Individual applications. Your Use the Force check must still exceed the base Gather Information skill DCs in order to retrieve the information you seek, but you need not pay anything in bribes, and you retrieve the information as a part of the full-round action. Failing the skill check by 5 or more does not cause someone to notice that you are seeking the information.

talents_list.name: Mine Mastery
talents_list.description: can place mine as stan not full

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can place a mine as a standard action instead of a full-round action.

talents_list.name: Misplaced Loyalty
talents_list.description: 1/turn Persuasion v. Will Def to all opponents in LOS so target cannot attack you or 1 ally in 6sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action once per turn, you can make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of all opponents within your line of sight. If successful, a target cannot attack you if one of your allies is within 6 squares of you. You may not use this talent in the same round as the soldier's Draw Fire talent. You may not gain the benefit this talent if another character within 6 squares of you has used this talent since the end of your last turn. This effect lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Mobile Attack (lightsabers)
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Multiattack Prof, Dual Weapon Mastery I, WF (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: immediately after making a full atk with two lightsabers you may move your speed as free action
talents_list.full_text_description: Immediately after making a full attack where you attack with two lightsabers (or both ends of a double-bladed lightsaber), you may move up to your speed as a free action.

talents_list.name: Mobile Attack (pistols)
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Multiattack Proficiency (pistols), Dual Weapon Mastery I, Weapon Focus (pistols)
talents_list.description: immediately after making a full atk with two pistols you may move your speed as free action
talents_list.full_text_description: Immediately after making a full attack where you attack with two pistols, you may move up to your speed as a free action.

talents_list.name: Mobile Combatant
talents_list.description: when you end movement next to opponent & they withdraw, you can move with them
talents_list.full_text_description: You know that the key to winning a fight is keeping your enemies from pinning you down. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: • Evasive Assault: As a standard action, make a single melee or ranged attack. If the attack successfully deals damage, you gain a +5 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn. • Expeditious Attack: As a standard action, make a single melee or ranged attack, then move up to half your speed as a free action. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity. • Yielding Assault: When you are damaged by an enemy’s melee or ranged attack, you can move up to one-half your speed as a reaction. This movement does not provoke an attack of opportunity. On your next turn, you gain a favorable circumstance to your first attack roll against the same enemy that damaged you.

talents_list.name: Mobile Combatant
talents_list.description: each 1/enc 1. stan make ranged or melee atk if deal dam gain +5 dodge until end of next turn, or 2. stan make ranged or melee atk then move half spd as free & no atk of opp, or 3. when damaged by atk move half spd as reac & no atk of opp & gain favorable circumstances to 1st atk v. that enemy
talents_list.full_text_description: When you end your movement adjacent to an opponent, you can spend a swift action to activate this talent. If the designated opponent moves or withdraws before the beginning of your next turn, you can choose to move with that opponent, up to a total distance equal to your current speed. Unless your opponent uses the withdraw action or makes an Acrobatics check to avoid attacks of opportunity, its movement provokes an attack of opportunity from you for the first square moved as normal (but not subsequent squares in the same movement). If your target moves farther than your speed, you must still end this movement closer to the target than you began.

talents_list.name: Mobile Whirlwind
talents_list.description: can move speed after Whirlwind Attack
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you can move up to your speed after the attack is resolved.

talents_list.name: Modification Specialist
talents_list.description: do not take -5 penalty when you try to modify or reprogram yourself

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have become skilled at reprogramming and modifying your own systems. You do not incur the normal -5 penalty on Mechanics and Use Computer checks to reprogram yourself or perform self-modifications (see page 197 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Modify Poison
talents_list.description: you can modify delivery method with a Knowledge (life sciences) check, DC=Treat Injury DC

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can modify the delivery method of a poison (contact, ingested, inhaled, injury) to another delivery method by succeeding on a Knowledge (life sciences) check (DC equal to the poison's Treat Injury DC). The poison's capabilities and specific effects are unchanged.

talents_list.name: Motion of the Future
talents_list.description: uses farseeing from your suite, before end of your next turn force attacker to reroll atk & keep second
talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can peer into the future in search of signs of danger, removing one use of the farseeing Force power from your active suite (as though you had just activated the power). Any time before the end of your next turn when you are the target of an attack or Force power, you can force your attacker to reroll the attack roll (or Use the Force check) against you, keeping the second result. This counts as using the farseeing Force power against the attacker, but this talent replaces the normal rules and effect of that power.

talents_list.name: Move Massive Object
talents_list.description: use move object to make area attack = L 2x2, H 3x3, G 4x4 C 6x6, compare Use the Force to Ref Def
talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully use the move object power to move an object of Large size or bigger, you can make an area attack with the object instead of throwing it at or dropping it on a single target, as normal for the power. You must spend a Force Point when you activate the power to do this, and the area you target is based on the size of the object: Large, 2x2; Huge, 3x3; Gargantuan, 4x4; Colossal and larger, 6x6. When you use move object to make an area attack with the object you are moving, you compare your Use the Force check to the Reflex Defense of each creature, droid, and vehicle in the target area. If your check equals or exceeds the target’s Reflex Defense, it takes damage from the object (as determined by the move object power). Otherwise, the target takes half damage. This is an area effect.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (advanced melee weapons)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with advanced melee weapons as a full attack action, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (advanced melee weapons)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make multiple attacks with any type of advanced melee weapon as a full attack action, you lessen the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times. Each time you do so, you lessen the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (exotic weapons)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with exotic weapons as a full attack action, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (heavy weapons)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with any type of heavy weapon as a full attack action (see Full Attack, page 154), you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (pistols)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with any type of pistol as a full attack action (see Full Attack, page 154), you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (rifles)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with any type of rifle as a full attack action (see Full Attack, page 154), you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (rifles)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with any type of rifle as a full attack action (see page 154 of the Saga Edition core rulebook), you reduce the penalty of your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack Proficiency (simple weapons)
talents_list.description: reduce Atk penalty by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you make multiple attacks with any type of simple weapon as a full attack action (CR page 154), you reduce the penalty to your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty to your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Multiattack proficiency (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: reduces penalty by 2, can be taken multiple

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make multiple attacks with any type of lightsaber as a full attack action (see Full Attack, page 154), you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by 2. You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, you reduce the penalty on your attack rolls by an additional 2.

talents_list.name: Murderous Arts I
talents_list.description: if you move opponent down CT they take +1d6 dam
talents_list.full_text_description: When your successful attack causes an opponent to move -1 step along the condition track, that opponent immediately takes an additional +1d6 damage.

talents_list.name: Murderous Arts II
talents_list.description: if you hit an opponent you have "marked" +1d6 dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully hit an opponent that you have marked (see "Mark" below), your melee and ranged attacks deal an additional +1d6 damage.

talents_list.name: Mystic Mastery
talents_list.description: when you gain a level you get bonus Force Points = number of Force Talents (6 max)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you gain a level, you also gain a number of additional Force Points equal to the number of Force talents you possess (maximum +6).

talents_list.name: Mystical Link
talents_list.description: DC30 UtF for 1 benefit as decided by GM: 1. Force power returned, 2. 1 FP for use before end of enc, 3. +1 use of Force-related talent or feat, 4. roll +1 die w/Force check & select highest die rolled

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The Force guides you in unexpected ways. As a standard action, make a DC 30 Use the Force check. If the check is successful, you gain one of the following benefits, as selected by the Gamemaster: one Force power is returned to your Force suite; one Force Point that is lost if it is not spent before the end of the encounter; an additional use of a Force-related talent or feat normally restricted to once per encounter; or roll an additional die when making a Force check and select the highest die rolled.

talents_list.name: Natural Healing
talents_list.description: can make Treat Injury checks without medical kit with natural substitutes

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your extensive knowledge of natural healing allows you to make first aid, treat disease, and treat poison (Treat Injury) checks without a medical kit, if you have access to appropriate natural substitutes (as determined by the Gamemaster).

talents_list.name: Negate and Redirect
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Negate energy, trained in Use the Force*
talents_list.description: when negate energy v. ranged redirect at enemy w/in 6sq, UtF v. Fort Def for half negated dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully use the negate energy power against a ranged energy weapon (such as a blaster), you can redirect some of the shot’s energy at an enemy target, in addition to the power’s usual benefit. As a free action immediately following your successful use of the negate energy power, choose one enemy you can see within 6 squares of you, and make a Use the Force check against the target’s Fortitude [[Reflex]] Defense. If you hit, the target takes energy damage equal to one-half of the damage you negated.

talents_list.name: Niman
talents_list.description: +1 Ref and Will Def with lightsaber

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When wielding a lightsaber, you gain a +1 bonus to your Reflex Defense and Will Defense.

talents_list.name: Nimble Dodge
talents_list.description: if enemy misses with melee atk as a reac you can move 2 sq but must end adjacent to attacker
talents_list.full_text_description: If an enemy misses you with a melee attack, as a reaction you can move up to 2 squares, but you must end your movement adjacent to your attacker.

talents_list.name: No Escape
talents_list.description: when an opponent withdraws that opponent is considered flat-footed v. you until end of next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an opponent uses the withdraw action to leave your threatened space, that opponent is considered flat-footed against you until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Noble Fencing Style
talents_list.description: can use Cha mod to replace Str mod with light melee or a lightsaber

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: This style of swordplay uses wit and force of personality to increase accuracy, taunting and distracting an opponent with feints, misdirection, and deception. When using a light melee weapon or a lightsaber that you are proficient with, you can use your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Noble Sacrifice
talents_list.description: if recruited enemy is 0 hp or bottom of CT, you & all allies in LOS gain hp = 10 + your cl

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use Recruit Enemy on a target, if that target is reduced to 0 hit points or moved to the bottom of the condition track, as a reaction you can grant yourself and all allies within line of sight a number of bonus hit points equal to 10 + your class level. Damage is subtracted from bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter are lost. Bonus hit points do not stack. No bonus hit points may be granted if you or an ally reduce the target to 0 hit points or move it to the bottom of the condition track.

talents_list.name: Nonlethal Tactics
talents_list.description: with a stun weapon +1 Atk & +1 die dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are using a ranged weapon set to stun, stun grenades, nets, or stun batons, you gain a +1 bonus on your attack roll and deal +1 die of stun damage.

talents_list.name: Notorious
talents_list.description: reroll Persuasion to Intimidate
talents_list.full_text_description: Your skill as a bounty hunter is known throughout the galaxy, even on fringe worlds. When you are not disguised, you can reroll any Persuasion checks made to intimidate others, keeping the better result (see the Persuasion skill, page 71).

talents_list.name: Notorious
talents_list.description: reroll Persuasion checks to intimidate
talents_list.full_text_description: Your reputation as a crime lord is known throughout the galaxy, even on fringe worlds. When you are not disguised, you may reroll any Persuasion checks made to intimidate others, keeping the better result (see the Persuasion skill, page 71).

talents_list.name: Nowhere to Hide
talents_list.description: reroll Gather Info to locate a specific individual
talents_list.full_text_description: You may choose to reroll any Gather Information checks made to locate a specific individual (see the Gather Information skill, page 67), but you must keep the result of the reroll even if it is worse.

talents_list.name: Nowhere to Run
talents_list.description: 1/turn if Hunter's Target attempts to withdraw you can make Atk of Opp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, whenever an opponent whom you selected for Hunter's Target attempts to withdraw, you can make an attack of opportunity against the opponent.

talents_list.name: Nuanced
talents_list.description: 1/enc add Wis mod to Persuasion in addition your Cha mod

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled in the nuances of diplomatic speech and gestures. Once per encounter, you can add your Wisdom bonus to a Persuasion check in addition to your Charisma bonus.

talents_list.name: Numbing Poison
talents_list.description: poisoned target denied Dex to Ref Def as long as it remains poisoned

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any target you poison is automatically denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense for as long as it remains poisoned.

talents_list.name: Oafish
talents_list.description: 1/enc when fail Deception or Persuasion check add +1d6 + Wis mod to check

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whether you come by oafishness naturally or it is all an act, you use your lack of sophistication and finesse as an excuse to bluff your way into or out of delicate situations. Once per encounter, when you fail either a Deception or a Persuasion check, you can add a bonus equal to 1d6 + your Wisdom modifier to your Deception or Persuasion check result.

talents_list.name: Oath of Duty
talents_list.description: when ally w/in 12 sq hits with lightsaber you gain hp = 3 x class level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally within 12 squares of you and within your line of sight hits with a lightsaber attack, you gain bonus hit points equal to 3 x your class level until the end of your next turn. Damage is subtracted from the bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points from different sources do not stack.

talents_list.name: Obscuring Defenses
talents_list.description: -2 atk to enemies that fire into your safe zone

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Enemies that fire into your safe zone take a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

talents_list.name: Observant
talents_list.description: if fail a Persuasion check can roll Perception as a free action & if succeed add +5 to original roll
talents_list.full_text_description: You enhance your persuasiveness by applying data obtained through observation. Whenever you would fail a Persuasion check, you can roll a Perception check as a free action, with a DC equal to the DC of the Persuasion check. If you succeed, add +5 to the original Persuasion check result.

talents_list.name: Old Faithful
talents_list.description: Trusty Sidearm also applies to any rifle or carbine

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The trusty sidearm class feature (see page 217 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) of the gunslinger prestige class also applies to any rifle or carbine that you use.

talents_list.name: Omens
talents_list.description: when ally in 10 sq & LOS rolls a nat 1 or 20, you gain +2 Atk or +2 Ref Def  until the end of your next

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You see omens in both success and failure. Whenever an ally within 10 squares and line of sight to you rolls a natural 1 or a natural 20 on an attack roll, you gain a +2 insight bonus to either your next attack roll made before the end of your next turn, or a +2 insight bonus to Reflex Defense until the end of your next turn (your choice).

talents_list.name: On-Board System Link
talents_list.description: reroute power or recharge shields as 2 swif not 3

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: While aboard a starship or vehicle and plugged into the ship’s systems by scomp link, droid socket, or basic data port, you can reroute power or recharge shields as two swift actions instead of three.

talents_list.name: One for the Team
talents_list.description: can take 1/2 or all dam for an adjacent ally an ally may take the same for you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can choose to take one-half or all of the damage dealt to an adjacent ally by a single attack. Similarly, as a reaction, an adjacent ally can choose to take one-half or all of the damage dealt to you by a single attack (even if he doesn't have this talent).
