talents_list.description: 1/encounter move up to your speed
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can use a swift action to move up to your speed.

talents_list.name: Surge of Light
talents_list.description: 1/encounter return any [light side] power without spending Force Point

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a swift action, you can return any Force power with the [light side] descriptor to your suite without spending a Force Point. You can select this talent multiple times. Each time you select it, you can use this talent one additional time per encounter.

talents_list.name: Surprise Strike
talents_list.description: if fail Deception can make single unarmed strike as free in surprise round, or other with Quick Draw
talents_list.full_text_description: Sometimes a smuggler has to fight his way out of a bad situation. If you fail any Deception check to convey deceptive information, you can initiate combat and make a single unarmed attack as a free action in the surprise round (or with a melee or ranged weapon, if you have the Quick Draw feat); all other combatants are considered surprised even if they are aware of you.

talents_list.name: Surprising Weapons
talents_list.description: if your atk with an amphistaff, thud bug, or razor bug is also over Will Def, opponent flat-footed v. you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully hit an enemy with an amphistaff, thud bug, or razor bug, and your attack roll also exceeds the target’s Will Defense, that target is considered flat-footed against you until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Surprisingly Quick
talents_list.description: in surprise rnd if not surprised can take swif in addition to other action, if surprised can take swif

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: In a surprise round, if you are not surprised, you can take a swift action in addition to the one other action normally allowed. If you are surprised, you can take a single swift action (instead of no actions).

talents_list.name: Surrender to the Current
talents_list.description: until end of encounter: can only use "you" Force Powers & 1/turn recover 1 spent power w/out FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can choose to surrender to the White Current and allow it to flow around you and fuel your Force powers. Until the end of the encounter, you cannot use Force powers that do not have "You" as the sole target. However, once per turn as a swift action, you can recover one spent Force power that has "You" as the sole target without spending a Force Point, adding that power back to your Force suite.

talents_list.name: Surveillance
talents_list.description: Perception v. target in LOS, DC15 or Stealth (higher), you & allies +2 atk until next turn & out of LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a full-round action, you can make a Perception check against a single target within line of sight. The DC-is equal to 15 or the target's Stealth check result (if the target is actively trying to remain hidden), whichever is greater. If the check is successful, you grant yourself and all allies within line of sight a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls against that target until the end of your next turn. Your allies must be able to hear and understand you to benefit from this bonus, and they do not lose the benefit of this talent if they move out of line of sight after it is used.

talents_list.name: Swerve
talents_list.description: 1/enc can negate Atk of Opp & move half spd w/out Atk of Opp (Combat Reflexes = number of uses = Dex bonus but only once a round)
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against you, as a reaction you can automatically negate the attack and immediately move up to half your speed. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. If you have the Combat Reflexes feat, you can use this talent a number of times per encounter equal to your Dexterity bonus (minimum 1). You may still only use this talent once per round.

talents_list.name: Swift Droid
talents_list.description: make a swif action a reaction after failing Deception or Stealth
talents_list.full_text_description: You move quickly when caught. You can make a swift action as a reaction after failing a Deception check or a Stealth check.

talents_list.name: Swift Power
talents_list.description: once a day, use a swift action instead of move or standard
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, you can use a Force power that normally takes a standard action or move action as a swift action.

talents_list.name: Swift Shot
talents_list.description: 1/enc make single ranged atk w/handheld weapon as swif not stan, cannot use remaining for atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can make a single ranged attack with a handheld weapon as a swift action instead of a standard action. However, you cannot use your remaining actions for an attack.

talents_list.name: Swift Strider
talents_list.description: each 1/encounter: move your speed & +2 Ref Def until end of enc, or no Def penalty on charge, or move & +2 Ref Def v. Atk of Opp until next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at maneuvering on the battlefield thanks to your experience surviving in dangerous places. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter: •Blurring Burst: As a move action move up to your speed, and gain a +2 bonus to your Reflex Defense until the end of the encounter. •Sudden Assault: Make a charge attack against an enemy within range as a standard action. You take no penalty to your Reflex Defense for this attack. •Weaving Stride: Move up to your speed as a move action. You gain a cumulative +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense for each attack of opportunity made against you during this movement. This bonus lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Sword of Vahl
talents_list.description: +1 Force bonus to attacks with simple weapons

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your devotion to Vahla allows you to eschew advanced weapons in favor of simple implements of war. You gain a +1 Force bonus on attack rolls made with simple weapons.

talents_list.name: Synchronized Fire
talents_list.description: once per encounter, treat attack with ally on with same target together vs. SR, DR & Threshold

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you may ready to fire a single weapon at the same target as an ally, and you coordinate with a single weapon of your ally. If both attacks hit, you add the damage of the two weapons together before applying the target's SR or DR, and treat it as a single attack for purposes of exceeding the target's damage threshold.

talents_list.name: System Hit
talents_list.description: move vehicle additional step down CT
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you deal damage to a vehicle that equals or exceeds its damage threshold, you move that vehicle an additional -1 step on the condition track (see Conditions, page 148).

talents_list.name: Tactical Edge
talents_list.description: can use Assault, Deployment or Field Tactics as a swift action not move
talents_list.full_text_description: You can use the Assault Tactics, Deployment Tactics, or Field Tactics talent as a swift action instead of a move action, provided you have the talent in question.

talents_list.name: Tactical Savvy
talents_list.description: when an ally you see spends a FP to enhance atk the ally gains bonus to FP = your Int mod

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an ally whom you can see spends a Force point to enhance an attack roll, the ally gains a bonus to the Force point roll equal to your Intelligence modifier. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Tactical Superiority
talents_list.description: select 2 allies, each moves 2 sq as reac w/out atk of opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Spend two swift actions to select two allies. Each ally can move 2 squares as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Tactical Withdraw
talents_list.description: all allies in LOS & within 6sq can withdraw as a swif until start of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Spend two swift actions to grant all allies that are in your line of sight and within 6 squares of you the ability to use the withdraw action as a swift action until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Tae-Jitsu Expertise
talents_list.description: 1/turn when dam target with unarmed atk compare atk roll to thresh & if over target -1 CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, when you damage a creature or droid with an unarmed attack, compare your attack roll to the target’s damage threshold. If your attack roll equals or exceeds the target’s threshold, the target is moved -1 step on the condition track, regardless the damage result of your attack.

talents_list.name: Tag
talents_list.description: if you damage Hunter's Target all allies +2 on next Atk v. Target until start of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you damage an opponent whom you selected for Hunter's Target, all allies gain a +2 bonus on their next attack roll against that opponent until the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Taint of the Dark Side
talents_list.description: add one dark side force power, once per encounter use that power without increasing Dark Side score

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Add one Force power with the [darkside] descriptor to your Force suite. Once per encounter you can use that Force power with the [darkside] descriptor without increasing your Dark Side Score. If you spend a Force Point or Destiny Point to modify this power in any way, you increase your Dark Side Score as normal.

talents_list.name: Take Them Alive
talents_list.description: if you or allies in 6 sq reduce enemy to 0 hp you can instead treat them as stunned

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you or any of your allies within 6 squares of you reduces a target to 0 hit points, you can choose to treat that opponent as though they had been reduced to 0 by stun damage (and, thus, remain stable).

talents_list.name: Take the Hit
talents_list.description: if you take damage for an ally your damage threshold +5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you take damage on behalf of an ally through the use of a talent (including Harm’s Way), your damage threshold is increased by 5.

talents_list.name: Takedown
talents_list.description: when you deal dam at end of charge, you knock target prone if opponent no more than 1 size larger

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully make a melee attack and deal damage at the end of a charge, you knock your target prone as well, provided your opponent is no more than one size category larger than you.

talents_list.name: Talkdroid
talents_list.description: if ally is using Persuasion to change attitude that doesn't understand you add +2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to subtly massage translations. When one of your allies is attempting to use the Persuasion skill to change the attitude of a creature that does not understand your ally, you add +2 to the ally’s Persuasion check results if you perform the translation.

talents_list.name: Tangle Up
talents_list.description: if non-area atk hits, can choose to do half damage and target loses its next move
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a non-area melee or ranged attack against an opponent within range. If the attack hits, you deal half your normal damage (minimum 1 point), but your opponent loses its next move action.

talents_list.name: Target Acquisition
talents_list.description: 1/enc designate 1 enemy in LOS & gain +1 atk & dam until end of enc if stays in LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a swift action, designate an enemy target within line of sight as an acquired target. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls for all attacks against that target until the end of the encounter, as long as the target remains within your line of sight.

talents_list.name: Target Lock
talents_list.description: auto reacquire target if leaves LOS as reac & gain +5 Perception v. target's Stealth

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You lock onto the target designated by the Target Acquisition talent. If the target leaves your line of sight, you automatically reacquire the target lock as a reaction if the target comes back within your line of sight. You also gain a +5 bonus to your Perception skill when opposing the target’s Stealth checks.

talents_list.name: Target Visions
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when an enemy moves within 6 sq can make Atk against as a reaction
talents_list.full_text_description: You have visions that tell you what your enemies are likely to do even before they do it. Once per encounter, when an enemy creature moves within 6 squares of you, you may make a melee or ranged attack against that target as a reaction to their movement.

talents_list.name: Targeting Package
talents_list.description: +2 Atk & damage on next PB or within reach attack if in LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can take two consecutive swift actions in the same round to activate special targeting software. When you do so, you gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls on your next attack if your target is at point blank range (or within reach, for melee attacks) and within line of sight. You lose the benefit of this talent if you lose line of sight to your target or if you take any other action before making your attack. The effect of this talent stacks with that of the Point Blank Shot feat.

talents_list.name: Task Optimization
talents_list.description: 1/enc w/ trained skill perform action quicker but at least as a swif, if more than 1 rnd can't be used

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Select a skill you are trained in. Once per encounter, you can perform any application of that skill as one action quicker than normal but as at least a swift action (for example, a full-round action becomes a standard action, a standard action becomes a move action, a move action becomes a swift action). Tasks requiring more than one round cannot be optimized with this talent.

talents_list.name: Team Recruiting
talents_list.description: can use Recruit Enemy when you or ally would deal dam to kill target instead of only you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Recruit Enemy talent whenever you or an ally would deal enough damage to kill a target, instead of only when you do.

talents_list.name: Tech Savant
talents_list.description: increase speed of droid or vehicle if you occupy or are adjacent by 1 sq, 1 per round

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can increase the speed of one adjacent droid or vehicle you occupy by 1 square (applied to any method of locomotion) until the end of your next turn. Any droid or vehicle can only benefit from this talent once per round.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Power
talents_list.description: w/natural 20 to use Force disarm, grip, slam, thrust or Move Object, reuse same power immediately
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you roll a natural 20 on your Use the Force check to activate a power with the [telekinetic] descriptor, you may choose to use that power again immediately as a free action. You may direct the second use of the Force power against any eligible target.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Prodigy
talents_list.description: with Force Training & take move object, gain extra power from disarm, slam, thrust or move object
talents_list.full_text_description: When you take the Force Training feat and select move object as one of your Force powers, you can also select one extra power to add to your Force suite for free. This power must be one of the powers affected by the Telekinetic Savant talent. You can gain only one extra power each time you take the Force Training feat, regardless of how many times you choose the move object power. If you increase your Wisdom score at a later time and select the move object power, you only gain an additional power if you did not take the move object power when you first chose that feat. Otherwise, you gain an additional Force power as normal.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Resistance
talents_list.description: if you are moved by a Force power reduce the distance by half
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are targeted by a Force power that moves you, you reduce the distance you are moved by half.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Savant
talents_list.description: once per encounter, return Force disarm, slam, thrust, or Move Object without Force Point
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter as a swift action, you may return one Force power with the [telekinetic] descriptor to your suite without spending a Force Point. You may select this talent multiple times. Each time you select it, you may use this talent one additional time per encounter.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Stability
talents_list.description: negate movement if being force against will
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an attack or effect would normally move you against your will (such as being targeted by a Bantha Rush, or being moved by Force thrust or stagger power), you can spend a Force Point to negate that movement.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Strike
talents_list.description: add Force Point roll to damage & attack if unarmed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you make a successful unarmed attack, you can add the result of a Force Point roll to the damage instead of the attack roll (see "Using Force Points" on page 93 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Throw
talents_list.description: with successful Throw opponent falls prone in any space you desire up to 3 sq beyond your reach

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you successfully use the Throw feat, your opponent falls prone in any space you desire up to 3 squares beyond your reach.

talents_list.name: Telekinetic Vigilance
talents_list.description: can return Intercept to suite without spending Force Point

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can return the intercept Force power to your Force suite as a swift action without spending a Force Point.

talents_list.name: Telepathic Influence
talents_list.description: when you roll a natural 20 on Atk or Use the Force instead of gaining force powers can grant ally FP

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You naturally and unconsciously influence those who are regularly around you. Whenever you roll a natural 20 on an attack roll or Use the Force check, instead of regaining all your spent Force powers you may instead choose to grant one ally within 12 squares a temporary Force Point. If your ally does not use this temporary Force Point before the end of the encounter, it is lost.

talents_list.name: Telepathic Intruder
talents_list.description: if you successfully use a mind-affecting power gain +2 on mind-affecting powers v. that target

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use a Force power with the [mind-affecting] descriptor successfully against a target, until the end of your next turn you gain a +2 Force bonus on skill checks made to activate mind-affecting Force powers and talents against that same target.

talents_list.name: Telepathic Link
talents_list.description: link within 1km can communicate as if speaking, 1/encounter may share Force power of target or you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You form an enhanced telepathic link with a willing ally with the Force Sensitivity feat as a swift action. The link is maintained until you choose to remove it (no action required). As long as you remain within one kilometer or your target, you and the target can communicate telepathically as though you were speaking. Once per encounter, you may use a Force power from your target's Force suite (if the target consents), or you may allow the target to use one of your Force powers. You may only have one telepathic link active at a time.

talents_list.name: Tempest Tossed
talents_list.description: can move target 1 sq if damaged by Whirlwind Attack, not if grabbed or grappled, no Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: When you damage a target with a Whirlwind Attack, you can choose to move that target 1 square in any direction as a free action. You can’t move a target that’s being grabbed or grappled, and you can’t move the opponent into a solid object or another creature’s fighting space. This forced movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Temporal Awareness
talents_list.description: 1/encounter when attacked you can move your speed
talents_list.full_text_description: Timing is crucial to a Findsman. Once per encounter, as a reaction to any enemy's attack, you can move up to your speed.

talents_list.name: Terrain Guidance
talents_list.description: DC20 Ride to negate difficult terrain

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You effectively guide your mount through rough terrain. When in control of your mount, you can make a DC 20 Ride check as a swift action to negate the effect of difficult terrain on your mount’s speed.

talents_list.name: Terrify
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def of Inspire Fear & LOS, must move away from you, if can't move, Fear doubled
talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a Persuasion check against a target that is within your line of sight and that is also affected by your Inspire Fear talent. If you equal or exceed the target's Will Defense, then on its next turn the target must spend at least one move action to move away from you. If the target is somehow prevented from doing so, then the penalty from Inspire Fear doubles until the start of your next turn. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

talents_list.name: Teräs Käsi Basics
talents_list.description: deal additional die of damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You deal an additional die of damage with your unarmed attacks.

talents_list.name: Teräs Käsi Mastery
talents_list.description: only full-round actions unarmed, take full attack as standard action
talents_list.full_text_description: If you make only unarmed attacks during a full attack action, you can take the full attack action as a standard action instead of a full-round action.

talents_list.name: Tested in Battle
talents_list.description: when you catch a Second Wind move +2 CT
talents_list.full_text_description: When you catch a second wind, you move +2 steps on the condition track in addition to regaining hit points.

talents_list.name: The Will to Resist
talents_list.description: 1/turn if Will Def is targeted can replace Will with Use the Force check, you -5 UtF until end of next

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a reaction to being targeted by a Force power or other ability that targets your Will Defense, you can make a Use the Force check and replace your Will Defense with the result of the Use the Force check. After you make this check, until the end of your next turn, you take a -5 penalty on all Use the Force checks.

talents_list.name: Thrive on Chaos
talents_list.description: when enemy or ally within 20sq is reduced to 0hp, you gain hp = 5+1/2CL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an enemy or ally within 20 squares of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you gain bonus hit points equal to 5 + one-half your character level. Damage is subtracted from bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points do not stack.

talents_list.name: Thrown Lightsaber Mastery
talents_list.description: any target struck by thrown lightsaber moves at half spd (round down) until your next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: Any target successfully struck by a lightsaber you throw moves at half speed (round down) until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Thunderclap
talents_list.description: if you use a Force Power that deals damage you can use Bantha Rush against target as if melee atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use a Force power that deals damage, you can use the Bantha Rush feat against that target as though you had made a melee attack.

talents_list.name: Total Concealment
talents_list.description: get total concealment in place of any concealment

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any situation that would give you concealment (see CR page 156) grants you total concealment instead. [If the talent is in effect due to lowlight or darkness (as opposed to fog, smoke, etc.), then darkvision trumps the Total Concealment talent.]

talents_list.name: Tough as Nails
talents_list.description: catch a Second Wind one extra time

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can catch a second wind one extra time per day (see Second Wind, page 146). If you have this talent and the Extra Second Wind feat (see page 85), you can catch your second wind a total of three times per day. [[You are still limited to one second wind per encounter]]

talents_list.name: Trace
talents_list.description: can substitute Use Computer for Gather Info if you have computer access

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can substitute your Use Computer skill for [ie instead of] any Gather Information check as long as you have access to a computer network.

talents_list.name: Traceless Tampering
talents_list.description: automatically leave no trace of tampering, something goes wrong if you fail by 10 not 5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Spies specialize in leaving no evidence of their presence when they tamper with advanced electronics or basic mechanical systems. When using Mechanics to disable a device, you automatically leave no trace when tampering (with no DC increase), and you must fail by 10 or more (instead of 5 or more) before something goes wrong.

talents_list.name: Trailblazer
talents_list.description: allow all allies w/in 6 sq & LOS to count 1st sq of difficult terrain as normal

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: During your turn, you can spend a swift action to allow all allies within 6 squares of you and within your line of sight to count the first square of difficult terrain as normal terrain each time they move.

talents_list.name: Trakata
talents_list.description: Deception to feint, shut off and reignite lightsaber

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: By harnessing the unique characteristics of a lightsaber, you can catch your opponent off guard by quickly shutting off and reigniting the blade. When wielding a lightsaber, you may spend two swift actions to make a Deception check to feint in combat (see CR page 66). [[Weak talent option: (1) costs 1 swift action due to high prerequisites; maybe makes opponent flat-footed until end of next turn. (2) Remove BAB+12 prerequisite and Weapon Spec prerequisite.]]

talents_list.name: Transfer Essence
talents_list.description: when you die become a dark side spirit & can possess others or enter an object, see J16

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you die, you become a dark side spirit (see page 118) until the end of the encounter. You continue to occupy a space in this form, but other creatures can occupy the same space or move through your space without impediment. As a standard action, you can attempt to possess an adjacent target. You must succeed on a Use the Force check against an adjacent target's Will Defense. If your check result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, you deal 8d6 points of stun damage to the target; if you reduce the target to 0 hit points or move it to the bottom of the condition track with this attack, you possess the target as though it were a willing host (see the dark spirit template for details). Alternately, as a standard action, you can transfer your essence into a single adjacent object, such as a holocron or a lightsaber. If you do so, you lie dormant within the object until another creature attempts to use that object, at which time you can emerge and attempt to possess the creature, as described above. If you do not possess a creature or object within 10 rounds of manifesting as a dark spirit, your spirit dissipates and ceases to exist.

talents_list.name: Transfer Power
talents_list.description: spend a power in suite & give to ally trained in UtF & w/in 12 sq & LOS, lost if not used by end of enc

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can spend any one use of a Force power currently in your Force suite, adding a use of that power to the Force suite of any ally trained in the Use the Force skill. The ally must be within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. When your ally uses that power, it disappears from his or her Force suite. If the ally does not use the Force power before the end of the encounter, it is permanently removed from his or her Force suite.

talents_list.name: Transposing Strike
talents_list.description: when you hit an opp with melee you can choose to do half dam & switch spots with foe, no Atk of Opp

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you hit a character with a melee attack, you can choose to have the attack deal only half damage and switch places with that foe. Your foe must be no more than one size category larger than you, and you must end up occupying a space that was previously occupied by your target (and vice versa) to use this talent. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Treacherous
talents_list.description: if not adjacent to attacker & attacked other adjacent attacked & you move 1 sq, can have Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are attacked in combat and adjacent to a creature other than your attacker, you can move 1 square as a reaction. The attack, intended for you, instead targets the adjacent creature, though if you move away from a creature that threatens you, it can make an attack of opportunity before the original attack is resolved.

talents_list.name: Triage Scan
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Trained in Treat Injury, medical droid
talents_list.description: DC20 Treat Injury to know if organics in 6 sq & LOS are below half hp & where on CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a DC 20 Treat Injury check. If the check succeeds, you know if the organic characters within 6 squares and within your line of sight are below one half of their hit points and at what step they are along the condition track.

talents_list.name: Triangulate
talents_list.description: 1/encounter if you and allies have LOS to same target you all can reroll one ranged attack
talents_list.full_text_description: If you and at least one other ally have line of sight to and are aware of a target, you and allies that can hear and understand you can reroll one ranged attack roll against that target, accepting the second result even if it is worse. You and your allies can only gain the benefit of this talent once per encounter.

talents_list.name: Trick Step
talents_list.description: Initiative check v. enemy in LOS, loser is flat-footed v. other

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, make an Initiative check, opposed by the Initiative check of an enemy within your line of sight. If your check result equals or exceeds the target’s check, the target is considered flat-footed against the next attack you make before the end of your turn. If the target’s check result is higher, you are considered flat-footed against the next attack made by the target before the start of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Trigger Work
talents_list.description: no penalty to Atk when using Rapid Shot

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You take no penalty on your attack roll when using the Rapid Shot feat.

talents_list.name: Tripwire
talents_list.description: set trap 3sq wide, DC20 Mechanics & Deception to conceal, target DC10 Acrobatics to avoid, select 1 option: 1. target falls prone 1d6 dam, 2. auto hit w/mine & 1d20+10 v. adjacent, 3. +2 Deception & fall prone

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can set up a simple snare or trap across an opening up to 3 squares wide. You must have the required item to set the trap. Make a successful DC 20 Mechanics check to set the  trap. Make a Deception check to conceal the wire. Compare the result of the Deception check to the Perception check of the next creature that passes through that square (-10 if it observes you setting the trap). If the creature fails the Perception check, it takes the result indicated for the trap. If the creature succeeds, it can make a DC 10 Acrobatics check to avoid the wire. Select one of the following options: • Clothesline: Requires thin wire, set at neck height. Success results in the target falling prone in the trapped square, ending its actions for the turn and taking 1d6 points of damage. • Electronic tripwire: Success results in mine damage (treat as frag grenade, 2-square blast radius centered on one end of the wire). Target is automatically hit; roll 1d20+10 against the Reflex Defense of adjacent targets. • Tripwire: Requires thin wire, set at ankle height. Add 2 to the Deception check result. Success results in the target immediately falling prone in the trapped square and ending its actions for the turn.

talents_list.name: True Betrayal
talents_list.description: Persuasion v. Will Def of 1 enemy in LOS for them to attack who you choose, +5 if they're higher level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of one enemy within your line of sight that can hear and understand you. If your check result equals or exceeds the target’s Will Defense, that target immediately makes an attack (as a free action) against another target of your choice. This can be a melee attack against an adjacent target or a ranged attack against a target within the attacker’s point-blank range. The target gets a +5 bonus to its Will Defense if it is higher level than you. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Trust
talents_list.description: give up standard action to give 1 ally extra action next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: You can give up your standard action to give one ally within your line of sight an extra standard action or move action on his next turn, to do with as he pleases. The ally does not lose the action if line of sight is later broken. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Try Your Luck
talents_list.description: When you fail check in skill challenge choose ally. Next use of same skill roll 2 dice & keep better

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you accrue a failure in a skill challenge, choose one ally. The next time that ally uses the same skill that you used to accrue a failure before the end of the skill challenge, that ally rolls two dice on the skill check and keeps the better result.

talents_list.name: Turn the Tide
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Command Decision [[talent does not exist]], Commander's Prerogative*
talents_list.description: 1/enc after first round Knowledge (tactics) v. Will Def of enemies w/in 12sq & LOS for enemies to reroll Init at start of next round, allies in LOS can choose to reroll
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, after the first round of combat, you can make a Knowledge (tactics) check as a full-round action and compare the result to the Will Defense of all enemies with in 12 squares of you and within your line of sight. If your check is successful, affected enemies must reroll their Initiative checks at the start of the next round. Allies within your line of sight can choose whether to reroll their check. Rerolls and other modifiers to the Initiative skill apply normally to this check for all affected targets.

talents_list.name: Turret Self-Destruct
talents_list.description: turret self-destructs at 0hp with 2sq radius dealing its normal dam, you can disable if adjacent as reac

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Your turret self-destructs automatically when it reaches 0 hit points. It explodes in a 2-square radius, dealing its normal damage. If you are adjacent to the turret, you can disable this feature as a reaction.

talents_list.name: Twin Shot
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Dual Weapon Mastery I, Rapid Shot
talents_list.description: with two pistols, +2 dam if using Rapid Shot

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you are wielding two pistols, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using the Rapid Shot feat.

talents_list.name: Twin Weapon Mastery
talents_list.description: you can move 2 squares between attacks without an attack of opportunity
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the Twin Weapon Style talent, you can move 2 squares between each attack. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Twin Weapon Style
talents_list.description: you can make an attack with both weapons or double-sided weapon against different targets

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, whenever you are wielding two weapons (or a double weapon), you can make one attack with each weapon (or each end of a double-weapon). Each attack must be against a different target. [[Since this talent does not mention anything about normally taking penalties associated with 2-weapon fighting, some believe that you do not take the penalties. Also, the book mentions taking the penalties when making a full attack. Since this is not a full-round action but a standard action, there is some support to this view.]]

talents_list.name: Two-Faced
talents_list.description: each 1/enc after you atk: if same atks you atk/reac, or opp can't atk you, or +2 atk if they haven't atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have mastered the art of saying one thing and doing another, allowing you to deceive your enemies to keep you machinations hidden. You can use each of the following actions once per encounter as a standard action: •False Security: Make a single melee or ranged attack against a target within your range. [[Whether you hit or miss,]] at any time before the beginning of your next turn, you can make a single attack against that target as a reaction if that target attacks you. •Nonthreatening: Making a single melee or ranged attack against a target within your range. [[Whether you hit or miss,]] until the beginning of your next turn, that opponent cannot make any attacks against you except for attacks of opportunity. This is a mind-affecting effect. •Tricky Target: Make a single melee or ranged attack against a target within your range that has not attacked you since the end of your last turn. You gain a +2 bonus on your attack roll and damage roll for this attack.

talents_list.name: Two-For-One Throw
talents_list.description: throw 2 weapons at same enemy or target sq w/one hand, separate atks -10 & weapons must be similar, range = 8sq

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can throw two weapons simultaneously. Both weapons target the same enemy or target square and are thrown with one hand. Make separate attack rolls for each weapon, each at a -10 penalty. The weapons must be similar, such as two grenade-like objects or two knives, and they must be no larger than one size category smaller than you. The attack cannot exceed short range (typically 8 squares).

talents_list.name: Tyia Adept
talents_list.description: ally in 12 sq & LOS takes dam you take half dam & ally takes half dam

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can spend a Force Point to designate one nondroid ally within 12 squares of you and in your line of sight. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you or the targeted ally takes damage from any source, you take half of the damage and your ally takes half of the damage. This halving of damage takes place before the damage is compared to your respective damage thresholds.

talents_list.name: Ultra Resilient
talents_list.description: 1/enc increase dam thresh = Independent Droid level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You have advanced subroutines that make you more resistant to the effect of damage. Once per encounter, as a reaction, you can increase your damage threshold with a bonus equal to your Independent Droid level.

talents_list.name: Unarmed Counterstrike
talents_list.prerequisites_text: MA I-II, Unarmed Parry, Teras Kasi Basics
talents_list.description: if parry melee attack, can immediately make unarmed Atk as reaction against target
talents_list.full_text_description: When you successfully parry a melee attack with the Unarmed Parry talent, you can immediately make an unarmed attack as a reaction against that target.

talents_list.name: Unarmed Parry
talents_list.description: fighting defensively, can negate melee Atk, if Atk beats melee Atk, Atk negated (-2 cum Atk v. others)

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you fight defensively, as a reaction you can negate a melee attack by making a successful unarmed attack roll. If your attack roll equals or exceeds the attack roll of the incoming melee attack, the attack is negated. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed, and you take a cumulative -2 penalty to all attack rolls for each attack roll made since the beginning of your last turn.

talents_list.name: Unbalance Opponent
talents_list.description: one opponent loses Str bonus to melee attacks against you, not to damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You are skilled at keeping your opponents off balance in melee combat. During your action, you designate an opponent no more than one size category larger or smaller than you. That opponent doesn't get to add his Strength bonus on attack rolls when targeting you. (If the opponent has a Strength penalty, he still suffers that penalty.) The opponent's Strength modifier applies to damage, as usual. You can select a new opponent on your next turn.

talents_list.name: Unbalancing Adaptation
talents_list.description: when you use Adapt & Survive, you deny the bonus to the enemy in LOS

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When you use the Adapt and Survive talent, you also deny the bonus that triggered the talent to one enemy within your line of sight.

talents_list.name: Uncanny Defense
talents_list.description: 1/day add 1/2 officer class to all Def 1 round, must declare at beginning of your turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day, you can add one-half your officer class level to all your defenses for one round. You must declare that you are using this talent at the beginning of your turn. The benefits last until the beginning of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Uncanny Dodge I
talents_list.description: do not lose Dex bonus if flat-footed or attacked by hidden attacker

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You retain your Dexterity bonus to your Reflex Defense regardless of being caught flat-footed or struck by a hidden attacker. You still lose your Dexterity bonus to your Reflex Defense if you are immobilized. (SotG) If you are the pilot, this talent applies to your vehicle. [[Weak talent option: Too many prerequisites, remove 1 or both.]]

talents_list.name: Uncanny Dodge II
talents_list.description: cannot be flanked

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You cannot be flanked. You can react to opponents on opposite sides of you as easily as you can react to a single attacker. (SotG) If you are the pilot, this talent applies to your vehicle. [[Weak talent option: Too many prerequisites, remove 1 or both (Acute Senses and Improved Initiative)]]

talents_list.name: Uncanny Instincts
talents_list.description: 1/round if damaged move 1 sq as reac, no Atk of Opp
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round whenever an opponent successfully deals damage to you, you can move 1 square as a reaction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

talents_list.name: Uncanny Luck
talents_list.description: 1/encounter a roll 16 or higher is considered a natural 20

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can consider any single d20 roll of 16 or higher to be a natural 20.

talents_list.name: Unclouded Judgment
talents_list.description: spend a Force Point to automatically negate a mind-affecting Force power or talent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you are the target of a mind-affecting Force power or talent, you can spend a Force Point as a reaction to negate the effects of that Force power or talent (no skill check required).

talents_list.name: Undetectable Poison
talents_list.description: Treat Injury DC increases by 5

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: The Treat Injury DC needed to cure a poison you have used against a target increases by 5.

talents_list.name: Undying Loyalty
talents_list.description: followers gain Toughness feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Each of your followers gains the Toughness feat.

talents_list.name: Unlikely Shot
talents_list.description: 1/encounter reroll damage of one attack
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can reroll the damage of one attack and take the better result.

talents_list.name: Unreadable
talents_list.description: Will Def +5 v. skill checks to read your emotion, when you feint in combat target is flat-footed v. you

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +5 bonus to your Will Defense against skill checks made to read your emotions and influence your attitude. In addition, whenever you successfully feint a target in combat, that target is flat-footed against all your attacks until the end of your next turn.

talents_list.name: Unrelenting Assault
talents_list.description: if miss melee or atk negated still do Str bonus (min 1) or 2 x Str bonus if attacking two-handed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You launch yourself at your foe, attacking with weapons, limbs, and anything else available. Whenever you miss with a melee attack or the attack is negated, you still deal your Strength bonus in damage to the target (minimum 1) or 2 x your Strength bonus if you attack with a weapon you are wielding two-handed.

talents_list.name: Unsavory Reputation
talents_list.description: opponent reduced to half hp within 6 sq of you -2 Atk & skill for rest of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any opponent that is reduced to half hit points or fewer while within 6 squares of you takes a -2 penalty on all attack rolls and skill checks for the duration of the encounter. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

talents_list.name: Unseen Eyes
talents_list.description: allies hidden in Haze can reroll Perception, keep best, allies gain +2 dam v. unaware foes
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the Force Haze talent, allies hidden by the haze can reroll any Perception check, keeping the better result. Additionally, allies hidden by the haze gain +2 on all damage rolls against foes that are unaware of them.

talents_list.name: Unsettling Presence
talents_list.description: Use the Force v. Will Def v. any in 6sq, -2 Atk & skill checks within 6sq of you until end of encounter

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can spend a Force Point as a standard action to create an aura of unsettling discomfort around you. You make a Use the Force check when you activate this talent and compare the check result to the Will Defense of any creature that comes within 6 squares of you. If your Use the Force check result exceeds the creature's Will Defense, that target takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls and skill checks while within 6 squares of you. This aura lasts for the remainder of the encounter.

talents_list.name: Unstoppable
talents_list.description: once per encounter an attack that would knock you down the CT is reduced by 1 step

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can sometimes shrug off the effect of debilitating attacks. Once per encounter, if you are hit by an attack that would normally knock you down the condition track, you can reduce the number of steps you move down the condition track by 1 step (to a minimum of 0).

talents_list.name: Unwavering Ally
talents_list.description: 1/turn 1 ally in LOS immune to effects that make flat-footed or deny Dex to Ref Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per turn, as a swift action, you can designate one ally within your line of sight who can hear and understand you. Until the start of your next turn, that ally becomes immune to all effects that render the ally flat-footed or that deny the ally a Dexterity bonus to his or her Reflex Defense. This is a mind-affecting effect.

talents_list.name: Urgency
talents_list.description: 1/encounter increase speed of allies in LOS by 2

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can spend three swift actions on consecutive turns to increase the speed of all allies within line of sight of you by 2. The increased speed lasts until the start of your next turn after the third swift action is spent.

talents_list.name: Vaapad
talents_list.description: Cri on 19-20, 19 not an auto hit

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When attacking with a lightsaber, you score a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20. However, a natural 19 is not considered an automatic hit; if you roll a natural 19 and still miss the target, you do not score a critical hit.

talents_list.name: Vahl's Brand
talents_list.description: additional damage from an empowered weapon is considered fire damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any additional damage you deal with an empowered weapon (see the Empower Weapon talent, page 214 of the Saga Edition core rulebook) is considered to be fire damage.

talents_list.name: Vahl's Flame
talents_list.description: +1d6 fire damage with melee weapons until the beginning of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can use the Force to call forth the sparks of your goddess, wreathing your weapon in flames. Until the beginning of your next turn, any successful attack you make with a melee weapon deals an additional 1d6 points of fire damage.

talents_list.name: Vanish
talents_list.description: UtF v. Will Def to vanish from sight of one target in LOS, total concealment v. target until next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can make a Use the Force check as a swift action to vanish from the sight of a single target within line of sight. If the result of your Use the Force check exceeds the target's Will Defense, you gain total concealment from that target until the beginning of your next turn, or until you make an attack roll or skill check against the target.

talents_list.name: Vehicle Focus
talents_list.description: +2 Atk with selected vehicle type, may take 10 on Pilot checks
talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single type of vehicle from the following list: airspeeder, capital ship, space transport, speeder, starfighter, or walker. When you are the pilot or gunner of that type of vehicle, you gain +2 to all attack rolls with a vehicle weapon, and may take 10 on any Pilot checks made while piloting that type of vehicle, even when you are otherwise unable to.

talents_list.name: Vehicle Mechanic
talents_list.description: 1/day make DC 20 Mechanics restore d8 vehicle hp & +1 CT & 1 hp for every point over DC

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per day you can spend three swift actions in successive rounds to make a DC 20 Mechanics check to restore 1d8 hit points to a vehicle and move it +1 step along the condition track. You also restore 1 hit point to the vehicle for every point by which you exceed the Mechanics check DC.

talents_list.name: Vehicle Sneak
talents_list.description: treat your ship as two size categories smaller when attempting Stealth checks

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You know how to fly and operate your vehicle in order to hide its approach visually, decrease the noise it produces, and minimize its sensor signature. Treat your ship as two size categories smaller when attempting Stealth checks.

talents_list.name: Vehicular Boost
talents_list.description: DC 15 Mechanics for hp = 5 x CL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can make a DC 15 Mechanics check to grant one vehicle you occupy a number of bonus hit points equal to 5 x your class level. Damage is subtracted from the bonus his points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter go away. Bonus hit points from multiple sources do not stack.

talents_list.name: Vehicular Evasion
talents_list.description: if hit by area attack, take half or no damage, must be moving

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If the vehicle you are piloting is hit by an area attack (see Area Attacks, page 155), it takes half damage if the attack hits. If the area attack misses your vehicle, it takes no damage. You cannot use this talent when your vehicle is stationary or disabled.

talents_list.name: Veiled Biotech
talents_list.description: +10 Deception & Stealth to conceal biotech, draw biotech as swif & if you atk opp loses Ref to Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +10 competence bonus on Deception and Stealth checks made to conceal any biotechnology or any biotech implants you possess. Additionally, you may draw a concealed biotech item or weapon as a swift action instead of a standard action; if you then make an attack with that biotech weapon before the end of your turn, your opponent loses its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense against the first attack you make with that weapon.

talents_list.name: Vicious Poison
talents_list.description: poisons used against a target get +2 Atk against Fort Def

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Any poisons you have used against a target gain a +2 bonus to their attack rolls made against that target's Fortitude Defense.

talents_list.name: Victorious Force Mastery
talents_list.description: if an enemy you damaged in this encounter is at 0 hp, return one Force Power as free
talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever an enemy you have damaged in this encounter is reduced to 0 hit points, you may automatically return one spent Force power to your Force suite as a free action.

talents_list.name: Vigilance
talents_list.description: one adjacent ally +1 Ref Def as long as they remain adjacent

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action you may designate one adjacent ally as the target of this talent. That target gains a +1 deflection bonus to Reflex Defense as long as you remain adjacent to them. You may change the target of this talent as a swift action.

talents_list.name: Vindication
talents_list.description: when an enemy you reduced to 0 hp or bottom of CT, your next atk is +1 die

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: When an enemy you have damaged is reduced to 0 hit points or moved to the bottom of the condition track, your next attack made before the end of the encounter deals +1 die of damage.

talents_list.name: Virus
talents_list.description: can sub Use Comp for Mechanics to disable computerized device, 1min v. Will, becomes unfriendly

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can substitute a Use Computer check for [ie instead of] a Mechanics check when disabling a computerized device. The effort takes 1 minute and the DC is equal to the computer's Will Defense. In addition, whenever anyone access the affected computer using a droid or another computer, that computer or droid's attitude immediately becomes unfriendly.

talents_list.name: Visionary Attack
talents_list.description: you or ally within 12sq if you miss an atk, UtF check over target's Will attacker can reroll Atk spend one farseeing, you -5 Use the Force until beginning of your next turn
talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can make a Use the Force check after you or an ally within 12 squares misses with a melee or ranged attack, removing one use of the farseeing Force power from your active suite (as though you had activated the power). If your check result equals or exceeds the Will Defense of the target of that missed attack, the attacker can reroll the missed attack roll. This counts as using the farseeing Force power against that target, but this talent replaces the normal rules and effect of that power. Any attack can only be affected by this talent once (thus, multiple characters cannot use this talent on the same attack to allow multiple rerolls). You take a cumulative -5 penalty on Use the Force checks until the beginning of your next turn when you use this talent.

talents_list.name: Visionary Defense
talents_list.description: you or ally within 12sq if attacked, UtF check over target's Will defender +5 Ref Def spend one farseeing, you -5 Use the Force until beginning of your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can make a Use the Force check after you or an ally within 12 squares is the target of a melee or ranged attack (but before the results of the attack roll are known), removing one use of the farseeing Force power from your active suite (as though you had just activated the power). If your check result exceeds the Will Defense of the attacker, you grant the target of the attack a +5 Force bonus to Reflex Defense against that attack. This counts as using the farseeing Force power against the attacker, but this talent replaces the normal rules and effect of that power. Any attack can only be affected by this talent once (thus, multiple characters cannot use this talent on the same attack to allow multiple rerolls). You take a cumulative -5 penalty on Use the Force checks until the beginning of your next turn when you use this talent.

talents_list.name: Visions
talents_list.description: See into past or future with farseeing, max one year per your level

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you use the farseeing Force power, you can spend a Force Point as a swift action to see into the target's past or future instead of the glimpsing the target in the present. You declare how far into the target's past or future you wish to look, up to a maximum of 1 year per your character level. Any information gained about a target's future is subject to change, depending on whether steps are taken to alter that future.

talents_list.name: Vital Encouragement
talents_list.description: 1/encounter you gain hp = 10 + 1/2 your HL

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, your guardian spirit offers you vital encouragement, urging you to press on despite adversity. As a free action, you gain bonus hit points equal to 10 + one-half your heroic level. Damage is subtracted from bonus hit points first, and any bonus hit points remaining at the end of the encounter are lost.

talents_list.name: Walk the Line
talents_list.description: enemies in LOS take -2 Def until your next turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you can do or say something that catches your enemies off guard. All opponents within 6 squares of you and in your line of sight take a -2 penalty to their defenses until the start of your next turn. The penalty is negated if line of sight is broken. (SotG) This talent has a range of 6 squares at starship scale.

talents_list.name: Wan-Shen Defense
talents_list.description: +1 Ref Def v. melee if have wan-shen in hand & not flat-footed

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, you can use your wan-shen to parry your opponents’ attacks, gaining a +1 deflection bonus to your Reflex Defense against melee attacks until the start of your next turn. You must have your wan-shen in hand to use this talent, and you do not gain the deflection bonus if you are flat-footed or otherwise unaware of the incoming attack, You can take this talent multiple times; each time you take this talent, the deflection bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +3).

talents_list.name: Wan-Shen Kata
talents_list.description: treat wan-shen as Med weapon not Large, can Pin & Trip with wan-shen if wan-shen in hand

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You treat the wan-shen as a Medium weapon instead of a Large weapon. You can use the Pin and Trip feats with a wan-shen, substituting your attack bonus with the wan-shen for your grapple check. You must have your wan-shen in hand to use this talent. In addition, when you use the wan-shen as a double weapon, you reduce all attack penalties for attacking with both ends of the weapon by 1.

talents_list.name: Wan-Shen Mastery
talents_list.prerequisites_text: Proficient with the wan-shen, Wan-Shen Kata, base attack bonus +5.
talents_list.description: make 2 atk with wan-shen each against a different target if have wan-shen in hand

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a standard action, you make two attacks with your wan-shen, each one against a different target within your reach. You must have your wan-shen in hand to use this talent.

talents_list.name: Ward
talents_list.description: provide soft cover to 1 adjacent ally

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: As a swift action, designate one adjacent ally. Until the end of your next turn, as long as that ally remains adjacent to you, you are considered to be providing that ally with soft cover against all attacks. You cannot be designated as the target of this talent (such as, when it is used by an ally) if you have used this talent since the start of your last turn, and you cannot use this talent if you are currently designated as another ally’s ward.

talents_list.name: Warrior's Awareness
talents_list.description: when enemy makes unarmed/melee atk for 2nd time in enc v. you make Perception as reac to gain +1 Ref & Fort Def v. for rest of enc, can switch targets by not using for 1 full rnd

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You learn your enemy’s preferred tactics quickly. When an enemy character makes an unarmed or a melee attack against you for at least the second time in an encounter, make a Perception check as a reaction. [[I think the Perception check should be the generic “target’s size + distance penalties.” Let’s not make this any harder than it is. After all, this talent only activates after you’ve been hit twice by the same enemy. Or you can make it a straight DC 15.]] If the check is successful, you gain a +1 bonus to your Reflex and Fortitude Defenses against that character until the end of the encounter. You can use this against only one character at a time, until that character is incapacitated or killed, or until you voluntarily switch targets by dropping the use of this talent for one full-round (you can take other actions normally).

talents_list.name: Warrior's Determination
talents_list.description: 1/enc ignore 1 non-Force effect, talent, skill or ability that exceeds Will Def, if spend FP ignore mind effect even if Force

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a reaction, you can ignore one non Force-related effect, talent, skill, or ability that exceeds your Will Defense. If you spend a Force Point, you can ignore one mind-affecting effect, even if it is the result of a Force power, technique, or secret.

talents_list.name: Wary
talents_list.description: if enemy fails Stealth or Deception v. your Perception you can take move as reac, if multiple fail, your moves cannot exceed Dex mod
talents_list.full_text_description: Your outsider status makes you cautious, observant, and ready for action. If an enemy fails a Stealth or a Deception check opposed by your Perception check, you can take one move action as a reaction. If multiple enemies fail on the same turn (such as when you detect several enemies sneaking up on you), the number of move actions you take cannot exceed your Dexterity modifier.

talents_list.name: Watch This
talents_list.description: can move into same space as frigate or larger without collision & can occupy same space
talents_list.full_text_description: You can move into or through a space occupied by a vehicle of Colossal (frigate) size or larger without causing a collision. Additionally, if you pilot a Colossal or smaller vehicle, you can occupy the same space as a vehicle of Colossal (frigate) size or larger.

talents_list.name: Watch Your Back
talents_list.description: if you are adjacent to an ally you can't be flanked

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you are adjacent to at least one ally, enemies gain no benefit from flanking you or any adjacent allies.

talents_list.name: WatchCircle Initiate
talents_list.description: Use the Force DC15, remove farseeing, add 1 Force Point to ally in LOS, replaces normal affects

effects.target_description: ce point to ally in los, replaces normal affects

talents_list.full_text_description: As a reaction, you can make a Use the Force check (DC 15) and remove one use of the farseeing Force power from your active suite (as though you had activated the power). You subtract 1 from your Force Point total (this cannot be subtracted from temporary Force Points, and does not count as spending a Force Point) and add 1 to the Force Point total of an ally within line of sight. This counts as using the farseeing Force power against that target, but this talent replaces the normal rules and effect of that power.

talents_list.name: Watchful Step
talents_list.description: Perception replaces Initiative & considered trained in Initiative

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You can use your Perception check modifier instead of your Initiative modifier when making Initiative checks. If you are entitled to an Initiative check reroll, you can reroll your Perception check instead (subject to the same circumstances and limitations). You are considered to be trained in Initiative.

talents_list.name: Watchman's Advance
talents_list.description: when acting in surprise round you &allies take +1 move max
talents_list.full_text_description: When acting in the surprise round, you and your allies can take an extra move action. Any character can gain only one extra move action during the surprise round regardless of the number of Jedi with this talent in your group.

talents_list.name: Waveform
talents_list.description: add Cha mod to dam (min +1) to telekinetic Force power

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Taking cues from Manaan's oceans, you know how to emulate wave action using the Force. As a swift action, when you use a telekinetic Force power (that is, a power affected by the Telekinetic Power or Telekinetic Savant talents), you manipulate the particles of the environment around you to add to the force of impact, allowing you to add your Charisma modifier to any damage dealt (minimum +1).

talents_list.name: Weak Point
talents_list.description: once per encounter ignore DR of single target in LOS for the rest of your turn

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, you can use a swift action to ignore the Damage Reduction of a single target within your line of sight for the rest of your turn.

talents_list.name: Weaken Resolve
talents_list.description: if deal dam over threshold, Persuasion as a free action v. Will, flees one min target can spend Force Point to negate, or if target's level is higher
talents_list.full_text_description: Once per round, when you deal damage equal to or greater than the target's damage threshold, make a Persuasion check as a free action; if the result equals or exceeds the target's Will Defense, you fill the target with terror, causing it to flee from you at top speed for 1 minute. The target can't take standard actions, swift actions, or full-round actions while fleeing, and the target stops fleeing and can act normally if it is wounded. As a free action or reaction, the target can spend a Force Point (if it has not already spent one earlier in the round) to negate the effect. The effect is automatically negated if the target's level is equal to or higher than your character level. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. (SotG) Unlike with other mind-affecting effects, you need only to hail a vehicle to weaken the crew's resolve. When you deal damage that equals or exceeds a vehicle's damage threshold, you may use this talent; in addition, you may ready an action to use this talent after any gunner on your vehicle deals damage that equals or exceeds a vehicle's damage threshold. You make your check against the vehicle's commander; all nonunique crews are assumed to have a Will Defense of 10. The effect is automatically negated if the target vehicle's Challenge Level is greater than your heroic level or your vehicle's Challenge Level.

talents_list.name: Weakening Strike
talents_list.description: if deal dam to opp without Dex to Def can impose -5 to Atk & melee dam instead of down CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever you deal damage to an opponent denied its Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense , you can choose not to move the target down the condition track and instead impose a -5 penalty on all your opponent's attacks and melee damage until the end of your next turn. [[boards consensus indicates -5 to ALL attacks and -5 to melee damage]]

talents_list.name: Wealth
talents_list.description: every level, get credits class level x5000

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Each time you gain a level (including the level at which you select this talent), you receive an amount of credits equal to 5,000 x your class level. You can spend these credits as you see fit. The credits appear in a civilized, accessible location of your choice or in your private bank account.

talents_list.name: Wealth of Allies
talents_list.description: if minion killed, they are replaced by one of same level 24 hours later

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Whenever one of your minions is killed, he or she is replaced by another minion of the same level. This replacement occurs 24 hours later.

talents_list.name: Weapon Shift
talents_list.description: if use ranged weapon as melee weapon +2 melee atk

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: If you use a ranged weapon as a melee weapon (as with the Gun Club talent), you gain a +2 bonus to melee attack rolls with that weapon.

talents_list.name: Weapon Specialization
talents_list.description: +2 dam, single weapon group

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group with which you are proficient. You gain a +2 bonus on damage rolls with such weapons. You may select this talent multiple times. Each time you select this talent, it applies to a different exotic weapon or weapon group. [[It's likely that this does not stack with Weapon Specialization (lightsabers) from the Jedi talents.]] (SotG) If you select heavy weapons as the weapon group these talents apply to, you may use the talents with vehicle weapon attacks.

talents_list.name: Weapon Specialization (discblade)
talents_list.description: +2 melee dam with discblade

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 bonus on melee damage rolls with your discblade.

talents_list.name: Weapon Specialization (lightsabers)
talents_list.description: +2 to melee damage

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: You gain a +2 bonus on melee damage rolls with lightsabers. [[It's likely that this does not stack with Weapon Specialization (lightsabers) from the Soldier talents. ]]

talents_list.name: Weapons Power Surge
talents_list.description: 1/enc increase dam of 1 internal/mounted weapon by 1 or 2 dice in exchange for -1 or -2 CT

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

talents_list.full_text_description: Once per encounter, as a free action, you can increase the damage dealt by one of your weapons by 1 or 2 damage dice in exchange for moving -1 step on the condition track for each die increased. The weapon must be permanently mounted to your chassis, and it must use your internal power supply. Handheld weapons, such as blaster rifles, do not qualify for this talent.

talents_list.name: Whirling Death
